loans.name: Leav

texts.en: Mrs. Leav T., age 40, is a housewife who would like to request this loan to expand her husband’s welding business. Her husband, Eang Sea, age 45, is a welder who needs to purchase additional tools to grow his business. He currently earns $4 per day. They have four children. One is a construction worker and three are students.

loans.use: Leav would like to purchase welding tools to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Mrs. Seam H., age 49, is a housewife who would like to purchase a plot of land to resell for profit. Her husband, age 67, is a construction foreman who earns $5 per day. He also assists her in their land brokerage business. They have four children, one of whom is a construction foreman and the other three are students.

loans.use: Seam would like to purchase a plot of land to resell as a real estate broker.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun R., age 48, is a housewife. Her husband, age 52, sells traditional medicines to earn $3 per day. They have five children, four of whom she shared information about. Two children are employed at a hotel and two of their children are students. She is pictured with one of her daughters in the photo. She would like to request this loan to purchase pigs to raise to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: Mrs. Phun would like to purchase pigs to raise and sell.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Phun Rom start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Nasrallah

texts.en:
Nasrallah lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan, with his own family. He is single but he has the responsibility for his family. His father died during the war in Kabul so he is the only one to help his family.

Nasrallah has a small shop and he started this business one year ago. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, etc. He hopes to attract more customers and make a good income to support his family.

loans.use: To buy extra inventory like boxes of chocolate, bags of sweets

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S. N., age 25, owns a store that makes palm sugar. Her husband climbs the palm trees to collect palm juice for making the sugar. Together they generate $8 per day in revenue. They have no children. She requests this loan in order to purchase additional tools to help produce the sugar and to build an oven for boiling the juice.

loans.use: Seng would like to purchase tools and build an oven to produce palm sugar.

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off the loan a head of time.
She would like to say thank deeply from her heart to all lenders.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok T., age 27, is a grocer who makes $1.20 per day in profit. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who makes $3.60 per day in revenue. They have three young children. She would like to borrow $500 to buy more grocery products to diversify her inventory and purchase a motorbike to replace her old one which is frequently repaired.

loans.use: Sok would like to purchase additional grocery products and a motorbike.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn I., age 55, sells flowers at a market in Phnom Penh to earn $3 per day in revenue. Her husband, age 60, is retired. Of their three children, two work in a garment factory. She would like to request this loan to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: Phorn would like to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Mohammad Nazir

texts.en: Mohammad Nazir lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan, and is married with one daughter. He has a small family and a small business. He has a motor oil shop. He has been in this business for two years and is ready to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra necessity materials for his shop, to complete his stock Mohammad Nazir is an active business man with the ability to repay the loan. He is happy that he can expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Siti Maryam

texts.id:
Siti Maryam's family has been living in Bali for five years. She lives with her husband and two children in a traditional woven-bambo walled, asbestos roofed and dirt floored house. The house is near the river bank, so they can take a bath and do laundry in the river. The house also serves as her business place. Together with her husband, she sells fish chips. Siti does the production and her husband sells the chips around the village. Their daily profit can go as high as 60,000 IDR (1USD~9,000 IDR). With a living cost of 30,000 per day they can still save a little. The loan will be used to increase the working capital. They receive an increase of orders during the month of Ramadan. Hence, the loan she receives this month can help her increase her inventory that eventually turns into additional profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Keluarga Siti Maryam sudah hampir 5 tahun tinggal di Bali. Dia tinggal bersama suami dan dua orang anaknya di rumah kontrakkan. Rumah dengan dinding gedhek, atap asbes dan lantai tanah. Rumahnya dekat dengan sungai. Jadi mereka mandi dan mencuci baju di sungai. Rumahnya sekaligus tempat usahanya. Bersama suaminya dia berusaha jualan krupuk. Bu Siti bagian pembuatan, suaminya bagian pemasaran keliling. Keuntungan per hari mereka dapat mencapai Rp 60.000,00. Dengan biaya hidup Rp 30.000,00 per hari, mereka masih bisa menabung. Pinjaman yang dia dapatkan akan digunakan untuk menambah modal usaha. Mereka akan menerima banyak pesanan pada saat bulan puasa. Artinya, modal yang diterimanya bulan ini akan dapat menambah persediaan krupuk yang akan dijualnya. Hal ini tentunya akan menambah keuntungannya.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, cooking oil and cooking fuel

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem A., age 42, is a housewife in Phnom Penh. She would like to borrow $150 to finance the purchase of a motorbike so her husband (shown in the photo) can become a moto-taxi driver and earn $3 per day in revenue. They have eight children. One child is a garment worker who earns $80 per month,  three children are students, and four have gotten married and moved out of the house. With her husband's new job, the family will increase their income and be better able to pay for their children's education.

loans.use: Yem would like to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate as a driver.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Selestina Ikun

texts.id:
Mrs. Selestina rents her apartment. It has one living room, one bedroom, one bathroom and a very small kitchen. She stores all the rice she picks up from the agent in the living room. Her customers are mostly her neighbors. If they run out of rice, the just order it through Mrs. Selestina. She picks up the rice almost everyday from the agent. She usually picks up 5-6 sacks depending om the order she receives. Some customers pay as you go by cash while others pay once a month. She has been doing the business for one year. Her profit could get as much as 1,500,000 IDR (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR). Considering living cost of 50,000 IDR per day and children's education expense of 100,000 IDR per month they need at least 1,600,000 IDR per month to cover the costs. Her husband's income is 250,000 IDR per month. So there is a little money left to be saved. The loan will be used to add the working capital- since many customers do not pay in advance. The large capital will help her grow the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Selestina menyewa sebuah rumah kos sebagai tempat tinggalnya. Tempatnya mempunyai satu ruang tamu, kamar tidur, kamar mandi dalam dan dapur yang sempit. Di ruang tamu inilah dia menaruh beras yang diambilnya dari Agen. Langganannya hampir semua orang yang tinggal di sekitar kos-kos-annya. Jika mereka kehabisan beras mereka, tinggal memesan ke Bu Selestina. Hampir setiap hari dia mengambil beras di Agen. Dia bisa mengambil 5-6 karung, sesuai dengan pesanan. Ada yang langsung membayar; ada juga yang membayarnya sebulan sekali. Usaha ini telah ditekuninya selama setahun. Keuntungan dari usaha ini mencapai Rp 1.500.000,00 per 2 minggu. Apabila dipertimbangkan dengan biaya hidup per hari meraka yang Rp 50.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak mereka per bulan yang Rp 100.000,00. Maka akan dibutuhkan Rp 1.600.000,00 per bulannya. Penghasilan suaminya Rp 250.000,00 per bulan. Jadi masih uang ada yang bisa ditabung. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya akan dia gunakan sebagai tambahan modal – mengingat pelanggan tidak membayar di muka. Modal yang besar akan membantu dia mengembangkan usaha ini.

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Israyil

texts.en: Israyil lives in  Yenikand village in the Salyan region, with his two children.  He is 54 years old and has been farming  for ten years. He wants to improve his business to provide his family with a better future. He is applying for a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Mr. Khayal is a 30-year-old married man . He is a farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He and his brother (he is pictured) started his business in 1995, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is hard, but interesting, and takes a lot of effort. Khayal buy calves, breeds them, then cuts and sells them to the butcher in the local big market.

However, the salary is not enough to cover all of Khayal’s family expenses. To increase the profit margin from his sales, Khayal needs to invest some money to make his small herd, bigger. This summer he applied for $1,000 to buy four calves. He hopes this will eventually expand his business.

loans.use: To buy animals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Mr. Emin is a low income vulnerable person. He is 32 and married with two children. He lives in the town of Saatli. The town is in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic, in the Caucasus region.

Emin rents a small tea shop and has hired a young man to assist him (he is pictured). His family's expenditures are increasing as his chidren grow older. Emin has trouble with his business income; it is very small compared to all the necessities demanded for his children.

Emin serves his customers very well, but the equipment he has is not enticing to bring in new customers. Emin applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of $500 to invest in his business. He hopes KIVA’s lenders can help him change his life.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Siyavush

texts.ru:
Siyavush was born and lives in the city of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He is 27 years old. He was born in a low-income family. 5 years ago he started his own business. To begin, he rented a two room facility, which he equipped with 5 computers and an Internet connection. He also provided his clients with software and sold parts for computers and cellphones. Naturally, computers become outdated as fast as technological progress marches forward and currently Siyavush is a situation where he has to either update his equipment or lose his clients. The latter would be detrimental to the well being of his family since the income from the business is used to support his parents and five siblings. This is why Siyavush come to the Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro), a Kiva partner, to ask for a loan that will allow him to update the equipment in his Internet club.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volnuteer

Сиявуш родился и живет в г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 27 лет, он выходец из малообеспеченной семьи. 5 лет тому назад он начал своё дело. Для начала он арендовал двух комнатное помещение в центре города, оборудовал его, купил 5 компьютеров, провел в салон интернет. И в то же время он поставлял своим клиентам программное обеспечение и продавал запчасти для компьютеров и мобильных телефонов. Конечно же скорость морального старения компьютерного оборудования прямо пропорциональна скорости развития техники. И сегодня Сиявуш оказался перед дилеммой обновления оборудования или потери клиентуры. Последнее грозит Сиявушу быть роковым, т.к. его заработок обеспечивает необходимым минимумом его родителей и пятерых братьев и сестер. Поэтому Сиявуш обратился к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру KIVA- за предоставлением ему займа чтобы получить возможность переоборудовать свой Интернет клуб.

loans.use: For the renovation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Algadir

texts.ru:
Algadir was born and now lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is forty years old—a man born in a low-income family. Algadir is married and has 2 children. Two years ago, jobless and desperate, he started his own business. Algadir rented a place, bought furniture and tableware and hired a helper (depicted on the photo). The low income of his startup business is not enough to repair the premises. Algadir turned to NorMicro, a KIVA partner, for help with obtaining $500 loan to finance café renovation.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Алгадир родился и живет в г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ему 40 лет, он выходец из малообеспеченной семьи. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Два года тому назад, будучи безработным, нужда заставила его в поисках заработка открыть собственное дело. Он арендовал помещение, купил столы и стулья, посуду и оборудование, нанял работника (изображен на рисунке). Но низкая прибыль не позволяла Алгадиру отремонтировать обветшавшее помещение кафе, и, как следствие, клиенты начали уходить. Чтобы прекратить отток клиентов, Алгадир обратился за получением ссуды в 500 долларов к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру KIVA.

loans.use: Cafe renovation

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Mr. Vusal is a low income vulnerable person. He is 27 and lives with his family in the town of Saatli. The town is in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic, in the Caucasus'.

Vusal rents an internet sega salon in the center of Saatli. The business is quite interesting, but demanding. It requires investments and upgrades from time to time, otherwise Vusal would run the risk of losing his customers. This summer, Vusal applied for a $700 loan from Normicro's Saatli branch to renovate his internet salon. As a result, Vusal will have higher income to support his parents.

loans.use: For renovations

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en: Huseyn is 29 years old and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region  with his wife.  They don't have a child. He has run his own farm for the past 4 years. Huseyn has requested a loan of $1200  to buy pesticides and fertilizer, which he will use to improve the size and quality of his crops.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Goncha

texts.en: Goncha is 46 years old and lives in Yenikand village with her husband and two children. She has run her own farm for the past 7 years.  Goncha has requested a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mirzoumar

texts.ru:
Mirzoumar is young and has everything ahead of him. He is married and has two children. Mirzoumar's sells auto parts. In addition to that however, each year his family buys apricots and dries them. He also purchases already dried fruit and stores it until the price goes up. Mirzoumar manages to make a good profit selling dried fruit. He used his previous loan from MicroInvest to purchase dried fruit. He plans to do the same with the new loan.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мирзоумар молодой парень, в жизни которого все еще впереди. Он женат и у него 2 детей. Мирзоумар занимается бизнесом – продает запасные части для автомобилей. Кроме того каждый год он и его семья покупает абрикосы и сушит их. Также он покупает готовые сухофрукты и хранит их до повышения цены. Продав сухофрукты Мирзоумар получает хорошую прибыль. В этом году получив займ в Микроинвест Мирзоумар закупил сухофрукты. Новый займ он хочет получить также на закупку сухофруктов.

loans.use: For purchase of dried apricot

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: For my family's safety, I need to install some security in my home, as there have been many robberies in the area. I'd also like to place some tiles in one of the rooms. I seek $1200 for both security system and tiles.

loans.use: Security and tiles

loans.name: Oyah

texts.id:
Oyah (60) is a widow who lives with her only daughter and 2 grandchildren. To help her daughter who sells clothes, she started a kiosk that sells snacks, soft drinks and other daily household needs. She earns about $8.5 per day from her kiosk, which is enough to buy food, but insufficient to afford her grand-children's education. Oyah wants to obtain $100 loan to increase her kiosk's offering. She expects $10 additional income. She expects to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Oyah (60) adalah seorang janda yang tinggal bersama 1 anak perempuan dan 2 cucunya, untuk membantu anaknya yang juga berjualan pakaian, dia membuka warung makanan, minuman dan barang-barang rumah tangga lainnya. dalam sehari oyah mendapatkan penghasilan dari warungnya itu $8.5, sudah cukup untuk makan, namun dia juga ingin cucu-cucunya dapat pendidikan yang layak sehingga dia berniat meminjam uang sebesar $100 untuk menambah barang-barang yang ada di warungnya, dengan menghasilannya itu ditambah dengan penghasilan anaknya $ 10 akan membayar pinjamannya dalam waktu 12 bulan.

loans.use: To increase income

loans.name: Rohanah

texts.id:
Rohanah (35) is an active Yamida client. She started trading since 5 year ago. Until now, Rohanah still helps her husband to support the household by selling snacks and soft drinks from a kiosk in front of her home. She earns about $9 per day from the kiosk, quite sufficient to help her husband, Aminudin (37) who works as a contract farmer with $5 daily income. Rohanah also has 1 child to support. Rohanah needs $125 loan to purchase more goods to be sold from her kiosk. The loan will be paid back in 12 months through monthly installments. Rohanah hopes with the loan, her income would increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Rohanah (35) salah satu Client Yamida yang aktif, Dia Mulai berjualan sejak 5 tahun lalu , sampai sekarang Rohanah masih membantu suaminya mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya , Dia berjualan di warung tepat didepan rumahnya untuk berjualan makanan ringan, minuman dan masakan. dari usahanya tersebut Rohanah mendapat penghasilan $ 9 perhari, lumayan cukup untuk membantu suaminya Aminudin (37) yang bekerja sebagai petani dengan pendapatan $ 5 perhari dan dengan tanggungan 1 anak yang masih sekolah. Rohanah memerlukan pinjaman $ 125 untuk tambahan modal membeli barang-barang , makanan dan minuman di warungnya dan akan dibayar selama 12 bulan di angsur setiap bulan. Rohanah berharap dengan mendapatkan pinjaman, usahanya dapat meningkat.

loans.use: To Increase her kiosk's working capital

loans.name: Ma Del Rosario

texts.es:
"I need this loan to finish construction on a room. I would like to install a wood roof to better use the room, since my home is very small. I am requesting a $1000 loan to add a room and a roof"

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito terminar la construcción de un cuarto, me gustaría poner un techo de madera para poder habitarlo ya que mi vivienda es muy reducida” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner un techo de madera a un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a wood roof.

loans.name: Julio Víctor

texts.es:
Sr. Julio is a 46 year old man who lives in a humble home with his loving wife and two small children. We find him to be a man of a strict personality, industrious, but most of all, loving and kind. His characteristic personality has helped form a very responsible, kind, and loving family.

All members of the family work the fields sowing potatoes, gladiolus, broad beans and corn. The income covers the cost of education and essential needs for the well-being of each member of the family, but sometimes unexpected events happen. A short time ago his little girl fell ill with bronchitis and it was necessary to take her to the hospital. The high cost of doctors and medicine provoked an imbalance in the economy of the family, and again this generated a drop in the crop and sale of products. They still haven´t recovered economically and for that reason they require a loan of $175 in order to buy seeds to increase the crop and recover the family´s economic balance. Let's help this family increase their life quality.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Julio es un hombre de 46 años; habita una humilde morada en compañía de sus dos pequeños hijos y su amorosa esposa. En él podemos percibir una personalidad estricta, trabajadora pero sobre todo amorosa y amable, estos aspectos siempre lo han caracterizado y le han ayudado a formar una familia muy responsable, amigable y afectuosa. Todos los miembros de su familia se dedican a sembrar papa, gladiolos, habas y maíz productos de los que obtienen una suma considerable de dinero que destinan a cubrir los gastos de educación y primeras necesidades para bienestar de todos y cada de los miembros de su hogar. A pesar de que aparentemente todo marcha bien en casa los inconvenientes no dejan de presentarse; hace poco su pequeña niña enfermó de bronquios y para su pronta recuperación tuvieron que internarla en un nosocomio de su ciudad; las exigencias médicas y el alto costo de cada una de las medicinas hicieron que la familia tuviera un gran desequilibrio económico que les generó grandes desniveles en los negocios de cultivo y venta de productos. Aún no se recuperan de manera general y tampoco han alcanzado una estabilidad parcial. A raíz de esta razón hace la solicitud de un préstamo por un monto de 175 dólares que destinará a incrementar la siembra de productos a fin de lograr pronto el equilibrio económico familiar. Hagamos que esta familia en corto tiempo incremente su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to increase crops.

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es:
Doña Luz is a diligent and noble mother of three who has bravely moved ahead in spite of the economic difficulties she faces daily having the responsibility of forming three minors and also being responsible for the family economy. Day by day she makes an effort, together with her husband, in the small stand where they sell apples, in order to offer a better way of life to their little ones. With that goal in mind they plan to expand their business by purchasing an additional space in order to make the sale of their delicious apples grow. They need $750 to get started and be able to reach their objective and thus satisfy the needs of their home. Let's contribute to make Luz' dreams come true.

Translated by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora luz es una diligente y noble madre de familia que a pesar de las dificultades económicas con las que tiene que lidiar a diario ha sabido sobrellevarlas valientemente; debido a que la tarea que demanda ser madre de tres menores hijos y pilar de la economía es muy ardua.Por ello día a día junto a su esposo se esmera en su pequeño puesto de ventas de manzanas, con el único propósito de ofrecerles a sus pequeños una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo con esta meta en mente han planeado expandir el campo de acción de su negocio adquiriendo un espacio adicional con el objetivo de acrecentar el flujo de ventas de sus deliciosas manzanas.La solicitud que hace para concretar este deseo en por un monto de 750 dólares con el podrá poner en marcha en poco tiempo su próximo proyecto y podrá satisfacer eficientemente las necesidades de su hogar.Contribuyamos para que los sueños de Luz puedan hacerse realidad.

loans.use: Purchase space  to increase the sale of apples.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen's entrepreneurial and optimistic spirit have helped her and her family overcome many financial difficulties that have arisen in their household. For some time now, she has learned to cope with the arduous responsibility entailed by the education of her three children. With the goal of bettering the quality of her family's life, she started a small business selling wallets and briefcases in which she places all of her efforts. Nonetheless, she still has many limitations to fully develop this activity because of numerous orders she has taken and not been able to fulfill due to lack of capital. For that reason, she hopes to increase her inventory to cover a variety of orders, and rent a space to offer them in a permanent fashion. By expanding her business, she will have greater returns that will allow her to efficiently contribute the unconditional support that she provides her little ones. In order to achieve these goals, she asks for the sum of $275 and extends her commitment to pay back during the course of 6 months. Lets contribute so that Carmen's dreams can become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva volunteer.

El espíritu emprendedor y optimista de Carmen la han ayudado a ella y a su familia a superar muchas dificultades económicas que surgen en casa. Hace tiempo ha aprendido a sobrellevar la ardua responsabilidad que genera la educación de tres hijos.Con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida familiar inició un pequeño negocio de comercialización de carteras y maletines en el que ha puesto y pone todo su esfuerzo; sin embargo aún tiene muchas limitaciones para desarrollar plenamente esta actividad debido a los innumerables pedidos que recepciona y no ha podido cumplir en un 100%por falta de capital; por ello que desea incrementar su inversión para cubrir la variedad de pedidos y alquilar un espacio para ofrecerlos de manera permanente. Al ampliar su negocio podrá obtener mayor rentabilidad y de esta manera contribuirá eficazmente con el apoyo incondicional que le brinda a sus pequeños. Para cumplir este deseo solicita la suma de 275 dólares y les extiende su compromiso de devolución en un lapso de 6 meses. Contribuyamos para que los sueños de Carmen puedan convertirse en una realidad.

loans.use: Increase capital to acquire inventory and rental space in which to sell her products

loans.name: Teodora Marcela

texts.es:
Her diligence and perseverance in life made doña Teodora seek an additional source of income to contribute to the well-being of her family. And after having worked in different activites she established a small grocery store close to her home where she works seven days a week. Having gained experience she wants to expand the stock of products in order to be able to have more variety and sell at a lower price than the competition. This way she can contribute to improve the life standards of her family and above all help to acquire her own dwelling which she longs for.

To get started on the path towards her goal, she needs $500 to increase the products and improve her sales. Let us help her make this dream come true very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Su diligencia y constancia en la vida, hicieron que Teodora buscara una fuente de ingresos adicional, para contribuir con el bienestar integral de su familia, es así que después de mucho tiempo de haberse dedicado a diversas actividades pudo establecer una pequeña bodega en las inmediaciones de su hogar; en el que trabaja incansablemente todos los días de la semana. Después de haber adquirido gran experiencia respecto a esta actividad desea expandir su campo de acción y ampliar la cantidad de productos que oferta en su pequeño establecimiento con el objetivo de empezar a comercializar mayor cantidad de abarrotes a menor precio en comparación a la competencia. De esta manera podrá seguir contribuyendo al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia y sobretodo ayudará a implementar la vivienda propia que tanto anhela. Para iniciar el camino hacia su objetivo solicita la suma de 500 dólares con los que optimizará y mejorará sus servicios. Ayudemos para que este anhelo se haga realidad en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of essential items to increase stock of a small grocery store.

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es:
Mr. P. has had a trying life, but he keeps an optimistic outlook on it. He remains a strong and persevering person, intent on improving his family’s standard of living. He cultivates broad beans in his plot of land, a job that he learnt since childhood. Mr. P. has a lot of experience after so many years of daily work. He has five children, and sometimes his income is not enough to provide for the most elemental needs of the family. So, he wants to increase the productivity in his plot; for this he needs to invest more money to get a larger crop. He also plans to start producing farmhouse cheeses, with the help of his beloved wife. Mr. P. believes he may be able then, to improve their home and live better with his children. He is asking for US$ 675 credit. This amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Your generosity can change their lives.

Traslated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva volunteer.

Don Nemesio, desde siempre tuvo que sobrellevar muchas circunstancias difíciles a lo largo de sus días, a pesar de ello, aún conserva su fuerza, optimismo y constancia con el único propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia a través de la siembra de habas en sus tierras de cultivo. Esta actividad la conoce desde muy pequeño y gracias a la experiencia que ha ido adquiriendo a lo largo de estos años, la realiza con regularidad. Es padre de 5 hijos y a pesar del arduo trabajo que desempeña durante todos los días muchas veces el ingreso que obtiene por la venta de su producción es insuficiente para poder cubrir las necesidades más imprescindibles de su familia, por ello desea ampliar la productividad de sus tierras con mayor inversión para acrecentar la cantidad de productos durante la cosecha con el propósito de iniciar también la producción de quesos artesanales con la importante colaboración de su adorada esposa. Así podrá mejorar las instalaciones de su pequeña morada en el que seguirá compartiendo momentos muy agradables con los suyos..Su solicitud para iniciar este proyecto es por un monto de 675 dólares, esta cantidad lo ayudará a cumplir con sus propósitos pronto. Colaboremos para que esta familia siga cosechando alegrías.

loans.use: Buying more seed to increase the crops in his plot

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es:
Don Gaudencia is an elderly gentleman who still keeps his good spirit and strength to work for improving the quality of life of his family. He has the responsibility of his 4 year old grandson abandoned by his parents, who represents a motivation to continue elaborating cheese together with his loyal and loving wife.

Through his work, this tireless father gave his children the support they needed to move ahead and presently they all carry out the activities they learned due to the education they received from their parents, and today his efforts are focused on covering the esential needs of his grandson and therefore he wishes to expand his activity and optimize the production of his cheeses.

Doing this Don Gaudencio would increase his income and would spend more time with his sacrificing wife and his little one. To achieve this he asks for $350 and his plan is to pay back in 6 months. Together we can fulfill his dreams if we support don Gaudencio.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Don Gaudencio, a pesar de su avanzada edad aún conserva su ánimo y fortaleza para seguir trabajando con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y a visto en la presencia de su nieto de 4 años, a quién abandonaron sus padres, una motivación por la cual continuar sus labores con la producción de quesos que realiza diariamente junto a su leal y querida esposa.

Este incansable padre de familia supo brindarles todo el apoyo, a través de su trabajo, a sus hijos y ahora ellos desempeñan las actividades que aprendieron gracias a la educación que les brindó cuando se encontraban acogidos en el seno de su hogar. Ahora todos y cada uno de sus esfuerzos los enfoca para brindarle lo esencial y necesario a su pequeño nieto y con este objetivo en mente desea ampliar el capital de inversión en su actividad con el propósito de optimizar la producción de sus quesos. De esta manera Gaudencio podrá tener mejores ingresos y compartirá mucho mayor tiempo con su abnegada esposa y el pequeño por el cual lucha.Su solicitud es por la suma de 350 dólares y se compromete a realizar el pago en un lapso de 6 meses.Juntos podremos cristalizar los sueños de Gaudencio, brindémosle pronto nuestro apoyo.

loans.use: To optimize the process of craft production of cheese

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
With the help of her children and her beloved and yet old mother, in her own humble house, Rosalbina has installed a service to handle telephone calls for all the residents of her comunity with the purpose of keeping them close to their beloved ones despite the distance. This clever service came up after watching the needs of communication of the members of the comunity.The demand and the enormous distance they had to cover in order to access this tool for communication were enough reasons to set up a telephone inside her little house providing a friendly and efficient service. Today, Rosalbina wants to expand the customers attention space to provide a better and renewed service to her regular customers. With the purpose of reaching her goals, she asks for a 350 dollars loan to begin cristallizing her desires. Let’s keep this comunity communicated with the important support we can bring to Rosalbina. p>Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Rosalbina, con ayuda de sus hijos y su adorada madre que ya es muy anciana, dentro de su humilde morada, ha instalado el servicio de recepción de llamadas telefónicas para todos los residentes de su comunidad con el objetivo de mantenerlos cerca de sus seres queridos a pesar de la distancia.El ingenioso servicio de recepción surgió a causa de observar la necesidad de comunicación de muchos miembros de su localidad; la demanda y la enorme distancia que tenían que recorrer para hacer uso de esta herramienta comunicativa se convirtieron en motivos suficientes para instalar un teléfono en las instalaciones de su pequeña casa con el fin de prestar sus servicios de manera amigable y eficiente. Hoy Rosalbina quiere ampliar su espacio de atención con el objetivo de brindarles un mejor y renovado servicio a cada uno de sus asiduos clientes.Con el propósito de alcanzar sus metas solicita la suma de 350 dólares para iniciar la cristalización de sus anhelos.Hagamos que esta comunidad siga manteniéndose comunicada con el importante apoyo que le podemos generar a Rosalbina.

loans.use: Seting up the reception area to improve the service.

loans.name: Ni Putu Sorti

texts.id:
Mrs. Putu Sorti has been running a business raising pigs for the past three years. She lives in the village of Berawantangi with her husband Ketut Wanes, and both her children are married and live separately from Putu Sorti. Starting with an investment of only Rp. 700,000, Putu Sorti bought one sow which along with her litter resides in a simple stall. Every four months a litter of between six and twelve piglets is born, and they are ready to sell two months later. Daily necessary expenses for the pigs can be Rp 8,000. When they are two months of age, the piglets can be sold for a total of Rp. 2,400,000, or 200,000 x 12 piglets. From that sale, Putu Sorti earns Rp. 912,000 every six month in profit, after subtracting the pig feed expenses which amount to Rp. 1,488,000 per 6 months. With these profits, Putu Sorti can maintain the necessities of her house, as well as slowly but surely make improvements to her house, which is still in the state of being constructed. The loan in the amount of Rp. 1,300,000 from Dinari will be used for expenses during the next six months, because the cost of pig feed has increased, and become more expensive.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Putu Sorti menjalankan usaha beternak babi sejak tiga tahun yang lalu. Putu Sorti tinggal di desa Berawantangi bersama suaminya Ketut Wanes , sedangkan kedua anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal terpisah dengan Putu Sorti. Dengan modal awal hanya Rp.700.000.- , Putu Sorti membeli satu ekor induk babi penginduk yang ditempatkan pada sebuah kandang yang sangat sederhana. Setiap 4 bulan sekali penginduk ini bisa melahirkan anak 6 sampai 12 ekor dan akan siap dijual setelah 2 bulan kemudian. Sedangkan biaya yang harus dikeluarkan setiap hari untuk pakan babi tesebut sebesar Rp.8.000. Setelah berumur 2 bulan setelah lahir maka anak babi tersebut bisa dijual seharga Rp.2.400.000, @200.000 x 12 ekor. Dari penjualan tersebut Putu Sorti mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp.912.000/ 6 bulan setelah dikurangi biaya pakan sebesar Rp.1.488.000 selama 6 bulan .Dengan diperolehnya keuntungan ini maka Putu Sorti bisa mencukupi keperluan rumah tangganya,disamping itu juga sedikit demi sedikit sudah bisa memperbaiki rumahnya walaupun masih dalam tingkat semi permanen. Sedangkan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dari Dinari akan dipakai untuk biaya pakan selama 6 bulan kedepan karena sekarang biaya untuk pakan ternak itu terus meningkat / mahal harganya.

loans.use: Purchase livestock feed - Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, 57 years old, mother of 5 children, lives in Baalback, in the east of Lebanon, and sells clothes at the "local open-air market". Mona has borrowed 7 consecutive loans from Al Majmoua and has an excellent history of on-time repayment.

Most of the time, Mona has been borrowing to increase her business inventory and to help her children financially. Indeed, Mona is the main family breadwinner and through her business profits she was able to pay for her daughters' and sons' weddings and to purchase home furniture and appliances on their behalf.

Mona needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to buy some inventory for her business and buy furniture for her youngest son who will get married soon.

loans.use: Buy clothes inventory for her business and furniture for her son's house

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tantri

texts.id:
Mrs Ni Ketut Tantri is a very able and diligent housewife and she has proved she can aid the household economy by opening a pig breeding and livestock business three years ago. Ketut Tantri's husband is only a farmer who does not have enough income, because the land he works is not large. From this marriage Ketut Tantri has two children but they are already married and live apart from Ketut Tantri. With starting capital of Rp. 1,600,000, Ketut Tantri bought two sows. One of them now has twelve children. Two months after birth those piglets can be sold, and usually one piglet sells for Rp 200,000, but the plan is for five of these to be fattened up, leaving seven to be sold. The income from the sale will be Rp.1,400,000 (@200,000 x &), of which Rp. 500,000 will be profit, which Ketut Tantri will use to improve her house although it is still very basic (semi-permanent). Of the loan received from Dinari the plan is to use Rp.1,300,000 to buy feed because Ketut Tantri is now expanding her business to raise and fatten-up five piglets, in addition to the two sows, with the goal of increasing the profits.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Ni Ketut Tantri seorang ibu rumah tangga yang sangat ulet dan tekun terbukti untuk membantu perekonomian rumah tangganya Ketut Tantri menjalankan usaha memelihara ternak babi sejak 3 tahun yang lalu. Suami Ketut Tantri hanya sebagai seorang petani yang tidak mempunyai penghasilan cukup,karena ladang yang dikerjakannyapun tidak banyak,dari pernikahannya ini Ketut Tantri mempuyai 2 orang anak namun keduanya kini sudah menikah dan tinggal terpisah dengan Ketut Tantri.Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.600.000 Ketut Tantri membeli 2 ekor babi penginduk. Dan salah satunya sekarang sudah mempunyai anak 12 ekor ,Setelah 2 bulan sejak lahir maka anak babi ini sudah bisa dijual ,Biasanya 1 ekor dijual seharga Rp.200.000,tetapi rencananya anak babi ini akan dipelihara sebagai babi penggemukan,sebanyak 5 ekor dan sisanya 7 ekor baru dijual. Dari hasil penjualan sebesar Rp.1.400.000 (@200.000 x 7) maka diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.500.000 , dari keuntungan inilah Ketut Tantri bisa memperbaiki rumahnya walaupun masih sangat sederhana (semipermanen) . Untuk pinjaman yang diperoleh dari dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 rencananya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak karena KetutTantri sekarang menambah usahanya dengan memelihara 5 ekor penggemukan disamping 2 ekor penginduk tadi,dengan harapan keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih meningkat.

loans.use: Buy livestock feed - Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en: Mr. Yusif is a low income vulnerable person. He is 55, married with three children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Yusif owns a small herd of dairy cows. He sells milk in the Saatli bazaar, while his son (he is pictured) grazes the herd. His family expenses are increasing as his children are growing up. Yusif plans to increase the number of cows to make his income higher. But this project requires investment. This summer, Yusif applied for $500 frpm the Normicro Saatli branch. He hopes this credit will let him improve his family life.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Ketut Santi

texts.id:
Mrs. Ni Ketut Santi lives in a village in Berawantangi-Tukadaya. The state of the economy is increasingly difficult and her three children are in great need of school fees, while the income of her farmer husband is not enough, and because daily expenses require Rp. 20,000 each day, Ketut Sani started thinking about opening a pig breeding business. With beginning capital of Rp.800,000 Ketut Sani bought one female piglet. Every four months, this one sow has a litter of between five and ten piglets. These are ready to be sold after they are two months old. From the Rp.2,000,000 (@200,000 x 10) income of this sale, Ketut Santi earns a profit of Rp.850,000 every six months, after subtracting the cost of six months feed (Rp.1,150,000). From these earnings, Ketut Santi can pay for her children's school fees, as well as invest in improvements in her house which is still in a semi-permanent state. The loan from Dinari in the amount of Rp.1,300,000 will be used to purchase one baby female pig, and another pig for fattening-up, with the hope that in the future the income will increase, allowing for an increase in the prosperity of the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Ni Ketut Santi tinggal disebuah desa di Berawantangi –Tukadaya,karena keadaan ekonomi yang semakin sulit dan ketiga anaknnya kini sangat membutuhkan biaya untuk sekolah,sedangkan penghasilan suami sebagai seorang petani tidak mencukupi,sedangkan biaya yang harus dikeluarkan setiap hari sebesar Rp.20.000 ,maka Ketut Santi mulai melirik usaha memelihara ternak babi sejak 4 tahun yang lalu.Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.800.000 Ketut Santi membeli 1 ekor babi penginduk. Setiap 4 bulan sekali maka penginduk ini akan melahirkan anak 5 sampai 10 ekor.Dan akan siap dijual setelah 2 bulan sejak lahir. Dari hasil penjualan sebesar Rp.2.000.000 (@200.000 x 10) Ketut Santi mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 850.000 per 6 bulan sekali,setelah dikurangi biaya pakan sebesar Rp.1.150.000 selama enam bulan.Dari keuntungan tersebut Ketut Santi bisa membiaya anak-anaknya sekolah juga memperbaiki rumahnya hingga dalam taraf semipermanen seperti sekarang ini. Sedangkan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dipergunakan untuk membeli 1 bibit penginduk dan satu lagi bibit untuk penggemukan, diharapkan nantinya hasil yang diperoleh lebih meningkat lagi ,sehingga dapat pula meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarga.

loans.use: Purchase a baby female pig and another piglet -- Membeli induk babi dan bibit babi

loans.name: Ni Putu Yasi

texts.id:
The lives of three children who now sit on a school bench represent an important matter for Ni Putu Yasi, especially as her husband is only a farmer without expansive fields, which inevitably means low earnings. The house in which she lives is very simple and still in a semi-permanent state, although they own it free and clear. For everyday expenses Putu Yasi needs Rp.20,000. In order to get on top of these issues, Putu Yasi diligently began a pig breeding business three years ago. With starting capital of only Rp.800,000, Putu Yasi bought one sow. Every four months the sow gives birth to a litter of between five and eleven piglets, and after the piglets are two months old they are ready to be sold. One piglets sells for Rp.200,000, so the earnings of the sale can reach Rp.2,200,000 (@200,000 x 11). From that sale, profits can be up to Rp.700,000 every six months, after subtracting for the feed (Rp.1,500,000 every six months). These profits are used by Putu Yasi to pay her children's school fees as well as to add to her house. Putu Yasi is very pleased with the loan from Dinari, because with it, she can add to her business. Now Putu Yasi has begun to fatten up two pigs, and the loan of Rp.1,300,000 will be used to puchase pig feed with the hope that the profits will be good and Putu Yasi's children can attend school through a higher grade level.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Menghidupi 3 orang anak yang kini sudah duduk dibangku sekolah merupakan hal yang berat bagi Ni Putu Yasi, apalagi suaminya hanyalah seorang petani yang ladangnya tidak begitu luas,otomatis penghasilannya pun tidak banyak.Rumah yang ditempatipun sangat sederhana dan masih dalam tingkat semipermanen,tetapi sudah menjadi milik sendiri. Sedang untuk keperluan sehari-hari Putu Yasi harus mengeluarkan uang sebesar Rp.20.000. Supaya masalah ini bisa diatasi maka sejak 3 tahun yang lalu Putu Yasi mulai menekuni usaha berternak babi.Modal awal hanya Rp.800.000,Putu Yasi membeli 1 ekor penginduk. Setiap 4 bulan sekali babi penginduk ini melahirkan anak bisanya 5 sampai 11ekor,dan selang 2 bulan kemudian anak-anak babi ini sudah bisa dijual.Satu ekor dijual seharga Rp. 200.000 ,jadi hasil penjulan semuanya sebesar Rp.2.200.000 ( @ 200.000 x 11 ). Dari penjualan ini keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.700.000 per 6 bulan ,setelah dikurangi biaya pakan sebesar Rp.1.500.000 selama 6 bulan.Keuntungan ini dipakai oleh Putu Yasi untuk biaya sekolah anak-anaknya juga untuk mencukupi keperluan rumah tangga. Putu Yasi sangat senang dengan adanya pinjaman dari Dinari,karena dengan adanya pinjaman ini Putu Yasi dapat mengembangkan usahanya karena sekarang Putu Yasi mulai memelihara babi penggemukan 2 ekor,dan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternak dengan harapan keuntungan yang didapat lebih banyak dan anak-anak Putu Yasi bisa sekolah ketingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: Purchase feed -- Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en: Ms Sevinj is a low income, vulnerable woman. She is 32, married with three children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. She and her husband (he is pictured) run a family business, managing a tea-shop. To develop their business Sevinj needs investment, but she cannot get a loan through a  commercial bank. But her application for $300 loan was approved in Normicro Saatli branch. She plans to use the credit to renovate the tea-shop and increase the quantity and quality of her inventory.

loans.use: For the renovation of her tea-shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mirjamal

texts.en: Mr. Mirjamal is a low income vulnerable person. He is 49, married with five children, and lives in Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in  the Caucasus region. 20 years ago he started his butchery business and has run it very successfully since then.  His children are growing up and Mirjamal can hardly meet his family’s food and important consumption needs. He has to buy more animals to sell more beef and earn more money. Therefore, he finally applied for  a $500 loan with the Normicro Saatli branch. Now he is waiting for funding so that he can make some improvements to his business.

loans.use: To expand the volume of business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Fahim

texts.en:
Fahim lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated. He was in Iran for about 6 years but he came back last year and started a business. He opened a small retail shop in the main bazaar of Kabul.

Now Fahim wants to enlarge his shop so he is requesting an individual loan to expand his inventory by buying sweets, crisps, bags of candies, milk, mineral water, etc. Fahim is looking forward to receiving this loan which will allow him to expand his business and make a good income to support his family.

loans.use: expand the inventory of his little store

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en: Mr. Sabuhi is  a low income, vulnerable man. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli city in the central part of Azerbaijan Republic. Sabuhi has a herd of five cows. He started his business five years ago when he bought his first cow with money he had saved up. He purchases young calfs, breeds them and then sells them in the city market. The business is profitable, but requires investment from time to time. Sabuhi plans to increase the number of animals in the herd and his application has been approved in Normicro Saatli branch for $500. He hopes he can successfully collaborate with this micro credit organization and with KIVA.

loans.use: To buy animals

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Mr. Murad is a low man which makes him vulnerable. He is 25 and lives with parents in the village of Saatli city in the central part of the Azerbaijan Republic. Murad started his business five years ago with one cow, and now he has increased the number of animals in the herd up to five.  He applied to Norwegian Microcredit LLC, (Normicro Saatli branch) to obtain a $500 loan to build an open shed for his cattle.

loans.use: To buy animals and build a shed for his cattle

loans.name: Fath Mohammad

texts.en:
Fath M. lives in District 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 4 children, two daughters and two sons. He is a shopkeeper and he has good experience in his work. He has been in this business for more than 8 years.

Fath M. wants to expand his business so he is requesting an individual loan to expand his inventory to make a good income. He hopes to make it possible for his children to have a better education in future. He will be very happy to receive the loan.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Rahmatllah

texts.en:
Rahmatllah lives in District 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and lives with his own family. He has still not completed his education; he is in university.

Rahmatllah has a cosmetics shop where he works part time. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy goods such as creams, shampoos, powders, and extra equipment for the younger generation. He hopes to attract more customers and make a good monthly income to make a better future for himself and also for his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of his shop

loans.name: Vugar Alimshad

texts.en: Vugar is 36 years old, married and has one child. For the last three years, he has owned and operated an orchard in Khaladj village in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve the size and quality of the produce he grows on his orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: 48-year-old Elshan lives in the Salyan region, Girkhchirak settlement . He is married and has two children. Elshan has been breeding calves for the past 7 years.. He supports his family with this business. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy  baling presses and cotton-seed.

loans.use: To buy cotton-seed and baling presses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar S. is  a 36-year-old woman, is married and has three children. She has her own orchard in Hasanli village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for four years. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides to improve her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fuzuli

texts.en: Fuzuli G. is 41 and lives in the Gardili village in the Salyan region. He is married and has five children. He has raised cattle for four years, and now he would like to buy pasture land. To do this, he requests a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To buy pasture land

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mayil

texts.en: Mayil is 51 years old and lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has four children. Mayil has been in this business for 10 years. Now he requests a loan of $1200  to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy plot of land

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Asmakhanim

texts.en: This 47-year-old woman has her  own orchard. She is a mother of three children and lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. She has 10 years experience in this business. Asmakhanim is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy plot of land.

loans.use: to buy plot of land

loans.name: Yath

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Yath learned to weave silk from her sister in 1997, and started producing silk in 2002 after she got married. Her husband is a farmer who plants vegetables and raises cows.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is asking for a loan of $400. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms, and for setting up 2 more looms for her sisters, who are living with her.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, and paying the fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms, and setting up 2 more 
looms.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Yath Chhun paid off her loan already. Thank you.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chhon is a widow with 3 children, 1 son and 2 daughters. Her daughter taught her to weave silk. Since 2004, she and her daughters have been weaving silk at home, and they each have a loom.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times before. Now she is asking for a loan of $500 to expand her silk production. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, paying fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Irada

texts.en: Irada is 35 years old and lives in Khaladj village  in the Salyan region with her husband and fthree children. She has run her own farm for the past 4 years.  Irada has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Ravy learned to weave from her mother in1982 and then started weaving silk at home. One of her daughters also weaves silk at home with her. Her husband has been a potato farmer since 2004. They married in 1983, and have 5 children, 3 sons and 2 daughters.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times before. Now she is asking for a loan of $300 to expand her silk production. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. She would also like to buy more potato seeds for her husband's farm.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sambo has a home business selling Chinese noodles, coffee, and beer since 2006. She has continued the family business. Her husband also assists her selling their products. Mrs. C. Sambo was married in 1983 and has 2 sons and 3 daughters.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase more beer and coffee to sell to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more beer and coffee to sell to expand the business.

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Dy was married in 1997 and has 1 son. She started her grocery store at home in 2005. Her business is doing well. People in the village can buy many groceries at her store, so they don't have to go to the market. Her husband is a security bodyguard in Phnom Penh.

This is Mrs Dy's first request for a loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more groceries. She wants to increase the inventory for the store so that the neighbors can afford the food and other things for their daily needs, and avoid spending a lot of time traveling to the market. She will not have any problem paying back the loan because she and her husband have good incomes.

loans.use: Purchasing grocery items in increase the inventory in the store.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mr. S. Him has had a fish business since 1979. He started fishing by learning from the older members of his family. In addition, he raises cows in his village. His wife helps him sell fish in the market; sometimes she sells the fish wholesale to the middle man. Mr S.'s oldest son helps him look after the cows. Mr. S. was married in 1980 and has 5 sons.

This is Mr S.'s first request for a loan from MAXIMA, and he is requesting $500. He will use this loan to purchase fishing net to expand his existing business, and to repair his fishing boat.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net to expand his existing business and repair the fishing boat.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Qasimov Rashad was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict region Gubadli, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city. He is 24 years old and he is single. His parents are old. Therefore he is the only breadwinner of his family. He started his business in 2001. He sells perfumes, creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, etc. His friend helps him with this work. With this business he earns a little money. This money id enough for only some of his family's basic needs. He has difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for food, medication, clothes, etc. 

His best clients are young ladies who work in offices. He needs $1000 to buy silver goods and merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and be able to offer his clients a bigger variety and quality. He is able to support his family’s expenses with this bigger income. He will repay the loan within 14 months.

loans.use: to buy silver goods and merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Run was married in 1985 and has 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. Since 2000, she has had a wholesale business selling firewood. She started this business with her husband's support. Her husband also helps her in the firewood business. He drives to the places to purchase the firewood from other villagers in the commune and other people.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA 3 times before now. She requests a loan of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase more firewood, so she can expand her business. She expects to have good sales during the upcoming flooding season.

loans.use: Purchase more firewood to sell to expand the business.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sivorn was married in 1983 and has 6 children, 3 sons and 3 daughters. After she learned how to weave scarves from her neighbor, Mrs. N. started her own business weaving scarves in 2005.

She uses a semiautomatic machine at home. She currently owns one machine and now she plans to purchase another semiautomatic machine so she can increase her production of scarves. Her husband is a government official in the Ministry of Post and Telecommunication.

This is Mrs. N.'s first request for a loan from MAXIMA. She is asking for $1,000 to purchase sewing materials and another semiautomatic machine so she can expand her scarf production.

loans.use: Purchase a semiautomatic machine to weave scarves, and sewing materials.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sophorn started her business selling grocery items from her house in 1980. She also sells many kinds of fruit at her store. She was married in 1970 and has one daughter, who assists her in the business. Her husband is a farmer and plants vegetables in the village.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. She now requests a loan for $700. She will use this money to purchase more groceries and more fruit to sell at her store so she can expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase groceries and fruit to sell at grocery store

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Yoeurn started her business weaving silk in 1969, after her neighbor taught her how to weave. However, she stopped weaving during the Khmer Rouge regime from 1975-1979, and she began weaving again in mid 1979. She also rolls cigarettes to sell at home.

Mrs. P. was married in 1972, and has 7 children, 4 sons and 3 daughters. Of the 6 children whom she supports at home, some are students, and some are working. Her husband is a fisherman.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice before. Now she is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. She also wants to use some of the money to purchase fishing nets for her husband.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
F. Arifa was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Gubadli region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasuses. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children. Right now, she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2002. She sells creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, etc. Her daughter helps her at this work. 

In 2004 Arifa borrowed $500 from Normicro, to buy perfume goods and to expand her business. With this business she earned little money. Her income was enough for only some of her family's basic needs, but she had difficulty in covering other family needs like medication, clothes, and school fees.

Next, she borrowed $700 to buy more merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and to be able to offer her clients a bigger variety and quality of goods. Now she needs $1000 for expanding her business even more and improving her family living conditions.  She wants increase the number of clients and increase her income considerably. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Expanding her business and improving her family living conditions.

loans.name: Tharch

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Tharch has run a battery charging station since 2005. Her husband, Mr. Veth Savath, also helps her run her charging-battery business at home.

Mrs. N. was married in 1984, and has 3 children. All of her children live at home, but they work at other jobs.

She has had loans from MAXIMA twice before. Now she is requesting a loan of $1,100. She will use the money to purchase another new generator and other tools for expanding the battery-charging station.

loans.use: Purchase a new generator and other tools for battery-charging station.

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Thary learned to weave from her mother in 1985, and has been weaving silk since then. Her husband is a farmer, who grows vegetables and rice. However, he also assisting her in weaving silk when he is free from his farming activities. He learned to weave from his wife. They were married in 1988 and have 6 children, 4 sons and 2 daughters.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now she is asking for a loan of $400. She will use $200 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. She will use the other $200 to supplement the money she has saved, so she can buy a small generator.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for preparing the loom; and purchase a generator.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Mr. P. Ruos was married in 1979 and has 5 children, 4 sons and 1 daughter. He started his horse cart business in1979. With his horse cart service, he helps the people in the community transport goods, and bricks and rocks from one village to another.

His wife has been weaving silk at home since 1979, after she learned to weave from her mother.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times. Now he is requesting a loan of $200. He will use this money to purchase a new horse cart because the current one is too old and is easily damaged.

loans.use: New horse cart for transportation service

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sophy learned to weave from her neighbor in 1980, and then she worked as a weaver for her neighbor. After Mrs. N. got married in 1983, she started her own business weaving silk. She currently owns three looms: one for herself and the other two for her daughters.

Her husband plows land for villagers. They have eight children, 4 sons and 4 daughters.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times already. Now she is asking for a loan of $400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on her looms.

loans.use: Purchase silk supplies, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Mr. L. Hok has run the battery charging station since 1984. He was married in 1992, and has 5 children, 2 sons and 3 daughters. His wife stays at home to look after their children. All of their children are studying at the local school.

This is Mr. L.'s first request for a loan from MAXIMA. He requests a loan of $600 to purchase more electric tools so he can expand his battery-charging station.

loans.use: Purchase more electric tools for battery-charging station.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chuon learned to weave from her neighbor in 1987, and then she started her own business weaving silk at home.

Her husband is a director of the primary school in the community. He also plants vegetables in the village in his free time. They were married in 1978 and have 4 children, 3 sons and 1 daughter.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she requests a loan of $700. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on her loom. She will use some of the money to buy pesticide fertilizer for her husband's farm.

loans.use: Purchase silk supplies, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Valin

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Valin is a widow with 4 children, 2 sons and 2 daughters. She learned to sew clothes from the trainer in the village, and then she started to sew for the villagers, going from one village to another. Her sewing improved every day.

Then in 1992, she began her business in sewing clothes at home. She has expanded her sewing business by buying more sewing machines and employing the young ladies in her village. Her youngest daughter also sews clothes at home.

This is Mrs. Y.'s first application for a loan from MAXIMA. She requests a loan of $1,000 to buy one more sewing machine for her employee.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine for her employee.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Sopheap has been married since 1999, and does not yet have any children. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1997, and soon afterwards started her own silk weaving business. Mrs. T.'s husband is a carver. He carves many kinds of wooden items to sell in the local market as well as in the market in Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. T. has borrowed money from MAXIMA already four times, and is now asking for a loan of US$800. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on her loom. In addition, she plans to buy more wood for her husband's carving business.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, and wood for carving

payments.comment: Thank you verry much to all lenders.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Vantha has been married since 1997 and has 2 children - a son and a daughter. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1990, and started her own silk weaving business that same year. In addition, Mrs. S. also plants vegetables on her land in the village. Her husband is a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh city. 

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She is asking for US$1,000 to be able to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and a motorbike for use in the family.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and a motorbike

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. B. Vuthy has been married since 1990 and has a daughter. He was a wooden-house construction worker before he got married. In1995, he started his own wooden-house construction business. Mr. B. makes contracts with villagers to repair and build wooden houses. In addition, he also grows rice and catches fish, while his wife is a garment factory worker.   

Mr. B. is asking for a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. He will use the US$200 to purchase zinc and pillar to repair his house.

loans.use: Purchase of  zinc and pillar for house repair

loans.name: Nouv

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Nouv has been married since 1976 and has 7 children: 2 sons and 5 daughters. Since 1979, she and her husband have been earning living growing rice and planting vegetables.

Mrs. M. has borrowed from MAXIMA already twice. Now she is asking for a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase cows for her farm.

loans.use: Purchase of cows for farming

loans.name: Gandab

texts.en: Gandab is a 57 year old widow with four children. She lives in the Hasanli village in  Salyan region of Azerbaijan, where she has owned and operated a vineyard for the last twenty years. Gandab has applied for a loan of $475 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Chantha has been married since 1978 and has 5 children: 2 sons and 3 daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1971 and was soon afterwards employed to weave for the village. She started her own home-based silk-weaving business in 1981. Now her 3 daughters weave silk at home as well. Mrs. T.'s husband is a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh city. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. Mrs. T. will use the US$500 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk for her daughters' weaving looms.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk for the looms

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Chantha THOU paid off her loan early before contract. Now she is requesting a new loan.

Thank You.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Phally has been married since 1987 and has 4 children - 2 sons and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1984, and started her silk-weaving business that same year. Her eldest daughter currently works in the make-up business.  

Mrs. T. has borrowed from MAXIMA already three times. This time she is requesting a loan of US$500 which will be used to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk for looms.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk for looms

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Phon is a widow with 3 children - a son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her elder relatives in 1967, and started her weaving business that same year. During the Khmer Rough regime she temporarily stopped weaving and continued only in 1979. Mrs. C. also trained her eldest daughter in the silk-weaving art, who has been assisting her in the business since 2002. Mrs. C. currently owns 2 looms - one for herself and another one for her daughter.    

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use the US$600 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk for her and her daughter's loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk for looms

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Sarorn has been married since 1987 and has 5 children: 4 sons and a daughter. She learned to weave from her mother in 1980, and started her silk production business that same year. Her husband is a construction contractor - he has been in the house-construction business since 1987. With their combined income, Mrs. K. and her husband can afford to send all of their children to school.  

Mrs. K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA already twice, and is now asking for a loan of US$200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Srey Nein

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Srey Nein has been married since 1991 and has 2 children. She learned to weave from her aunt in 1995, and started her own silk-weaving business that same year. Her husband is a policeman in the Prek Ampil commune.     

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of US$1,000. It is the first time she is borrowing from MAXIMA. Of the US$1,000, she will use US$300 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, while the remaining US$700 will be spent on repairing her house.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom

payments.comment: This loan has been completely repaid ahead of schedule.  Srey Nein hopes to borrow again in the future to continue expanding her business.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Lorn has been married since 1995 and has 3 children - a son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1983, and started her own silk-production business that same year. Her husband is a construction contractor, and has been in the house-construction business since 2000. 

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. Of the US$700, she will use US$300 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, while the remaining US$400 will be used to buy construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: Purchase of 1) silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, 2) construction materials

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. R. Say has been married since 1994 and has 2 children: a son and a daughter. She started a pig-raising business in 2003. In addition, she also produces white alcohol at home. Her husband is a farmer - he grows rice on a field in the village. 

Mrs. R. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use the US$400 to purchase food for her pigs.

loans.use: Purchase of foo for pigs

loans.name: Shamil

texts.en: Shamil A., a 34-year-old man, is married and has two  children. He has his own orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for eight years. Now he requests a loan of $725 to buy pesticides to improve his orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Thul

texts.en:
Mrs. B. Thul has been married since 1967 and has 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. She has been in the banana-growing business since 1979. Her husband assists her in looking after the banana farm. In addition, he also earns money fishing. Mrs. B. would like to buy a motor bike for her husband which he could operate as a motor-taxi in the village, thereby making extra income for the family.   

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA already three times. Mrs. B. is now requesting a loan of US$800 which will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. U. Sokhom has been married since 1985 and has 3 daughters. She has been doing farming since 2000. She plants different kinds of vegetables and flowers and sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists her in planting vegetables and flowers.

Mrs. U. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use the US$300 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable farm.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable farming

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sim has been married since 1998 and has 3 children: a son and 2 daughters. She learned to weave from her mother in 1990, and started her own silk production business that same year. Her husband has also been weaving silk at home ever since 1998 when he learned the skill from his wife. 

Mrs. S. has borrowed money from MAXIMA already three times, and is now requesting a loan of US$400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom
