loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. E. Channa has been married since1988 and has 4 children: 3 son and a daughter. She learned to weave from her mother in 1993, and started her own silk production business that same year. Her husband has also been weaving silk since 1995 when he was trained in this art by his wife. In addition, he is also a construction contractor in the village, while Mrs. E.'s entire family has been earning money planting food crops and raising cows in the village.    

Mrs. E. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time. She will use the US$500 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en: Mr. Alasgar is a low income person which makes him vulnerable. He is 41, married with two children, and lives in Sumgayit city in the north-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Alasgar has owned and operated a small food market in the local bazaar of Sumgayit town for the past five years. The business is stable because Alasgar has collected many customers during time he runs this shop. But he would like to make an investment in his business to diversify the assortment of goods, increase their turnover, and therefore increase his income so he can provide all the necessities of life for his children. Some commercial banks demand collateral to give to Alasgar credit, but Alasgar has nothing to mortgage; that's why he applied to Normicro Sumqayit, which disburses credit free of collateral for his $800 loan. This credit could let him to buy and sell a larger amount of goods and to develop his business.

loans.use: To sell a larger amount of goods and to develop his business

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en: Vusala I.  is a single woman who lives in Gardili village, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. She is 24 years old and has 3 years of experience in this business.  She would like a loan of $725 to buy pesticides and fertilizer  to develop her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her orchard

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. She would like a loan of $725 to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: C. Elshan was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict region Gubadli, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He is 40 years old and the father of three children. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He is homeless and staying in a worker’s  hostel in Sumgayit city. Elshan opened his business in 1997. He started selling a small variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family’s food and important consumption needs. Now, he wants to borrow $800  to open a big vegetable section at his counter and he thinks this could improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To add a vegtables section to his counter

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Haydee Octavia

texts.es:
Doña Haydee is the lovely mother of four childern and a devoted wife. For a long time she's been doing different activitys with the purpose of raising her family’s standard of living because her husband works occasionally in construction but the money he earns is not enough to satisfy the family needs. Under this need, she started knitting some colorfull T-shirts. In the meantime, she realized there was a number of activitys she could dedicate herself like pumping water for her comunity or selling wood for cooking. This last activity is the one that requires more attention from Haydee and the one that is payed the better. Her older children, seeing how much attention it required from her beloved mother, decided to become her best allieds with the purpose of changing the airs of this hard task and making it more enjoyable for all of them. They also seek their personal growth and they want to keep going, working hard and see this project rise to accomplish their own dreams. Haydee asks for a 350 dollars loan to increase the investments of her little family company with the desire of following the dreams of her two more important and unconditional partners. With your unselfish collaboration you’ll be abble to make this dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Haydee, es una amorosa madre de 4 hijos y una dedicada esposa. Desde hace tiempo a desempeñado diversas actividades con el propósito de contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia; debido a que el dinero que aporta ocasionalmente, por los trabajos de albañilería que realiza su esposo eran insuficientes y no satisfacían por completo las necesidades de su hogar.Bajo esta necesidad empezó a trabajar tejiendo coloridas chompas, pero en el transcurso de su labor observó que había muchas actividades a las que también podría dedicarse y es así que empezó a bombear el agua en su comunidad y también a vender leña para la cocción de alimentos. Esta última actividad es la que requiere el mayor de sus esfuerzos y del cuál obtiene una importante suma de ganancias; sus hijos mayores al ver el inmenso trabajo que le demandaba el desarrollo de esta actividad a su querida madre decidieron convertirse en sus mejores aliados con la finalidad de hacer que la dura labor cobre un aire distinto y pueda ser disfrutado por todos.Ellos también tienen sueños de superación personal y sólo esperan seguir adelante y poner mucho más empeño para que esta ocupación crezca y se consolide con el propósito de empezar ha trabajar para cristalizar sus propios sueños.Haydee solicita la suma de 350 dólares para incrementar el capital de inversión de su pequeña micro empresa familiar con el anhelo de consolidarlo y contribuir con la persecución de los sueños de sus dos grandes e incondicionales socios.Con tu desinteresada colaboración podrás convertir estos anhelos en un hecho real.

loans.use:
Increase the investment to consolidate the family micro-company
Incremento de capital para consolidar la pequeña micro empresa familiar.

loans.name: Salvadora Natividad

texts.es:
Salvadora Natividad R. S. is from Bluefields. She is 44 years old and is the single mother of three children, who are 14, 8, and 6 years old. She has 18 years of experience in making gold and silver into rings, earrings, bracelets, and chains. With this job, she has been able to pay her children’s school fees. Her customers are parents of students in the city of Bluefields who prefer her because of her accessible prices. She buys each gram of gold for $8.00, $1.00 per gram of silver, $3.00 per metallic paste, and $5.00 per dozen stones to decorate the rings.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Salvadora Natividad R. S. es originaria de Bluefields tiene 44 años y es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 14,8 y 6 años.Tiene 18 años de experiencia en la transformación del oro y la plata en anillos, aretes, pulseras y cadenas con este trabajo a podido costear los estudios de sus tres hijos. Sus clientes son padres de familia de esta ciudad de Bluefields que la prefieren porque tiene precios accesibles. Ella compra cada gramo de oro a 8 dólares,cada gramo de plata a 1 dólar, la libra de acido a 4 dólares, cada pasta metalica a 3 dólares, la docena de piedras para decorar los anillos a 5 dólares.

loans.use: She will buy 31 grams of gold, 30 grams of silver, 1 metalic paste, 2 pounds of acid, and 3½ dozen stones for graduation rings.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
The wish to move ahead is an important reason for doña Antolina to have started the breeding of small animals, in spite of having many obligations at home taking care of her children and husband.

This activity has allowed her to obtain an extra income and contribute to the welfare of her family as it does not demand much time away from home and she can still take care of her chores and family. Her previous job away from home caused family conflicts, but now she is very happy and satisfied with her new occupation.

The breeding of pigs and sheep has become an important part of the family income and therefore she wishes to increase the number of animals with the purpose of improving the quality of life of her young children, who are all of school age. She asks for $100 to purchase a pig. Let us help Antolina so she can have more animals and that way ensure the future of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Los deseos de salir adelante se han convertido en una importante razón de existencia para Antolina, que a pesar de tener muchas obligaciones en casa, con el cuidado de sus hijos y esposo a podido iniciar la crianza de animales pequeños. Esta actividad le ayuda a obtener ingresos interesantes para contribuir con el bienestar de su familia y debido a que su desempeño no le demanda mucho tiempo ha continuado con el diligente cuidado de su hogar; debido a que su labor anterior fuera de casa ocasionó muchos conflictos familiares ahora está muy contenta y satisfecha con su nueva ocupación. La crianza de cerditos y ovejitas se ha convertido en una importante fuente de ingresos y por esta razón desea aumentar el número de sus animalitos con el propósito de seguir incrementando la calidad de vida de sus pequeños hijos que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar. Solicita la suma de 100 dólares para adquirir un cerdito más. Ayudemos a que Antolina pueda tener más animalitos en bien del futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase a pig

loans.name: Macarena

texts.es:
Macarena is a married woman with four children: two sons, 15 and 7 years old respectively, and two grown daughters who are married and no longer live with her. Macarena’s husband works as a carpenter but his earnings are not sufficient to maintain the family. For that reason Macarena decided to begin her own business in order to bring income to her family and above all education to her young sons. She began to sell women’s undergarments by catalogue to her neighbors, friends and family. Little by little, her sales have increased. The business has been in operation between 6 and 7 years, and Macarena wants to continue with it.

Macarena is asking for a $925 loan in order to buy merchandise and to be able to offer better products. She is offering to repay the loan in 5 months. She and her family thank you for your support in helping her business continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Macarena es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos hijos de 15 y de 7 años respectivamente, y dos hijas mayores que ya son casadas y no viven con ella, su esposo trabaja como carpintero y los ingresos que él tiene no eran suficientes para mantener la economía de su hogar, fue por ello que ella tomó la decisión de empezar con su negocio para poder aportar ingresos a su hogar y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos que son pequeños. Ella empezó a vender ropa interior de dama por catálogo entre sus vecinos, amistades y familiares y poco a poco han ido creciendo con sus ventas, teniendo ya entre 6 a 7 años con su negocio y desea continuar con el mismo.

Macarena está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecer mejor sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen tu apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Imelda

texts.es:
Doña Blanca is married and her husband works as a welder assistant. They have 3 children, 20, 17, and 15 of age. She started her business as she needed to contribute to the household income because her three children are studying and the income of her husband is not sufficient. 10 years ago she started selling cosmetics from catalogue, from a well-known firm in Mexico to friends, neighbors, and family and now she has more clients as she has been furthermore recommended. She is helping her husband and improving the entire family's life quality little by little. It is her wish to continue with her business and improve sales.

Blanca is asking for a loan of $925 and she plans to repay in 5 months. She will buy cosmetics and meet existing orders from her clients. She and her family appreciate the support in order to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Blanca esta casada y su esposo trabaja como ayudante de soldador, ellos tienen 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. Ella inició su negocio por que tenía que aportar ingresos para poder mantener y ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar ya que sus tres hijos están estudiando y los ingresos de su esposo no eran suficientes, por ello, empezó a vender hace 10 años atrás productos de belleza de una reconocida marca en México a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares por catálogo, y ahora ya tiene más clientes debido a la recomendación de sus clientes anteriores, con esto, ella esta ayudando a su esposo y mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia, y desea continuar con su negocio y tener cada vez mejores ventas.

Blanca esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925que ofrece pagar en 5 meses, con el que comprará mercadería y cubrir los pedidos que tiene pendiente de sus clientes, ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Doña María Antonia is a married woman, her husband works as a security guard and they have four children. She started her business to contribute to the household income. She is fond of sales so 4 years ago she started selling cosmetics of a well-known company in Mexico, and little by little she has contributed to the income and helped keep her family going. She started sales from catalogue among her friends who have recommended her and thus she has improved her sales and wishes to expand her business.

María Antonia needs a loan of $375 to buy more products to offer her clients and also she has several orders to fulfill. Her plan is to repay in 3 months. She and her family appreciate the support offered to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

María Antonia es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad y tienen cuatro hijos, ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a la economía familiar. A ella le encantan las ventas y fue por ello que hace 4 años atrás decidió iniciarse en la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca en México y así poco a poco ha ido colaborando en los ingresos a su hogar y poder sacar adelante a su familia. Empezó su negocio de venta por catálogos primero entre sus amistades quienes a la fecha la han ido recomendando con otras personas y han mejorado sus ventas y desea continuar con su negocio.

María Antonia esta solicitando un préstamo por US 375 para comprar mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y por que tiene varios pedidos que surtir, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les brindas para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics to improve sales and fulfill orders.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Don Teodoro is a carpenter committed to his trade and his family's well being, which is the reason he struggles daily to increase his income. Even though he must deal with certain limitations, he is always hopeful that his efforts will soon bear results. One of his most urgent needs is to own his own home, so that he can open a more adequate carpentry shop there; this will allow him to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

He is requesting a loan of $350, which he will use to purchase some needed tools and better raw materials, to improve the quality of the beautiful furniture pieces he makes. You can be an important participant in this endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Teodoro, es un carpintero comprometido con su trabajo y el bienestar de su familia razón por la cual se dedica a incrementar a través de diversas actividades el ingreso económico a su hogar día a día.A pesar de tener que lidiar con algunas limitaciones que se presentan, él siempre mantiene las esperanzas de obtener pronto muchos frutos de su esfuerzo. Una de las necesidades más urgente por las que atraviesa hace mucho tiempo es la de tener una casa propia para abrir su propio taller de carpintería y aumentar sus ingresos con el objetivo de incrementar la calidad de vida de su hogar.. Por esta razón está tratando de aumentar sus pedidos e incrementar la calidad de los mismos con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y hacer realidad sus anhelos.Hoy requiere para ello un préstamo de 350 dólares; con los que podrá adquirir algunas herramientas que le hacen falta y mejorar la materia prima que moldea para la elaboración de los bellísimos muebles que le encomiendan. Hoy puedes convertirte en un importante partícipe. Tan sólo tienes que colaborar con las personas que necesitan de ti.

loans.use: To buy tools and raw materials

loans.name: Walter Luis

texts.es:
Walter is a 38 year old man, hard worker and dedicated who loves his family and does numerous activities in order to provide for them. Because he bears a great responsibility he will spare no effort, working at night in a gas station close to his home. As we know, night jobs require a lot of effort, but he has many needs that he has to take care of and therefore he has to sacrifice some of his sleep for the well being of his family. He has some plans in mind, and he would like to open a small store to sell shoes in an area of the house of his mother-in-law, but in order to do that he requires a $350 loan with which he will be able to achieve his objective in a short period of time. Your contribution is important so that he can achieve his dream.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer

Walter es un hombre de 38 años de edad, trabajador y empeñoso en lo que realiza, ama mucho a su familia y para procurarles bienestar realiza innumerables actividades.Frente a la gran responsabilidad que tiene no escatima esfuerzos y también se dedica por las noches a prestar sus servicios en un grifo de combustible próximo a su hogar. Como sabemos los trabajos de noche requieren de mucho esfuerzo, pero para él con tantas necesidades que cubrir a cuestas no le queda mas que sacrificar sus horas de sueño por el bien de su familia Hoy tiene planes en mente, aperturar una pequeña tienda para ofertar zapatos y zapatillas en un ambiente de la casa de su suegra; sin embargo para llevar a cabo este próximo propósito necesita la suma de 350 dólares con los que podrá poner en marcha sus objetivos en corto tiempo.Tu colaboración es importante para la cristalización de sus deseos

loans.use: To buy shoes in order to start a new business

loans.name: Juan Nicador

texts.es:
Juan is a young man who has watched over his mother’s well-being for the past 20 years. Day by day he works in his small piece of land sowing potatoes, with the aim of bettering the quality of life at home. Currently he is 32 years old and his dear mother 82. In spite of being able to count on the immense affection and company of his mother, Juan never stops longing to begin his own family and have children who will enjoy his infinite love. This dream led him to formalize his engagement and plan a timely wedding. Nothing is more beautiful than seeing a couple in love with dreams of starting their own family. However, Juan’s dreams could be frustrated by the lack of a solid income. In order to increase his income and offer the best to members of his future family, he needs a sum of $150 dollars in order to invest in the purchase of manure and other fertilizers with the hope of improving his products and in a short time realizing his longed for dream. Let’s make the dreams of this young couple become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan, es un joven hijo que ha velado por el bienestar de su madre desde hace 20 años y día a día trabaja en su pequeña tierra sembrando papa, con el propósito de incrementar la calidad de vida de su hogar.Actualmente tiene 32 años y su querida progenitora 82.A pesar de contar con el inmenso cariño y compañía de su madre, no deja de anhelar constituir su propia familia y tener hijos para gozar de su infinito amor. Este sueño lo llevó a consolidar su noviazgo y planear una pronta boda.Nada es más hermoso que ver a una pareja de enamorados con muchas ilusiones de formar un hogar. Sin embargo sus sueños pueden frustrarse por falta de una sólida economía. Con el propósito de incrementar sus ganancias y ofrecerle lo mejor a los miembros de su futura familia, requiere la suma de 150 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes con el afán de mejorar sus productos y en poco tiempo realizar su anhelado sueño. Hagamos que los sueños de esta pareja joven puedan hacerse realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for cropland

loans.name: Alberto Alfredo

texts.es:
Alberto is a young livestock farmer who sells meat to people who live in and visit his locale. His work in this area permits him to maintain his wife and their young daughter. He is 22 years old and carries an immense responsibility on his shoulders. He knows that he cannot give himself the luxury of rest because each moment counts toward increasing his productivity. In spite of leading a young family with lots of enthusiasm, he understands that in order to grow and better his products he needs a sum of money as investment capital. For this reason he is asking our help in raising $150 dollars in order to invest in his farmland and the purchase of small animals which over time will increase his capital and quality of life. If you are able to help Alberto please do so. He needs people like you.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto es un joven ganadero que vende carne a las personas que viven y visitan su localidad. Su desempeño en esta actividad le permite mantener a su esposa y a su pequeña niña. Tiene 22 años y una inmensa responsabilidad a cuestas, sabe que no puede darse el lujo de descansar porque cada momento cuenta para aumentar su productividad y a pesar de ser una familia joven con mucho entusiasmo comprende que para crecer y mejorar sus productos necesita de una suma de dinero como capital de inversión; motivo por el cual solicita nuestra ayuda con la monto de 150 dólares para invertirlos en sus terrenos de cultivo y en la compra de animalitos pequeños que con el transcurrir del tiempo incrementarán su capital y calidad de vida.Si usted tiene la posibilidad de ayudar a Alberto no deje de hacerlo, él necesita de personas como usted.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for his farmland and small animals for his modest farm.

loans.name: Miguel Percy

texts.es:
Percy, who is 19 years old, has enjoyed financial independence for the past 3 years, since inheriting a small farm from his father. With his mother's help, he took over the farm and is now seeing the results of his hard work. He now has another challenge that he would like to overcome.

Because he's aware that hard work and hands on experience alone won't be enough to accomplish his goals, he has made the decision to attend a local university to study agriculture and learn to improve his planting and harvesting techniques.

He's seeking a loan of $100 to increase the quantity of products he will plant before embarking in his academic career. This way he will be able to rely on the income from his harvest while he attends school. Together we can make this motivated young man's dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Percy, a sus cortos 19 años de edad goza de independencia económica gracias a la chacra que heredó de su padre hace 3 años, después de cumplir la mayoría de edad decidió iniciar el trabajo en sus campos de cultivo gracias a la ayuda de su madre, hoy puede ver los frutos de su trabajo; sin embargo aún tiene una gran prueba que asumir. Consciente de que no sólo la experiencia podrá brindarle frutos más adelante se ha propuesto estudiar la carrera de agronomía en la universidad que acaban de instalar en su pequeña localidad , próximamente con el fin de mejorar sus sistemas de siembra y cosecha. Actualmente requiere la suma de 100 dólares para incrementar la cantidad de productos que va a sembrar de esta manera luego de la inversión que se propone hacer iniciará sus estudios en la universidad teniendo como soporte económico la suma de dinero que obtendrá por la cosecha de sus productos. Juntos podremos hacer realidad los sueños de este impetuoso joven.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is a fighter who to this day manages to provide the best for his family through his effort, early mornings, and constant work. For this reason he leaves home very early and leads his small animals toward his farmland where he works all day. His self-sacrificing wife stays at home taking care of their young sons and the pigs that they raise in order to supplement their family income. Teofila, Victor’s wife, lives in fear for her persistent husband's health. Three months ago they found a tumor in his stomach, but due to a lack of money it still has not been removed. In order to operate soon, his worried wife has made the special request for collaboration with her family for the well-being of the man of the house. With that goal in mind, she is asking for $175 dollars in order to sow a large quantity of potatoes that after being marketed will give Victor admittance into the operating room of a local hospital. Let’s not be indifferent toward this family’s misfortune. Let’s give them our support.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor es un hombre luchador que hasta el día de hoy procura darle lo mejor a su familia a base de esfuerzo y muchas madrugadas de constante trabajo, razón por la que abandona su hogar muy temprano y sale con sus animalitos rumbo a sus campos de cultivo en el que permanece trabajando todo el día. Su abnegada esposa se queda en casa cuidando de sus pequeños hijos y los cerditos que crían para incrementar el ingreso familiar.Teofila esposa de Víctor, vive angustiada por la salud de su obstinado esposo debido a que hace tres meses le detectaron un tumor en el estómago y que por falta de dinero aún no ha podido ser extirpado.Con el propósito de operarlo pronto su preocupada esposa nos hace la especial petición de colaborar con su familia para el bienestar del jefe de su hogar.Teniendo en cuenta este propósito solicita la suma de 175 dólares para sembrar una gran cantidad de papa que luego de ser comercializada posibilitará el ingreso de Víctor al quirófano en un nosocomio de su localidad. No seamos indiferentes ante esta desgracia familiar y brindémosles nuestro apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Haydee Gloria

texts.es:
Ever since Haydee was a little girl she dreamed of having a shop, now that she is married she has realized this dream, and thanks to the efforts of her and her husband she can enjoy the benefits of her business without neglecting her family.

Until now, she has been able to grow the products in her small shop with the money generated. However, there has now been an event which causes her great sadness and which is still difficult for her to accept - the deceit of her husband.

The mother of the small child resulting from this betrayal filed a demand for support, and because he did not comply, he is now in the city prison. She loves him very much and she has forgiven him, and hopes he will return very soon, especially now that their second son has been born. These problems caused a decline in the prosperous shop which they had only run for a short time, and the ongoing losses reduced the quantity of products they offered. This is the reason they need our help to be able to recover economically. She is requesting a loan of $350 to stock the small shop one more time, so with hard work they can improve the well being of their two children.

Let's support this selfless mother who struggles despite the circumstances she is living with.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Haydee desde muy niña soñó con tener una tienda, sueño que ahora de casada pudo consolidar gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo puede disfrutar de los beneficios de su actividad sin descuidar a su familia.

Hasta ahora ha podido incrementar los productos de su pequeña bodega con los réditos que le generaba ésta, sin embargo se ha suscitado un hecho que le dió mucha pena y aún le cuesta aceptar, el engaño de su esposo. Fruto de esa traición la madre de su pequeño hijo le ha entablado una demanda por manutención y por motivos de incumplimiento hoy pasa sus días en la prisión de su ciudad. Sin embargo por el inmenso amor que le tiene lo ha perdonado y espera volver a reunirse muy pronto con él; ahora más que nunca porque acaba de nacer su segundo hijo. Estos inconvenientes han generado el declive de la próspera tienda que administraba hace poco y las continuas pérdidas aminoraron la cantidad de los productos que ofertaba, motivo por el cual requiere de nuestra ayuda para poder recuperarse económicamente. Solicita la suma de 350 dólares para implementar una vez más la pequeña bodega con el afán de procurarles bienestar a sus dos pequeños niños. Apoyemos a esta abnegada madre que lucha a pesar de las circunstancias que le tocó vivir.

loans.use: She will use this loan to buy the necessary items to stock  her small shop.

loans.name: Ivanny

texts.en:
Ivanny is requesting her first loan from Esperanza. This loan will go to start her cloth and bedding store. She will purchase her wares from the capital city of El Seybo, then sell them to her community for a small service charge.

This is a group loan; there are four other women in her group. Ivanny is 27 years old and has two children (ages 8 and 5). She lives with her boyfriend in his mother´s house. She will use the profits from her small business to buy food for her family and send her children to school. Ivanny also spoke about wanting to feel like she had accomplished something on her own. She plans to put away a little savings in case she may need it in the future.

NOTE: This is a group loan, there are four other women in her group. This $750 loan will fund Ivanny's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: Purchase bedding sheets and fabrics

loans.name: Felícita Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina is a 50-year-old woman. At her age, she is very cheerful and her ways win even the hardest heart. This trait has enabled her to relate well to the people she encounters in her world as well as to her 52-year-old husband and two children. The children are currently working to forge a better future in a technical school in the city.

Thanks to the commitment she has to her work and to the daily dedication that she devotes to her store, her children are able to study without trouble. For a long time, she pledged herself to working hard to form a base standard of living. Nevertheless, her continual headaches cause her terrible pain, which is why she had to shut herself insiD. and stop working for a long period. This event caused a great decline in her home and her store; now she has decided to take up her work one more time, and she is very optimistic and the prospect of recovering the high acceptance she had with her customers. That's why she needs $450 to start up her and make her shop one of the best. With your contribution, Sabina will have the ability to keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina es una señora D. 50 años a su edad es muy jovial y con su forma D. ser muy particular pueD. ganarse hasta a la persona más recia, esta característica le ha permitido tener muy buenas relaciones con las personas que se encuentran en su entorno y más que nada con su esposo D. 52 años y sus 2 hijos, los cuales ahora ocupan su tiempo para forjarse un futuro mejor en la escuela técnica D. su ciudad.

Gracias al compromiso que tiene con su trabajo y a la dedicación diaria que le otorga a su bodega sus hijos pueden estudiar sin ninguna dificultad, durante mucho tiempo se empeñó a consolidar en base a mucho esfuerzo un nivel D. vida adecuado para su familia.Sin embargo sus continuas dolencias cerebrales le ocasionaron un terrible derrame, motivo por el cual tuvo que internarse y dejar todas sus actividades por un largo período.Este acontecimiento ocasionó grandes declives en su hogar y bodega, hoy a decidido emprender su labor una vez más y se muestra optimista con el propósito D. recuperar la gran acogida que tuvo con sus clientes.Por esta razón requiere D. 450 dólares para iniciar la implementación D. su negocio y hacer D. su bodega una D. las mejores. Con su contribución Sabina tendrá aun más fuerzas para seguir trabajando

loans.use: To stock the store with must-have items

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady is a 34 year-old woman with two kids who are currently in school. Her husband left to work in Spain in order to increase the family income. For that reason, Lady lives in her father-in-law's house which is located behind Saguapac on Choretti street. Lady sells shoes on the sidewalk of Aroma street, which is located in Los Pozos market on the corner of Antonio Vaca Diez in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. She is requesting funds because she doesn’t have a lot of merchandise and she needs credit in order to acquire more shoes for her business.

Lady has been working in this area for ten years, and hers is practically a family business since her mother sells shoes next to her and has taught her the business since Lady was young. There is quite a bit of competition in Lady’s area. There are 15 or 20 other people who set up their stalls where Lady sells, but her friendliness and attention to the clients help her have a strong clientele. The prices of the shoes vary according to the models and also depending on if they are for men or women. Regarding Lady's credit history, it is not negative.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Lady es una señora de 34 años, tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando en el colegio, su esposo (concubino) se fue a españa a trabajar para mejorar los ingresos de la familia, es por esta razón que Lady vive en la casa de su suegro que se encuentra ubicada detrás de Saguapac en la calle Choretti. Lady se dedica a la venta de zapatos en el mercado de Los Pozos en la acera de la calle Aroma esquina Antonio Vaca Diez, en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. El motivo de la presente solicitud es porque no tiene mucha mercadería y requiere del crédito para adquirir más zapatos para su respectiva comercialización. Lady trabaja en este rubro desde hace diez años atrás, negocio que es practicamente familiar ya que su mamá también vende zapatos al lado suyo y le enseño el negocio desde bastante joven. Existe bastante competencia en este rubro, donde ella vende hay unas 15 o 20 personas más que instalan sus puestos para vender, pero su amabilidad y peculiar atención a los clientes le ayudan a tener buena clientela. Los precios de los zapatos varian de acuerdo a los modelos y también dependiendo si son para varon o mujer, en cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios, no son negativos.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca considers herself a very optimistic, hard-working and responsible person. She's married and her husband is employed at a restaurant in their city. They have two boys and two girls who still live at home. She started her business because she enjoys sales and wanted to help her husband with the family's expenses, which includes her mother. She started her business in 1992 selling produce from her home. Francisca soon had a small produce stand and even though she had to close it down due to illness, she continued to sell from her home.

She would like to expand her business and for that reason is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid over 4 months, to buy more merchandise and offer her customers a better selection. Francisca and her family thank you for your support in helping her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca se considera una persona muy optimista, trabajadora y responsable, ella esta casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en un restaurante de su ciudad, ellos tienen cuatro hijos, dos hombres y dos mujeres, todos viven con ellos. Ella inició el negocio por que le gusta mucho el comercio y además de querer ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que también con ellos vive su madre y tuvo la visión de vender verduras por su casa, ya que no había nadie que venda esos productos y así en 1992 fue cuando empezó con su negocio, llego a tener en poco tiempo una tiendita pero por una enfermedad tuvo que cerrarla pero se mantuvo vendiendo verduras que hasta la actualidad aún lo hace y desea volver a crecer con su negocio.

Francisca está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para poder comprar mercadería y tener un mayor surtido que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que les das para poder seguir con su negocio y poder crecer con el mismo.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel considers himself a fighter and a very responsible person that is not afraid of working. He is single and he started his own business because he did not have a stable job and he needed something to live on. A close friend advised him to sell clothes, and that is how in 2005 he started selling clothes among his acquaintances and later on he started selling door to door and that way he got a client base and improved his business. He now wants to expand his business.

Miguel is asking for a $475 loan in order to buy clothes for the next season which will be colder and that way be able to offer better products to his clients and increase his sales, offering to pay back the loan in 4 months. He is very thankful for the support that he is given so that he can get ahead and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel se considera una persona muy luchadora, responsable y que no le tiene miedo al trabajo, él es un hombre soltero, el empezó su negocio por que no tenía un trabajo fijo y necesitaba hacer algo para poder vivir, por lo que escucho el consejo de un amigo cercano que le sugirió que se dedique a la venta de ropa y fue así como en el año 2005 el comenzó vendiendo ropa entre sus amistades y poco a poco fue vendiendo de casa en casa y así se fue haciendo de una cartera de clientes y a la vez fue mejorando su negocio, ahora el desea continuar con su negocio y llegar a hacerlo crecer.

Miguel esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para poder comprar ropa para la temporada que viene que ya comenzará a hacer más frío y así poder ofrecer buenos productos a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Él esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante con su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa Maria is an honest, active worker that does not like to depend on anybody else; she currently lives with her partner, they have 4 children and she really likes sales. Her partner works as a security guard with a low salary, and that is why she started her own business to help support her family. She has been working on her business since 1999 when she started selling corn and later on during winter she would sell prepared meals and in the summer she sells fruits and soft drinks that she gives in bags. She wants to expand her business and improve the quality of the products that she offers.

Rosa Maria is asking for a loan of $475 in order to invest in raw materials, merchandise and assets that will allow her to transport her products so that she can offer them in more places, offering to pay back the loan in 4 months. She and her family thank the support that they are given so that they can improve with their business and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa María es una persona, honesta, trabajadora y activa que no le gusta depender de nadie, ella vive actualmente en unión libre con su pareja, tienen 4 hijos y a ella le gustan mucho las ventas y además que su esposo trabaja como velador, tiene un ingreso bajo, fue por ello que decidió empezar con su propio negocio y apoyar en la economía familiar, lleva trabajando en su negocio desde 1999 cuando empezó a vender elotes y posteriormente en la temporada de invierno vendía comidas y cenas y en temporada de calor vende frutas y refrescos que los da en bolsas. Ella desea crecer con su negocio y poder mejorar la calidad de sus productos que ofrece.

Rosa maría esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para invertir en su negocio en materia prima, mercadería y activos que le permitan transportar sus productos para así poder ofrecerlos en más lugares, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le das para poder mejorar con su negocio y salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise, raw materials  and assets in order to expand business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is 38 years old and is a mother of 2 young boys that are still in school. When she realized that her husband's income as a taxi driver was not covering the basic necessities of her home, she decided to support him, and started to prepare and sell ice cream. In order to excel in this endeavor, she repurposed a space in her humble home and at first only catered to her neighbors using a small wheelbarrow that her husband built for her business. Today, after having dedicated endless hours of work and much effort, she has obtained a small ice cream cart. The small business she has built has also allowed her to offer employment to three young people in her city.

Her hopes are to better the quality and variety of the products she offers, with the purpose of increasing customer preference and satisfaction. In order to fulfill this goal, she is asking for a loan of $500 that she will use to acquire a freezer to preserve the quality and taste of her delicious ice cream. Lets contribute to this young woman's effort.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva volunteer.

Elena tiene 38 años de edad y es madre de 2 pequeños niños que se encuentran aún en etapa escolar, al observar que el ingreso económico que obtenía su esposo con su labor de mototaxista no cubría las necesidades básicas de su hogar, decidió apoyarlo e inició su incursión en la preparación y venta de helados, para el buen desempeño de su actividad habilitó un espacio de su humilde morada y en principio sólo los ofrecía a sus vecinos en una carretita que elaboró su esposo para este trabajo. Ahora, después de haberle dedicado interminables horas de trabajo y esfuerzo ya cuenta con una pequeña distribuidora de helados; con esta microempresa que consolidó también puede ofrecerle empleo a tres jóvenes de su ciudad. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad y variedad de los productos que ofrece con el propósito de incrementar la preferencia y satisfacción de sus clientes y para llevar a cabo este proyecto esta solicitando un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que utilizará para adquirir una congeladora donde podrá preservar la calidad y sabor de sus deliciosos helados.Colaboremos con el propósito de esta joven madre.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Sonia Porfidia

texts.es:
Sonia is 39 years old and is married to Erasmo F. Arteaga, with whom she has two children. They live in the Toborochi neighborhood, in a house owned by Sonia's mother. Her beauty salon, providing hair styling, massages and spa services, is located at the same address.

This request for a loan is to buy the equipment necessary to proviD. the best service possible to current and future clients. The equipment includes: hair dryer, chair, and hair tints, whose prices vary based on whether they are new or used in the case of the furniture and dryers, and their brand in the case of the tints.

Sonia had a negative credit record at one time which has been resolved and she has always met her obligations with this sponsoring institution in a timely and responsible manner. It must be noted that her picture is not available as she was not on the premises when the photographer went to take her picture and her assistant did not want to be photographed.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia es una señora D. 39 años D. edad que está casada con el señor Erasmo F. Arteaga, tienen dos hijos y viven en la urbanización TOBOROCHI, en la calle Los Ceibos, UV-132, mza-58, esta casa le pertenece a la madre D. Sonia. En el mismo domicilio se encuentra instalado el salón D. belleza donD. se realizan tintes, peinados, masajes y yesoterapias. Este tipo D. rubros en la ciudad D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra tiene bastante competencia, pero la demanda por verse bien es también bastante elevada, esto sin distinciones entre estratos sociales. La presente solicitud es para la implementación D. nuevos equipos en el salón, con lo que se satisfacerá D. mejor manera las exigencias D. las clientes actuales y futuras. Los equipos que se comprarán con el crédito son: Una secadora, un sillón, Tintes Profesionales D. diferentes marcas y otros, los precios D. los mismos varian según si los muebles son nuevos o usados y en el caso D. los tintes dependiendo D. la marca. Sonia tiene un antecedente negativo que ya fué solucionado y desistido, sin embargo en la institución siempre ha cumplido sus cuotas D. manera puntual y responsable. Se hace notar que la cliente no sale en la foto debido a que cuando se fué a tomar la foto la misma no se encontraba, sólo se ubico a su ayudante y no quiso salir en la foto.

loans.use: To buy equipment for beauty salon

loans.name: Ignacia Loyola

texts.es:
Doña Ignacia is 47 years old, a selfless mother of 5 children and a caring grandmother of her young grandchildren. She comes from a humble, but hard working family. She has worked since she was 14 years old, packaging and selling cooking spices on foot. She learned this trade from her aunt, and it has now become an important means to generate income for the family, whose members have all contributed to its development. In order to market her products, she must visit many establishments and the day turns into never-ending hours of walking in the company of her younger children and, occasionally, her oldest grandchild.

Her second job consists of recycling plastic and paper products, in addition to selling buckets of motor oil which she cleans re-sells as water containers after they are used. These endeavors also generate important income to increase her quality of life. The hopes of Doña Ignacia are to have more capital to establish a small store in which to sell her spices. She asks for a loan of $500 to invest in and develop her current businesses in order to start her next enterprise. With your help, she will be able start her projects in a small period of time. ?

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

? Doña Ignacia tiene 47 años, es una abnegada madre de 5 hijos y abueL. cariñosa de sus pequeños nietos, proviene de una familia humilde pero laboriosa, empezó ha trabajar a L. edad de 14 años empaquetando y vendiendo condimentos para cocinar en forma ambulatoria, esta actividad L. aprendió de su tía y ahora se ha convertido en un importante generador del ingreso económico familiar, en el que todos los miembros de su hogar colaboran con el propósito de consolidarlo muy pronto. Para ofrecer sus productos tiene que recorrer muchos establecimientos y el día se convierte en interminables horas de caminata en compañía de sus hijos menores o su nieto mayor ocasionalmente. Su otra labor consiste en reciclar artículos de plástico y/o papel; adicionalmente L. venta de baldes de aceite para carros, que luego de lavarlos vende como depósitos de agua. también le genera ingresos económicos importantes para elevar su nivel de vida. El deseo de Doña Ignacia es contar con más capital para poner una pequeña tienda de venta de especerías, para esto solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá en sus actuales negocios con el objetivo de consolidarlos para iniciar su próximo anhelo. Con tu ayuda en poco tiempo podrá poner en marcha sus proyectos.

loans.use: Increase capital to develop current business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a 29-year-old single mother of two, who cares for her children without any outside help. After working various temporary jobs, she tried selling second hand leather jackets door to door, but this activity did not generate the income necessary to support her household. She then made the decision to raise dairy cows outside her parents' humble home, where she lives with her children.

Thanks to the milk they produce and that her neighbors buy, she has been able to provide her children with a certain degree of financial stability. Her next goal is to purchase another dairy cow to increase milk production in order to generate more income and have a better quality of life. For this purpose, she's requesting a loan of $400.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy tiene 29 años, es madre soltera y cuida sin ninguna ayuda a sus dos pequeños niños; después de realizar diversos trabajos eventuales, decidió incursionar en la venta de casacas de cuero de segundo uso en forma ambulatoria, sin embargo esta actividad no siempre fue rentable debido a que vendía solo dos días a la semana y los ingresos que obtenía para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar eran insuficientes. Observando esto, decidió habilitar la pequeña y humilde morada de sus padres que actualmente habita con sus pequeños, para dedicarse a la crianza de las vaquitas que adquirió con mucho sacrificio años atras.Gracias a la venta de la leche que producen y que sus vecinos gustosamente consumen, puede otorgarles una mesurada estabilidad económica a sus hijos. Su próximo propósito es adquirir otra vaquita para aumentar la producción de leche con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida. Con el fin de concretar sus objetivos solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares este dinero le permitirá iniciar la cristalización de sus anhelos.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
The ceaseless fighting spirit of Beatriz, a mother of a 3 year old girl, lead her to build a small business that manufactures and sells furniture over 4 years ago. As a result of much effort and sacrifice, she was able to rent a space where she could run her business and conduct sales. Her work day begins at 8:00 am and ends at 7:00 pm every day of the week. Her small business also provides work to 5 other people who are responsible for the well-being of their families. She asks for a loan of $635 in hopes to continue to grow and increase the quality of her products to sell in other cities. She will invest this money to acquire raw materials to build her beautiful furniture that she sells in her city. Be an important part of Beatriz's business growth; she awaits your help.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva volunteer.

El incansable espíritu luchador que tiene Beatriz, madre de una niña de 3 años, la ha llevado a constituir una pequeña empresa de fabricación y venta de muebles; trabajo al que se dedica hace más de 4 años.A base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logró alquilar un local con el propósito de implementar su pequeña fabrica y espacio de ventas, inicia su trabajo a las 8:00 de la mañana y la culmina a las 7:00 de la noche durante todos los días de la semana, en su pequeña fábrica también ofrece trabajo a otras 5 personas quienes velan por el bienestar de sus respectivas familias. El deseo de seguir creciendo e incrementando la calidad de sus productos para comercializarlos en otras ciudades la lleva a solicitar un préstamo de 675 dólares, dinero que invertirá para adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de los hermosos muebles que oferta en su ciudad. Se parte importante del crecimiento del negocio de Beatriz, ella espera tu ayuda

loans.use: Purchasing of raw material.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal owns a small shop in a small village close to Baalback in the Bekaa. He has been a client of Majmoua for the past two years and has a good payment history. He invested the previous loans he received from Majmoua to increase the amount of goods available in his business.  Jalal is a hardworker who is financially responsible for his direct family members and some of his extended family. With the revenues from his business, he provides basic daily needs to more than 10 people. Jalal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a large quantity of gas bottles so he can sell these as a wholesaler. This will increase his earnings and help him financially care for those who depend on him.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of gas bottles for inventory for his retail shop

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi, 34-years old, married and father of five children, owns a small, traditional snack business in Saida in the South of Lebanon. He is a hardworking person whose work day starts at 4.00 AM to prepare the food that he mainly sells in the morning. The busiest days of the week are usually  the week-end.The snack bar's main specialties are "falafel" (fried spicy vegetables balls), "full" (beans peparation) and "hummus" (chick peas preparation). These are some of the traditional Lebanese breakfast main dishes. Fadi has been a client of Majmoua for the past four years and has a very good record of on-time repayments. With the consecutive loans he received from Majmoua, he expanded his business and improved the living conditions and quality of life of his family. Fadi is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase a tomato paste making machine and a coffee machine. This will increase the items he sells and earn him more income.

loans.use: To purchase a tomato paste machine and a coffee machine

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Sóng, 41 years old, started her waste recycling business 10 years ago. In the beginning, it was just buy and resell. The revenue was not enough for her family of 7. Three of her children are still in school. So in 2003, she and her husband made up a business plan to expand her waste recycling business. Instead of just buy & resell, they would open a factory to produce goods made from recycled material. Determined to succeed, her husband had enrolled in classes to learn how to produce jute bags and plastic beads. Now 4 years later, they own a factory that produces good made with recycled material in Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn district. They have 7 emplyees working in the factory, each earns 45 USD a month. Their revenue after expenses is 950 a month. Ms Sóng is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand their operation.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Vân, 39 tuổi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 2000. Bản thân là một người phụ nữ năng động chị đã cùng với chồng là anh Lê Văn Thu, cán bộ xã Tiên Dược, bàn bạc vay vốn để kinh doanh mặt hàng tạp hoá ngay tại nhà để phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của đông đảo bà con trong thôn. Tổng thu nhập từ cửa hàng trong 1 tháng là 180USD, cộng thêm tiền lương của chồng giúp gia đình đủ điều kiện kinh tế để trang trải cho những chi phí thường ngày và cho các con ăn học đầy đủ. 3 con chị hiện nay đều đang học đến những năm cuối cấp, riêng cháu đầu đang học cao đẳng ngoài Hà Nội. Hiện tại gia đình chị có kế hoạch sửa chữa nâng cấp cửa hàng và nhập thêm nhiều mặt hàng để phục vụ cho dịp tết Nguyên đán sắp tới, nếu được vay thêm 1200 USD.

loans.use: buy groceries, etc drinks, candy ...

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Being one of the first members of TYM fund in the village of Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn district, Ms Lê Thị Đãng invested all the loans that she received in her metal waste recycling business and chicken farm. Her daily revenue from the waste recycling business brought in 4-5 USD. Her husband and 5 children took care of the chicken farm. When she was approaching the age of 50, the hard labor of the metal waste recycling business started to take its toll on Ms Đãng's health. So she and her husband had decided to abandon this waste recycling business and concentrate their effort on exploiting a farm. In 2000, she bought 1 acre of land for cultivation and fish farming. About 6/10 of the acre is used to grow jasmine shrubs. Jasmine flowers are very fragrant, they are used to make perfume, soft and tea. The rest of her land is made up of 3 fish ponds. She also has a flock of 100 chickens. The revenue from her farm is about 375 USD a month. She is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy 100 chickens and more jasmine shrubs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Là một trong những hội viên đầu tiên của xã Tiên Dược, huyện Sóc Sơn tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, qua 13 năm tham gia chị Lê Thị Đãng luôn vay mức vốn cao dùng vào việc chăn nuôi gà, buôn bán phế liệu. Mỗi một ngày thu mua phế liệu mang lại cho chị khoảng 4-5USD, trong khi đó ở nhà, chồng và 5 người con thay nhau giúp đỡ vợ, mẹ trông nom đàn gà. Khi gần 50 tuổi, cảm thấy sức khỏe không còn thích hợp với việc đi lại, thu mua sắt thép, chị bàn với chồng chuyển sang mô hình làm trang trại vào. Đầu năm 2000, chị thầu hơn một mẫu đất về để trồng hoa, cây ăn quả và nuôi cá. Chị có khoảng 6 sào đất trồng hoa nhài, một loại hoa có mùi thơm dùng làm nước hoa, xà phòng và để ướp trà, và 3 sào ao thả cá. Bên cạnh đó chị tiếp tục duy trì việc chăn nuôi gà. Trang trại của chị hiện nay có khoảng hơn 100 con gà thịt. Thu nhập mỗi tháng từ trang trại là 375 USD/tháng. Chị đang dự định xin vay 950 USD để tăng đàn gà của mình lên khoảng 200 con và mua thêm cây giống.

loans.use: buy chicken and tree

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad, 44-years old, married and father of five children, owns a tailor factory in a village close to Saida in the South of Lebanon. Mohamad has been a client of Majmoua for the past five years. When he first came to Majmoua, he had a single machine and a lot of debts. With the consecutive loans he received from Majmoua, he bought new sewing machines for his factory, was able to recruit seamstresses increase his inventory of fabrics, and was finally able to answer the demand for his clothes. He has a very good record of on-time repayments. Mohamad is requesting a loan for $1,200 to purchase a large quantity of fabrics to produce winter clothes as the summer season is now over. Mohamad, who has a very high business turnover, will be able to repay the loan within four months.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of fabrics to produce winter clothes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Sóng, 41 years old, started her waste recycling business 10 years ago. In the beginning, it was just buy and resell. The revenue was not enough for her family of 7. Three of her children are still in school. So in 2003, she and her husband made up a business plan to expand her waste recycling business. Instead of just buy & resell, they would open a factory to produce goods made from recycled material. Determined to succeed, her husband had enrolled in classes to learn how to produce jute bags and plastic beads. Now 4 years later, they own a factory that produces good made with recycled material in Tiên Dược, Sóc Sơn district. They have 7 employees working in the factory, each earning 45 USD a month. Their revenue after expenses is 950 a month. Ms Sóng is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to expand their operation.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Sóng, 41 tuổi đã bắt đầu công việc kinh doanh từ 10 năm nay. Khởi đầu gia đình chỉ buôn bán phế liệu qui mô nhỏ (mua đi bán lại). Mức lãi thu được hàng tháng không đủ nuôi sống 2 vợ chồng và 5 đứa con, trong đó có 3 đứa đang đi học. Năm 2003 vợ chồng chị đã bàn bạc mở rộng và phát triển nghề kinh doanh phế liệu. Không chỉ dừng lại ở việc mua và bán phế liệu, hai anh chị muốn mở một xưởng sản xuất nguyên vật liệu từ các loại phế liệu cung cấp cho thị trường, Để thực hiện ý định này, chồng chị đã đi học nghề sơ chế bao tải, ép nhựa tạo hạt. Sau 4 năm thực hiện dự án, hiện tại gia đình chị có 1 xưởng sản xuất sơ chế phế liệu tại xã Tiên Dược, huyện Sóc Sơn với 7 công nhân lao động, lương cho mỗi người là 45USD/1 tháng. Tổng thu nhập của gia đình sau khi đã trừ tất cả chi phí là 950USD/tháng. Gia đình chị còn có nhu cầu vay 1200 USD để mua thêm nguyên liệu sản xuất.

loans.use: buy waste to recycle

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 21-years old, is a daily worker in a bakery. She lives with her parents in Abbassieh in South Lebanon. They live in an economically vulnerable situation and Fatmeh's status as a daily worker offers her limited revenues.
She is requesting a loan of  $300 to repay debts that she and her family owe four different persons, including money owed for food and plumbing. Fatmeh prefers to come to Al Majmoua to resolve her credit issues, because she wants to preserve her family's pride. She does not want the people of her community to look at her parents as if they are asking for charity. Fatmeh is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. They named their group "Fatmeh" because she was the one who had the idea of contacting our Institution. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: To repay personal and family debts

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad S. is 24 years old and lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. He is single. For two years he has been running his own orchard, and this business gives him the opportuniy to support himself.  Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy pesticides to improve his orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Seran

texts.en:
Seran B. is a 34-year-old farmer who owns a milk products business in the small, southern Azerbaijani village of Qiraqli, in the Saatli region. Seran has one milk cow and sells milk to the local people. Before selling milk, he used to breed cattle for meat production from 1999 till 2005. It brought him enough income, but family problems forced him to sell the calves, and his business crashed.

Later, when his family problems were solved, he borrowed money from his friends and purchased one cow. Seran applied for 900 USD to purchase an additional milk cow and expand his business making yogurt and cheese and selling dairy products to the bazaar traders. Selling dairy products will help his family to cover all of their needs. The estimated cost for a cow is 700-800 USD, and he will spend the rest of money on animal feed.

loans.use: Purchase one cow and animal feed

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Agila

texts.en: Agila is a 40-year old divorcee with one child. She lives with her family in Gardili village in the Salyan region. Seven years ago she started her own business and she now needs a loan of $725 to purchase pesticides for her orchard and to improve her harvest.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mudafig

texts.en: Mr. Mudafig is a low income person which makes him vulnerable. He is 37, married with two children, and lives in Saatli city in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Mudafig is a taxi driver and has been driving a taxi for ten years now. This will be Mudafig’s first loan with Normicro. He has been approved for a loan of $500.00 with which he plans to purchase new tires for this taxi as well as do some minor repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and do minor repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Minara

texts.en: Minara is 47 years old and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. She has her own orchard and started her business 10 years ago. She now needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Garib

texts.en: Mr. Garib is a 48-year-old married farmer with three children. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1987, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is hard, but interesting, and takes a lot of effort. Garib buy calves, breeds them, then quarters them before selling them to the butcher who works in the big local market. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of Garib’s family expenses. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Garib has to invest some money to make his small herd bigger. This Summer he applied for $500 to buy four calves.  He hopes eventually to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is 42 years old, married and has three children. For the last 15 years, she has owned and operated an orchard in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. She has requested a loan of $1200  to buy pesticides.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Gulhuseyn

texts.en: Three years ago Gulhuseyn started his own business. He is 26 years old and single and lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. Gulhuseyn needs a loan of $1200  to purchase pesticides and fertilizer for his orchard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anak Agung Ayu Sudar

texts.id:
With a very simple stall, bamboo walls and woven coconut leaves roof, Agung nicknamed after Anak Agung Ayu Sudaryati started her pig farming business after she got married to I Gusti Putu Tinda . Up to now she is active in the business, since with pig farming, this family of 5 could fulfill daily needs. Her husband's income as a tenant farmer is not sufficient to cover schooling expenses for her 3 children: Agung Ayu Damayanti, Agung Lanang Putra dan Ayu Cempaka Dewi. However wih her additional efforts of pig farming, her children are now in Highschool, Middle school, and Grade school. Before Dinari's loan she only has a capital of Rp300,000 (about US$33) to buy 2 local piglets, that she raised the traditional way, by feeding them banana tree trunk, and talas leaves which grows around her home. With that limited capital she often has to sell her pigs before harvest, because of urgent family needs or to buy food for the family. With additional loan of Rp1,500,000 (about $165), Agung could buy 3 more piglets, and the rest to buy few sacks of wheat and rice shell clippings to feed her animals. Hence the growth would be enhanced, and income would increase to Rp3,000,000 ($330) per 6 months.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan kandang yang sangat sederhana , dinding bambu dan atap daun kelapa yang di anyam. Agung begitu panggilan akrab dari Anak Agung Ayu Sudaryati yang telah memulai usaha beternak babi sejak menikah dengan I Gusti Putu Tinda . Sampai saat ini Agung masih tetap menekuni usaha itu karena dengan beternak babi keluarga yang beranggotakan 5 orang ini dapat memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari hari . Hasil suami yang hanya sebagai buruh tani tidak cukup untuk membiayai pendidikan tiga orang anaknya Yakni : Agung Ayu Damayanti, Agung Lanang Putra dan Ayu Cempaka Dewi. Namun berkat ketekunan Agung dalam memelihara babi, kini anak-anaknya telah duduk di bangku sekolah SMA, SMP dan SD .Sebelum mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Agung hanya mengandalkan modal Rp 300.000.- untuk membeli 2 ekor bibit babi lokal yang di pelihara secara tradisional yaitu dengan makanan batang pisang dan daun talas yang tumbuh di sekitar rumahnya . Dengan modal yang sangat terbatas itu sering kali Agung harus menjual ternaknya sebelum waktu panen karena kebutuhan keluarga yang mendesak atau tak sanggup membeli pakan. Kini Agung telah mendapatkan tambahan modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp 1.500.000.- Dengan tambahan modal itu Agung mulai membeli bibit baru lagi sebanyak 3 ekor dan sisanya di belikan beberapa sak dedak gandum dan dedak padi untuk pakan ternaknya Pertumbuhan babinya cukup baik dan hasil yang di perolehpun sangat lumayan yaitu Rp. 3.000.000.- / 6 bulannya.

loans.use:
To buy feedstock & pig food

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Tarana

texts.ru:
Taranara Suleymanove was born in 1969 in the city of Aksu. She is married and has two children. She has had her own business for 6 years now thanks to the Norwegian branch of Normico. Tarana remembers the day when she first came to Normico as if it was yesterday. It was in 2005 and she was able to obtain a $300 loan. The second time around she borrowed $600 that allowed her to increase the size of her business. Now she needs money in order to by more goods. Tarana sells clothing.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Тарана Сулейманова,родилась 1969 году в городе Аксу. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Уже 6 лет подряд она занимаеться бизнесом, благодаря Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.Тарана прекрасно помнить тот день, когда обратилась Аксуниский филиал. Это было 2005 году 300$.Второй раз она взяла 600$, чтобы расширяться. Теперь ей нужны деньги чтобы по больше купить товар.Тарана занимаеться торговли одеждами.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Mastona has been a client of MicroInvest for the past 2.5 years. Over this time she was able to significantly increase her turnover. Before she used to buy and sell dried fruit on local markets. Gradually she made the switch to selling fabric. This way she is able to get the money necessary to support her family. She is 27 years old, married and has two children. The new loan will allow her to buy fabric for the fall season.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Мастона является клиентом Микроинвест уже в течении 2,5 лет. За этот период она увеличила свой оборотный капитал в несколько раз. Раньше она занималась куплей продажей сухофруктов на местных рынках. Постепенно она перешла на торговлю тканями. Это дает ей возможность получать нормальную прибыль, достаточную для содержания семьи. Мастоне 27 лет, она замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. новый займ она планирует потратить на закупку тканей осеннего ассортимента.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: I Gusti Ayu Ketut Wi

texts.id:
I Gusti Ayu Widiantari is the full name of this woman who is also called Gusti Ayu by the local people. Wife of I Gusti Komang Jaya Pinatih is famous for being tough and clever in running her business to help her family every day. Besides a housewife and helping her husband in the fields as routine daily work, she a mother of 3 also has her own business, which runs quite well, and able to pay for her eldest child higher education expenses, and the brother in middle school. The business Gusti Ayu has run since 2002 is pig farming. With a mother pig as capital, Gusti Ayu could profit Rp1,200,000 (about US$132)/6 months, from sales of the piglets as feedstock. Gusti Ayu wishes to own a simple stall, and also like to add her raised animals by trying to obtain a loan from Dinari for Rp1,500,000 (about $165). Gusti Ayu is optimistic that all her dreams could be fulfilled so that she could pay for her children's higher education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

I Gusti Ayu Widiantari begitu nama lengkap dari wanita yang oleh masyarakat setempat sering di panggil dengan Gusti Ayu saja . Istri dari I Gusti Komang Jaya Pinatih ini terkenal sangat ulet dalam bekerja dan pintar dalam mengelola usaha , untuk membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga setiap hari. Mengerjakan pekerjaan sebagai ibu rumah tangga dan membantu suami di kebun merupakan pekerjaan rutin yang dilakukannya setiap hari. Namun begitu ibu tiga orang anak ini juga memiliki usaha sendiri yang memiliki hasil yang cukup baik dan dapat membantu biaya pendidikan anak sulungnya yang baru saja masuk bangku kuliah dan adiknya yang masih di SMP. Usaha yang ditekuni Gusti Ayu sejak tahun 2002 itu adalah memelihara ternak babi. Dengan modal awal 1 ekor induk babi , Gusti Ayu bisa meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1.200.000,- per 6 bulanya yaitu dari hasil penjualan anak-anak babinya untuk bibit. Gusti Ayu memiliki kerinduan untuk dapat memiliki sebuah kandang yang sederhana dan juga ingin menambah ternak peliharaanya dengan meminjam modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 1500.000,- Gusti Ayu sangat optimis semua impiannya akan terwujud sehingga cita-citanya untuk bisa membiayai pendidikan anaknya sampai tamat perguruan tinggi juga bisa terpenuhi.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and built a stall so that it would be cleaner and more hygienic

Membeli induk babi dan membuat kandang agar lebih bersih dan hyginis

loans.name: Oruj

texts.ru:
Oruj S. was born in 1949. He lives in the town of Shamakhe. Oruj is married and has 3 children. In 2004, he took his first NorMicro loan of $200. He used the money to rent a spot on the central market of Aksu, where Oruj sells every Saturday and Sunday. During the week, Oruj has a food service job.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сафаров Орудж, 1949 года рождения. Родилься и проживает в городе Шамахы.Семейный, имеет троих детей. Первый раз он взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 2004 году на сумму 200$.Орудж арендовал место на центральном рынке в городе Аксу. Каждую субботу и воскресенье ведет активную торговли.Кроме этого он еще занимаеться общепитом.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer is 27 years old and single and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He has had his own business for 2 years and has been selling fruits. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to expand his range of fruits and his client base.

loans.use: To expand his range of fruits and client base.

loans.name: Ni Made Yudiani

texts.id:
From 2 piglets she bought for Rp200,000 (about US$22)/piece Ni Made Yudiani started her business after she started her household. After being raised for 2 months , she sold the fattened piglets to a roasted pig vendor for Rp375,000 (about $41)/piece. From that sales, after expenses Yudiani got a nett profit of Rp100,000 (about $11). She used that profit to supplement family daily expenses, since her husband's income as a tenant farmer is not sufficient to cover family needs, especially since her 2 children Alit and Ratna are in highschool and kindergarden that certainly needs fees. Yudiani plans to expand her business from Dinari's loan of Rp1,500,000 (about $165) to buy 2 more piglets, and repair her broken stall. I Made Sutama Yasa, her husband supports Yudiani's business. Even her children also help in the business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dari dua ekor ternak babi yang di beli seharga Rp. 200.000,- / ekornya Ni Made Yudiani memulai usahanya sejak baru berumah tangga . Setelah dipelihara selama dua bulan babi itu kemudian dijual kepada pedagang babi guling dengan harga Rp. 375.000,- / ekor. Dari hasil penjualan itu Yudiani memperoleh keuntungan bersih Rp. 100.000.- Keuntungan yang didapatnya di pergunakan untuk membantu menambah biaya kebutuhan sehari –hari keluarganya karena pendapatan suaminya sebagai petani tidak cukup untuk memenuhi semua kebutuhan keluarga apalagi saat ini dua orang anaknya yakni Alit dan Ratna telah duduk di bangku SLTA dan TK yang tentunya sangat membutuhkan biaya . Yudani mengembangkan usaha ternaknya dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Rp 1.500.000,- Pinjaman itu digunakan untuk membeli dua ekor bibit lagi dan juga memperbaiki kandangnya yang sudah rusak.. , suaminya, sangat mendukung usaha dari Yudani. Bahkan tak jarang anaknya pun ikut dalam mengurus usaha itu.

loans.use:
To buy piglets and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Mr. Vusal is a 28-year-old farmer. He lives with his family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 2001, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The income from this business is not enough to cover all the family and business expenditures. Vusal purchases calves, breeds them, then quarters them before selling them to the butcher who works in the big local market. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Vusal has to invest some money to make his small herd bigger. His application to Normicro Saatli for $500 loan is approved already.  He hopes eventually to expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Saligha

texts.en: Ms. Saliga is a low income person which makes her vulnerable. She is 50 years old, married with four children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Saliga owns a herd of milk cows. Every day she sells milk to the local milk processing shop. Her children help her breed these cows in the nearby grazing fields. The income from four cows is too low to support the family and she needs to increase the number of cows in the herd - that’s why Saliga applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli. A loan of $500 will help her buy one more pure-breed cow which will make her monthly income higher. The price of a milk calf is $300 and the cost of breeding is $100. The other $100 she plans to save for unexpected expenditures.

loans.use: To buy milk cow

loans.name: Aziza
