texts.en: Ms. Aziza is a low income woman,she is 45, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Aziza owns a small flock of sheep and some cows. The business is going well, but needs some improvement. Aziza plans to increase number of lambs she purchases to make her income higher. Her family expenditures are growing as her children get older. Aziza's  application to receive a $600 loan has been approved by Normicro Saatli branch. She hopes this credit will let her to improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Feraset

texts.en: Feraset H. owns and operates an automotive parts store in the town of Devechi where he was born and raised. Devechi is located just south of the larger town of Khachmaz in northeastern Azerbaijan. Feraset has been running this business for the past six years and is now looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of automotive parts

loans.name: Ni Ketut Warni

texts.id:
Ketut Warni lives in a simple semi permanent house in Berawantangi village. With an initial capital of Rp1,300,000 Ketut Warni raised 2 mother pigs. Every day she fed those 2 pigs 2X/day Konsentrat (local brand) mixed with banana tree trunk at a cost of Rp15,000 (about US$1.70). She has been working on this business for 3 years, since her husband's income as a tenant farmer is not sufficient to pay for family expenses. Especially Ketut Warni has a child that now goes to Middle school. Every 4 months the mother pigs give birth to up to 10 piglets, after 2 months those piglets were ready to be sold. From that sales up to Rp 1,900,000 (about US$209) at Rp190,000X10, she could profit Rp800,000 (about $88)/6 months. This profit is used to pay for child school expenses, and other family needs. Ketut Warni is happy that with a loan from Dinari for Rp 1,300,000 (about $143-150 depending on exchange rate fluctuation) she could expand her business by buying another mother pig for Rp800,000 (about $88), while the rest Rp500,000 (about $55) would be used to buy animal feed. She hope her additional income and profit would increase so that it would be sufficient to pay for daily living expenses,

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Warni tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana semi permanen di desa di Berawantangi. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.300.000 Ketut Warni memelihara 2 ekor babi penginduk . Setiap hari babi tersebut diberi makan Konsentrat dicampur dengan batang pisang , sebanyak 2 kali sehari dan biaya yang dikeluarkan untuk 2 ekor babi tersebut sebanyak Rp.15.000. Usaha ini ditekuninya semenjak 3 tahun yang lalu mengingat penghasilan suami sebagai seorang petani tidak mampu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga . Apalagi Ketut Warni mempunyai satu orang anak yang kini sudah duduk dibangku SMU. Setiap 4 bulan sekali babi penginduk tersebut melahirkan anaknya .Dan sekarang salah satunya sudah melahirkan anak sebanyak 10 ekor, setelah 2 bulan maka anak-anak babi sudah siap dijual. Dari hasil penjualan sebanyak Rp. 1.900.000 ( @ 190.000 x 10) maka keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.800.000 setiap enam bulan sekali. Keuntungan ini pergunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya juga untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga Ketut Warni . Sekarang Ketut warni sangat senang dengan adanya pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 karena dengan pinjaman tersebut Ketut Warni bisa pengembangkan usahanya dengan membeli 1 ekor babi penginduk lagi seharga Rp.800.000 ,sedangkan sisanya sebesar Rp.500.000 dipergunakan untuk modal pakan ternak. Hal ini dilakukan agar hasil atau keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak dan dapat mencukupi biaya hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and animal feed

Membeli induk babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Mr. Elbrus is a 37-year-old farmer.  He lives with his family in the village of Saatli which is situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1999, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. Since then Elbrus collected up to seven cows. He buys calves, breeds them, quarters them, then sells them to the butcher, who works in the local big market. Elbrus has collected enough customers but needs more animals in his herd. This project requires investment. For this purpose Elbrus applied for $700 loan from Normicro to buy five calves.  He hopes eventually to expand his business using this loan.

loans.use: To buy more calves

loans.name: Melehet

texts.en: Melehet M. is a business woman who operates a women’s clothing stand in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Melehet has already successfully repaid four loans with Norwegian Microcredit, proving that she is a customer who can be trusted. Her last loan was for $1,000 and she is now looking for funding in the amount of $1,200. She plans on using her funds to increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her clothing inventory.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham owns a vineyard and has run his business for 5 years. He is 28 years old, single and lives in Yenikand, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Ilham would like a loan of $1200 to purchase vine-props to improve the growth of his vines.

loans.use: to buy vine-props

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif H. is a barber in his home town of Devechi which is located on the northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Vaqif has been working as a barber for the last six years and is now looking for funding in the amount of $1,000 so that he can purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his business.

loans.name: Shahina

texts.en: Shahina is 44 years old and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. Shas started her business 15 years ago and now has her own orchard.  She is looking for a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides so that she can improve her harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Ni Komang Wati

texts.id:
Pig farming has been the preoccupation of Komang Wati for a while. With a capital of Rp750,000 (about US$83), Komang Wati raised a mother pig. This pig was raised very simple and traditional. The food given was a mixture of rice shell clippings and pounded banana tree trunk . That pig was fed 2x/day, and the feed expenses per pig is Rp6500 (about 72 cents). In 4 months the pig gave birth to 9 piglets. She sold them for Rp1,575,000 (about $172) at Rp175,000(about $18)X9. After subtarcting Rp1,000,000 (about $110), her profit from this sale is Rp575,000 (about $62). She usd the profit to pay for her child's schooling expenses, who now sits in 7th grade; also to pay for other Komang Wati's household expenses, since her tenant farmer husband does not have a steady income. With a loan from Dinari in the amount of Rp1,300,000 (about $145), Komang Wati could expand her business, and expect to buy another mother pig for Rp800,000 (about $88), and 1 piglet for fattening for Rp250,000 (about $27.50); and the rest to buy animal feed. Komang Wati hopes that she could increase her profit, and make her family more prosperous.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha beternak babi sudah ditekuni Komang Wati sejak lama .Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.750.000, Komang Wati memelihara 1 ekor babi penginduk. Babi ini dipelihara dengan sangat sederhana dan tradisional. Makanan yang diberikan adalah campuran dedak padi dengan batang pisang yang sudah ditumbuk. Babi tersebut diberi makan 2 kali dalam satu hari sehingga biaya yang diperlukan untuk satu ekor babi tersebut sebesar Rp.6.500. Dalam waktu 4 bulan babi ini sudah melahirkan anaknya sebanyak 9 ekor, Dan laku dijual seharga Rp.1.575.000 (@ 175.000 x 9 ) ,dari penjualan ini diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.575.000 ,Setelah dikurangi biaya sebesar Rp. 1.000.000 selama enam bulan. Keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk biaya sekolah satu orang anaknya yang kini duduk dikelas 1 SMP, dan juga untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga Komang Wati mengingat suaminya seorang petani yang penghasilannya tidak pasti setiap bulan. Dengan adanya pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 1.300.000 Komang Wati dapat mengembangkan usahanya dengan membeli 1 ekor penginduk lagi seharga Rp.800.000 dan 1 ekor bibit babi penggemukan seharga Rp.250.000 ,sedangkan sisanya digunakan untuk menambah modal pakan ternak. Hal ini dilakukan Komang Wati dengan harapan keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak lagi dan kesejahteraan keluarga lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and piglet for fattening

Membeli induk dan bibit untuk penggemukkan

loans.name: Ilhem

texts.en: Ilhem M. (pictured on the left) sells fruits and vegetables at the bazaar in his northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Ilhem has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years and he is married with two children. He has already successfully re-paid two loans with Norwegian Microcredit. His last loan was in the amount of $600 and he is currently looking to get $1,200 so that he can begin to build a store where he can sell his produce.

loans.use: Ilhem would like to begin constructing a shop where he can sell his produce.

loans.name: Ni Made Ekarini

texts.id:
Although married at an age that is considered young, Ni Made Ekarini is persistend and hard working. Her husband's incomea as a building laborer is not sufficient to support household needs. Therefore after married 3 years agao, Made Ekarini started to farm pigs. With a capital of Rp600,000 (about US$66) Made Ekarini could buy 3 baby pigs. She gave them very simple food, a mixture of rice shell clippings and pounded banana tree trunks. She fed the pigs 2X/day, and the cost to feed them are about Rp10,000 ($1.10)/day. After 3 months she could sell those 3 piglets for Rp1,900,000 (about $209), and after expenses, she would profit Rp400,000(about $44)/3 months. Besides household needs, that profit is used to buy milk for her 3 year old child. Laon from Dinari for Rp1,300,000 (between $143-150, depending on exchange rate) will be used to expand her business by buying more pig feedstock, so that she would be able to make more profit. Made Ekarini also dreams to expand her other food stall side business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun menikah dalam usia yang tergolong muda namun Ni Made Ekarini sangat tekun dan ulet dalam bekerja . Melihat penghasilan suaminya sebagai buruh bangunan tidak dapat mencukupi keperluan rumah tangga maka sejak menikah 3 tahun yang lalu maka Made Ekarini mulai menekuni usaha beT. B.. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.600.000 Made Ekarini dapat membeli 3 ekor bibit B.. Makanan yang diberikan masih sangat sederhana yaitu campuran dedak padi dengan batang pohon pisang yang sudah ditumbuk. B. ini diberi makan 2 kali dalam satu hari, sehingga biaya yang dikeluarkan untuk pakan B. tersebut sebesar Rp. 10.000,setiap hari. B. ini akan dijual setelah berumur tiga bulan,dengan harga sebesar Rp. 1.900.000 untuk 3 ekor B., dari penjualan tersebut diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.400.000 selama 3 bulan. Keuntungan ini selain dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga juga untuk membeli susu anaknya yang kini baru berusia 3 tahun. Pinjaman yang diberikan oleh Dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dipakai untuk mengembangkan usahanya yaitu membeli bibit B., agar keuntungan yang diperoleh nantinya lebih banyak dan dari keuntungan itu Made Ekarini berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usaha warungnya sebagai usaha sampingan yang selama ini ditekuninya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz E. is a local butcher in his northeastern Azerbaijani home town of Devechi. Firuz is married with two children and has been working as a butcher for the last 10 years. He has already successfully re-paid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit in the amount of $400. He is currently looking to receive funding in the amount of $1,200 so that he can begin to build a new shop for his business.

loans.use: Firuz would like to begin construction on a new shop for his business.

loans.name: Ni Putu Budiantari

texts.id:
Putu Budiantari is married to Ketut Sutarma Yasa a tenant farmer who lives in Berawantangi village. They live in a modest semi permanent home. From that marriage they are blessed with 2 children, who now sits at Middle school and Grade school. Because tenant farmers do not earn much, and income unsure each month, while daily expenses has to be spent about Rp25,000 (about $2.75), Putu Budiantari started pig farming business since 4 years. With an initial capital of Rp800,000 (about US$88), Putu Budiantari could buy a mother pig. Every day she fed the pig 2X with rice shell clippings, mixed with pounded banana tree trunk. About every 4 months that pig bore about 10 piglets. After 2 months those piglets could be sold for about Rp2,000,000 (about $220) @ Rp200,000(about $22)X10. From that sales, after expenses, she could profit Rp900,000 (abou$109)/6months. Now that mother pig is again pregnant. From that profit Putu Budiantari could pay for family and 2 children school expenses. Dinari's loan would be used to buy another Mother pig for Rp1000,000 (about $110), and the rest to buy animal feed. Her hope is that with 2 mother pigs she would have more profit, and later on Putu Budiantari could provide better higher education for her children.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Putu Budiantari menikah dengan Ketut Sutarma Yasa seorang petani yang tinggal di Desa Berawantangi,mereka menempati sebuah rumah yang sangat sederhana dan masih semipermanen. Dari perkawinan ini mereka dikarunia 2 orang anak yang kini sudah duduk dibangku sekolah SMP dan SD. Karena penghasilan seorang petani tidak banyak dan tidak pasti setiap bulan ,sedangkan biaya yang harus dikeluarkan untuk kebutuhan rumah tangga setiap hari sebanyak Rp.25.000,maka Putu Budiantari memulai usaha beternak babi sejak 4 tahun yang lalu. Dengan modal awal hanya Rp.800.000 Putu Budiantari dapat membeli 1 ekor babi penginduk. Setiap hari babi tersebut diberi makan sebanyak 2 kali dengan makanan dedak padi dicampur dengan tumbukan batang pohon pisang . Dan setiap 4 bulan sekali maka babi ini melahirkan anaknya sebanyak 10 ekor, 2 bulan kemudian anak babi ini suda bisa dijual seharga Rp.2.000.000 ( @200.000 x 10 ),dari penjualan ini diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.900.000 selama 6 bulan sekali . Dan sekarang babi penginduk ini sedang hamil tua lagi.Dari keuntungan inilah Putu Budiantari dapat membiaya sekolah kedua anaknya dan juga biaya hidup keluarga. Sedangkan pinjaman dari Dinari dipergunakan untuk membeli satu ekor babi penginduk lagi seharga Rp. 1.000.000 dan sisanya untuk modal pakannya.Dengan harapan keuntungan dari memelihara 2 ekor penginduk akan lebih banyak,sehingga nantinya Putu Budiantari dapat menyekolahkan anaknya ke tingkat yang lebih tinggi

loans.use:
To buy mother pig

Membeli induk babi

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira E. has been operating a home goods store in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi for the last 10 years. Esmira has already successfully re-paid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding in the amount of $1,200 so that she can increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.use: Esmira would like to increase and diversify her inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rugiyya

texts.en: Rugiyya is a 38-year-old widow with 2 children. She lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. She has her own vineyard and 10 years of experience in this business. She would like a loan of $1200 so that she can buy pesticides and enjoy a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Wayan Ratih

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Ratih and her husband live in a simple semi permanent home in Berawantangi village. Her 3 children are married, and live separately from Wayan Ratih. Although elderly, Wayan Ratih has a forward spirit, and is persistent in her pig farming business. With a capital of Rp500,000 (about US$55) Wayan Ratih bought 2 piglets for fattening. Every day she fed those piglets 2X, at a cost of Rp12,000 (about $1.40). She raised them for 4 months and sold them both for Rp1,800,000 (about US$200). After expenses her profit was Rp550,000 (about $62) in 4 months time. From this profit Wayan Ratih could fulfill her household needs, since field income from her husband's tenant farming is not much. Loan from Dinari for Rp1,300,000 (about $150) will be used to buy another fattening piglet for Rp250,000 (about $28), the rest to buy animal feed for upcoming 4 months, with the hope that profit would increase so that Wayan Ratih could renovate her home little by little.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Ratih bersama suaminya tinggal disebuah rumah sederhana semipermanen di desa Berawantangi. Sedangkan ketiga orang anaknya sudah menikah dan tinggal terpisah dengan Wayan Ratih. Walaupun dalam usianya yang sudah tua namun Wayan Ratih tetap mempunyai semangat untuk terus maju dan menekuni usahanya beternak babi. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.500.000 Wayan Ratih membeli 2 ekor bibit babi yang nantinya dipelihara sebagai babi penggemukan . Setiap hari babi tersebut diberi makan 2 kali ,sehinggan biaya yang dikeluarkan sebesar Rp. 12.000. Babi ini dipelihara selama 4 bulan, dan laku dijual seharga Rp. 1.800.000 untuk dua ekor. Dari hasil penjulan ini diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp. 550.000 dalam waktu 4 bulan. Dari keuntungan inilah Wayan Ratih dapat memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya karena penghasilan ladang suaminya sebagai seorang petani tidak banyak. Pinjaman yang didapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dipergunakan oleh Wayan Ratih untuk membeli 1 ekor bibit penggemukan lagi seharga Rp. 250.000,sedangkan sisannya dipakai untuk biaya pakan ternak selama 4 bulan dengan harapan keuntungan yang didapat menjadi lebih banyak,sehingga nantinya Wayan Ratih bisa merenovasi rumahnya sedikit demi sedikit.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Imran

texts.en: Imran S. (his wife is pictured) and his wife own and operate a market in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Imran and his wife have two children and have been working with this business for the last 10 years. They have successfully re-paid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit proving that they are trust-worthy customers. They are currently looking to get funding in the amount of $1,200 so that they can increase and diversify their inventory.

loans.use: Imran would like to increase and diversify their product inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is 47 years old and is married with one child. The S. family lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Eldar has had his orchard business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy another plot of land so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy land to expand  his orchard.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
For three years Nadir has been running his own orchard, and this business gives him the opportuniy to support himself. He is 27 years old, lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region and is single.
He needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides to improve his orchard and enjoy a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Mehman

texts.ru:
Born in 1960, Mehman N. is married and has 3 children. In 2003, he opened a food mini market. Healthy sales helped Mehman to grow his business. This year, Mehman turned to NorMicro for help financing renovation of his store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нагиев Мехман, 1960 года рождения. Женат, имеет троих детей. 2003 году он открыл свой мини маркет.С хороший торговли начал развиваться.В этом году он обратилься Нормикро Аксуниского филиала за помощью.Мехман хочеть ремонтировать свой мини маркет.

loans.use: Store renovation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Ten years ago at the age of 27, this young man decided to start his own business.  He and his family live in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. Saleh is married, and has one child. He needs a loan of $1200 to purchase pesticides so that he can improve his orchard farming and enjoy a rich harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Gamar

texts.en:
Gamar is a mother of 3 children, and lives in Gardili village, in the Salyan region. She is 39 years old. Eight years ago Gamar started her own business.
Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides for improving her orchard farming.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Seymur

texts.ru:
Seymur M. was born in 1980. He lives in Aksu. Seymur has been in auto repair business for more than 8 years. He is a great mechanic. To produce quality job, he was lacking modern tools. Seymur used his first NorMicro loan to purchase some new tools. Now he asks to borrow more money to complete his tools inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мамедов Сеймур.1980 года рождения. Проживает в городе Аксу. Более 8-и лет занимаеться ремонтом автомобиля.Семейный, имеет двоих детей. Этот молодой человек прекрасный мастер.Для качественный работы не хватало современного оборудивания.Сеймур обратилься Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Он взял кредит и купил необходимые инструменты.Теперь еще хочеть взять кредит.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Asif

texts.ru:
Asif Karimiv was born in 1966. He lives in Aksu. Asif is married and has 4 children. This hardworking man has been a barber for 20 years. To provide for his large family, Asif must work more than the others. Asif used a $500 loan from NorMicro to renovate his barber shop. Now, he needs another loan to purchase new tools.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримов Асиф.Родилься 1966 году и проживает в городе Аксу. Семейный, имеет четверо детей. Этот трудолюбивый человек уже как 20 лет работает парикмахером.Большая семья вынуждает этого мастера работат больше и дольше всех. Асиф взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала 500$. Сделал ремонт в своем мастерском. Сейчас хочет купить инвентарь.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: This 37-year-old man lives in Hasanli village, in the Salyan region. He is married, and has one child. Chingiz has had 5 years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides for improving his orchard farming.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides

loans.name: Gubakhanim

texts.en: Gubakhanim is a mother of  one child. This 47-year-old woman lives in  Khaladj village, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan, where she has owned and operated a vineyard for the past 15 years. She has applied for a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides that will allow her to increase the quality  of her vines.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en: Shalala is a mother of two children, and lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. She is 36 years old. She has been in the farming business for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en: Vusala S. is a 27-year-old single girl who lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. She has 3 years of experience in this business.  Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Shahmar

texts.en: Shahmar has been in this business for 5 years. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. The A. family lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. Now he needs a loan of $1075 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.en: Ilkin has a small shop where he sells spare parts. He has had his business for 3 years, and it allows him to support his family. He is 28 years old,  married, and lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. Ilkin doesn't have any children.  He is applying for a loan of $950 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Khalig

texts.en: Khalig is 43 years old and lives in Gardili village, in the Salyan region. He is married and has two children. Khalig breeds calves. He supports his family with this business. Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy baling presses. He wants to improve his business and income. He has run this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase baling presses

loans.name: Cefesina Niese

texts.en:
Cefesina, 23 years old, owns a little grocery store (colmado) which she started two years ago. She’s living with her 3-year-old daughter and had been separated from her daughter’s father. Bread, juice, tomato paste, peas, spices are some of the foodstuffs that are sold in her grocery store.

Cefesina needs a loan to remodel her ‘colmado’. She plans to buy lumber and sheet iron and pay a craftsman to do the job. She will also use some of the money to buy more products like flour, sugar and other foodstuffs that people in the community frequently need.

loans.use: To buy lumber, sheet iron and other articles to remodel and stock her little grocery store

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida is a mother of one child. She is a widow. Valida and her child live in Khachmaz town. She has been selling phone accessories for 2 years. This 43-year-old woman needs a loan of $600 to purchase phone accessories so that she can increase the number of her clients.

loans.use: To increase the number of phone accessories

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rudelania

texts.en:
Rudelania, 21, is living with her daughter, 4 years old. Before her daughter’s birth, she separated from her partner, and since then she has been working to earn their living and tend to the child.

Rudelania owns a small beauty salon and offers hairdos and hair straightening. She also sells cosmetic products and other items like shampoo, hand and body lotion, beauty and medical soap.

Now, Rudelania is requesting a loan with the intention of purchasing the entire line of Jafra skin care products, since they’re well appreciated by the women of her community. She also wants to buy a showcase where she can put her new products in order to make them known to her clientele. This way, she’ll be able to increase her income and do her best for the sake of her beloved little daughter.

loans.use: To buy Jafra skin care products to introduce in her business and to buy a showcase to put these products in

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Since she and her husband split 3 years ago, Dominga, 47, has had to work hard so as to survive and feed her 3 children. She earns a living selling clothes for children, curtains, bed sheets and shoes for men. She walks around the streets and goes door-to-door to sell her products, since her house is too narrow and not handy for her customers.

As the holiday season is coming, Dominga needs a loan to purchase a large amount of the products she’s selling, especially clothes for children. Indeed, this period is usually the high season for selling clothes.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothes, curtains and shoes to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan is a 33 year-old widow with 3 children. She lives in Seyidlar village, in the Khachmaz region. Reyhan has had this business for three years.  She has been growing vegetables, in order to support her family. Now she needs a loan of $725 to purchase seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: The Kamilov family lives in Seyidlar village, in the Khachmaz region. Svetlana has 3 children who she supports. Svetlana has raised calves and cows for 5 years. This 57-year-old woman needs a loan of $725 to purchase a cow to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Yubelkis

texts.en:
It hasn't been long since this woman of 23 years old began her business, selling clothes for women, in order to earn a living and fend for her 2-year-old son. Like many young girls in Dominican Republic, Yubelkis left school after her pregnancy. Now, she’s living with her partner, a young man who is working as a pastry cook.

Yubelkis wants to increase her sales volume in order help her partner pay for their rented house, buy food for the baby, and face other issues. She plans to increase her inventory, selling underwear for men and women as well as toiletry articles like soaps, deodorants, perfumes and hand and body lotion.

Yubelkis is very positive regarding the future and is convinced that a loan will help her carry out her plans. She also hopes to set aside money to take special courses at a college very soon, in order to become educated and have a career.

loans.use: To buy underwear and toiletry articles in order to diversify her inventory

loans.name: Vusala

texts.en: Vusala is a widow and she doesn't have a child. This 26-year-old young woman lives in Khachmaz town. She buys foodstuffs (tea, butter, etc.) and then she disburses these foodstuffs wholesale to market. Vusala has been a wholesale merchant for 2 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy foodstuffs to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en: Parvana is a mother of 2 children, and a widow. She is 47 years old, and lives in the town of Khachmaz. This young woman has been in this business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to purchase a cow, to get more milk and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: María Eusebia

texts.en:
María is the kind of person who thinks that getting older is not synonymous for sluggishness but an opportunity to keep working and positively impacting society. Mother of 2 children (boy and girl), this woman of 48 years old is happily selling second-hand clothes and cosmetic products. She started the business when she was 40 and is still working to improve it day by day.

María has been selling the products in her house and sometimes delivering the goods to the customers’ houses, but now, she plans to do business in another way. She will buy used clothes in bulk, wholesale, and resell them in smaller quantities (retail wholesale) to other women of the community who will then retail the clothes. However, she’ll keep on selling the cosmetic products retail.

Furthermore, María wants to rent a small place to store the merchandise purchased. She believes that her new business ideas will be successful since the holiday season is when people buy a lot of clothes in her community. Earning extra money will help her cover the university expenses of her children.

loans.use: To buy in bulk used clothes to resell to other women in the community who will then sell them retail

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia is 28 years old; mother of two small children of ages 4 and 3; a hard worker and self-sacrificing; and she learned the importance of work as a young child. At the moment she is dedicated to two activities: selling watches and manufacturing decorative articles. This way she is able to work while taking care of her children at her house that she rented not long ago near the market. She starts selling her articles at 8 in the morning and finishes around 7 at night always accompanied by her lovely and inseparable daughter. Her wish is to increase the variety of her products to increase her income in order to improve the living quality for her family. She is seeking at $450 loan to use to increase her capital to invest and improve her stock of merchandise. Ignacia is looking forward to your help.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Ignacia tiene 28 años, es madre de dos pequeños niños de 4 y 3 años de edad, abnegada y muy laboriosa, desde muy jovencita conoció el valor significativo del trabajo. Actualmente dedica su tiempo a desarrollar dos actividades, la venta de relojes y la fabricación de artículos decorativos, así mismo estas labores las realiza mientras cuida a sus pequeños en un domicilio que alquiló hace poco tiempo cerca del mercado. Inicia su oferta de artículos a las 8:00 de la mañana y la culmina a las 7:00 de la noche acompañada siempre de su querida e inseparable hijita, el deseo que tiene es aumentar la variedad de sus productos para incrementar sus ingresos económicos a fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, para este propósito solicita un préstamo de 450 dólares dinero que utilizará para acrecentar su capital de inversión y mejorar el stock de su mercadería. Ignacia, espera tu colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase more watches and decorative articles.

loans.name: Gusbinda

texts.es:
Gusbinda is mother of two young children who are still in their early stages of childhood. She lives with her husband who is dedicated to providing classes in a center for primary education. Due to a lack of budget to cover personal expenses, it occurred to Gusbinda to provide her neighbors with portable water from installing networks of tubes outside of her house. Since the majority of the residences in her neighborhood lack this portable water, she decided to provide it. This activity has provided a significant income every month with which she can help her husband and improve the quality of life for her family. With the daily demand, she has plans to continue expanding her distribution network to provide faster and better service to each of her clients. She is seeking a $675 loan to purchase more tubes and will return the loan in 6 months. The loan will fulfill Gusbinda’s wishes so that more families can have access to this important and vital service.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.<.p> Gusbinda es madre de dos pequeños que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar, vive con su esposo que se dedica a brindar clases en un centro de educación primaria; por falta de presupuesto para cubrir los gastos familiares a la reina de la casa se le ocurrió proveer a sus vecinos de agua potable por medio de redes de tuberías que instaló en las afueras de su hogar; debido a que en el lugar de su residencia la mayoría de los moradores carecen de este liquido elemento.Esta actividad le viene generando importantes sumas de dinero mensualmente con el que apoya a su esposo e incrementa la calidad de vida de su familia.A raíz de la demanda diaria tiene planes de seguir ampliando su red de distribución con el propósito de otorgarles un rápido y mejor servicio a cada uno de sus clientes.Para este fin hace una solicitud de 675 dólares para comprar más tubos, así mismo el importe solicitado les será devuelto en 6 meses. Ayudemos a realizar el anhelo de Gusbinda para que más familias de su localidad puedan acceder a este importante y vital servicio

loans.use: To acquire tubes.

loans.name: Hassna

texts.en: Hassana, 56-years old, is a divorced mother with three children. Hassana 's children live with their father while she lives with her parents in a little village close to Tyre, South of Lebanon. She works as a cleaning employee and earns $200 per month. It is not much, but she helps her parents with the daily home expenses and she regularly sends money to help with her children's expenses as their father is not able to cover all expenses alone. This is the first time Hassana requests a loan from Al Majmoua. She requests a loan for $600 to buy new clothes, school books and stationery for her children as school will start soon.

loans.use: To buy new clothes, school books and stationery for her three children

loans.name: Deyda Doris

texts.es:
Deyda is mother of three children, two of whom are studying in a secondary school center of her neighborhood and the eldest recently became independent to form and take care of his own family. She started selling fruits at a small table at her old house. With the help of the municipality, she was able to obtain a piece of land where she is currently living and working. She is selling soda and other drinks along with her fruit collection. Her husband’s help is unconditional and aside from the fact that he works in a lumber factory on the outskirts of the city, he covers the family expenses and the education of his sons which demands a lot of money. Because of this necessity and demand for money, it is very important that he is successful in his work. With the loan, Deyda will be able to purchase a thermal box where she can put her cold drinks where they lack electric service in their zone of residence. They are seeking a loan of $150 and will return it in 6 months with the hope to improve her service and satisfy the needs of her new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Deyda es madre de tres niños, dos de ellos estan estudian en un centro educativo secundario de su localidad y el mayor hace poco que se independizó para formar y velar por su propia familia; Ella empezó vendiendo frutas en una mesita pequeña en su antiguo domicilio, con apoyo de la municipalidad logró obtener un terreno en el que actualmente habita y ha reiniciado su actividad de venta de frutas complementandolo ahora también con bebidas gaseosas y refrescos; el apoyo de su esposo es incondicional y a pesar de que trabaja en una empresa maderera ubicada fuera de la ciudad, la cobertura de los gastos familiares y la educación de sus dos hijos les demanda mucho dinero.A raíz de esto es que la necesidad urgente y primordial para el exitoso desempeño de su labor es la compra de una caja térmica en el que podrá mantener las bebidas heladas y frescas en vista de que carecen del servicio eléctrico en su zona de residencia. Para ello necesita en calidad de préstamo el importe de 150 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de seis meses, con el piensa mejorar su servicio y satisfacer las necesidades y peticiones de sus nuevos clientes.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and a thermal box to keep drinks cold.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel works washing clothing and has contracts with the embroiderers and exclusively washes folkloric clothing. She is separated from her husband and has one son. Her work is the only source of income in her home.

Her home is located in the zone called Llojeta, in the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested a loan from our institution. The money is to buy a clothes dryer. Her work makes her eligible for this loan. She has the experience in her business, and our analysis of her cash flow shows it is sufficient to cover this loan and her particular needs.

Mabel se dedica al lavado de ropa, ya que tiene contratos con los bordadores y exclusivamente lava la ropa folklórica. Tiene un hijo y esta separada de su esposo por lo que esta actividad es la única fuente de ingreso en su hogar. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito con nuestra Institución. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una secadora para que le pueda facilitar el secado de la ropa. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y el flujo de caja analizado muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades particulares.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will use this loan to purchase a clothing dryer for her laundry business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica has a small shop where she sells handicraft clothing exclusively. (specifically skirts, ponchos and footwear) Her husband works as an attendant in a gym. Their home is located in the zone called Alto Chijini, in the city of La Paz, and the shop is located in the zone called El Rosario.

This is the first time she has requested a loan. She will use the money to buy clothing in bulk from her suppliers. Her business makes her eligible for this loan. She has commercial experience and the shop is situated in one of the most commercial and popular areas of the city of La Paz.

Veronica tiene un puesto donde vende exclusivamente ropa para cholita (específicamente polleras, mantas y calzados) y su esposo trabaja atendiendo un gimnasio. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz y su puesto esta ubicado en la zona El Rosario. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de ropa por docena, de sus proveedores. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia de comerciante además que su puesto esta ubicado en una de las zonas más comerciales y populares de la ciudad de La Paz.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy merchandise for their clothing business.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh, 26-years old, lives with her parents and younger brothers in the little village of Jal El Bahar, close to Tyr, South Lebanon. She is employed in a small "lingerie" shop and earns limited wages of $200 per month. Fatmeh is the main breadwinner of the family, because her father, a daily worker, does not have a regular income. This month, she will use her last year's savings to pay for her brother's school fees and stationery. But Fatmeh needs medical treatment and lacks the funds to cover this unexpected expense. She is requesting a loan for $500 to cover these medical expenses.

loans.use: To cover medical treatment expenses

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela has a small general store where she sells soft drinks, rice, noodles, sugar, crackers, etc. Her home is located in the zone called Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. This is the second time she has requested a loan. Her previous loan qualified her as a good client as she complied with the terms of the loan. She will use the money to buy merchandise, and maintain her store with enough products to meet the demands of her customers. Her business qualifies her to receive this credit. She has experience in her business, and the income she generates is enough to cover this loan.

Pamela tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende refrescos, arroz, fideo, azúcar, galletas, etc. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su antecedente crediticio la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( arroz, fideo, azúcar, galletas y otros) y mantener su tienda con mercaderia suficiente para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her small general store. (soft drinks, rice, noodles, sugar, crackers, etc. )

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat, 53-years old, married and mother of two children, runs a small clothing business in the village of Deir Qanoun, close to the city of Tyre, South Lebanon. In order to adapt to the financial situation of the people living in her neighborhood, she offers a large variety of clothes in different price ranges. She buys cheap clothes from Syria and sells them at affordable prices to low income households. She also buys good quality clothes from Dubai that she sells to financially better-off families. Hayat started to buy goods from Dubai after her elder son moved there.  

This is the second time Fatmeh requests a loan from Al Majmoua. She is requesting a loan of $600 so her son can purchase scarves and women's underwear in Dubai and ship the goods to Lebanon. 

Fatmeh is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: To purchase of scarves and women's underwear and increase the inventory of her clothing shop

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza works selling clothing on credit, and her husband installs gas meters. Their home is located in the zone called Nueva Potosi, in the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested a loan. The money will be used to cover medical costs for her husband, who hurt his ankle in an accident and has to be in a cast during his recovery. It's important to emphasize that her husband is not healthy, and the financial situation of the family could be at risk. It for this reason that IMPRO supports this loan. Her work makes her eligible for this credit because she already has experience in her business.

Maritza se dedica a la venta de ropa a crédito y su esposo realiza instalación de medidores de gas. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la curación médica de su esposo ya que tuvo un accidente del tobillo y tiene que ser enyesado para su recuperación. Es importante recalcar que si el esposo no sana, la situación financiera de la familia podría estar en riesgo; por esta razón es que IMPRO apoya a este crédito. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She needs help covering the medical costs for her husband after his accident.  The financial well being of the family is at risk.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 43-years old, married and mother of two children, runs a small shop in the little village of Deir Qanoun, close to the city of Tyre, South Lebanon. She produces traditional food and Lebanese mixtures of cooking spices that she sells in her neighborhood to women who neither have the skills nor the time to prepare these products. For example, Fatmeh prepares a large variety of jams, marmalades, pickles, tomato pasta, fresh dried herbs and spices, herbal tea, etc.

Fatmeh and her family live in an economically vulnerable situation: she is the sole breadwinner of the family as her physically disabled husband is not able to work and to generate an income. 

This is the second time Fatmeh requests a loan from Al Majmoua. She is requesting a loan for $400 to purchase new equipment and a stock of fresh spices. 

Fatmeh is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment, like a small mixer, and a stock of fresh spices

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is 28 years old and has 3 children. They live on Avenue Buenos Aires in the zone called Tembladerani in the city of La Paz, in the house of her parents. Blanca works selling hats, as well as gifts, in the entrances to the neighborhoods. In addition to this activity, she began to sell flowers in the Rodrigues market. She will use the loan to increase her capital and buy more flowers for this new business.

With her previous history with Impro, (she has been a client since 2005), and her history of making payments, Blanca qualifies for a new loan.

Blanca tiene 28 años de edad y tiene tres hijos con quienes vive en la Av. Buenos Aires de la zona de tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. Blanca se dedica a la venta de gorras y también vende regalos en las puertas de los locales; además de esta actividad empezó con la venta de flores en el mercado Rodríguez y el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y asi comprar mas flores y mejorar su nuevo negocio. Por su antecedente histórico con Impro (ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005) y su historial de pagos, Blanca puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She will this loan to buy more merchandise and build her business.

loans.name: Judith Emilia

texts.es:
Judith is a talented young woman who has tried to give the best of herself throughout her life. Her desire to excel brought her to study cosmetology in an occupational training center, a profession to which she currently devotes herself and which has brought her much satisfaction. She is also a mother of a little girl that she cares for with all her heart and who has become the reason for living each day with optimism in spite of being a single mother. Her husband left and abandoned them, never to return. She is eager to formally open a beauty shop in a local shopping plaza in the city, hoping to give her only daughter a more proper life. She is asking for a loan of $200 with the promise of returning it in six months. We support Judith in her goals, and with your help, she can do it.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Judith es una joven mujer talentosa que a lo largo de su vida se ha esforzado por dar siempre lo mejor de si. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a estudiar cosmetología en un centro de formación ocupacional, profesión a la que se dedica actualmente y la ha llenado de muchas satisfacciones. Es también madre de una niña a la que cuida con todo su amor y se ha convertido en el motivo por el cual vive cada día con optimismo a pesar de que su esposo no vive con ella; ya que se marchó y las abandonó para jamás volver.Ella anhela abrir formalmente su centro de belleza en un local céntrico de su ciudad con el propósito de poder brindarle una vida más decorosa a su única hija, solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en seis meses.Apoyemos a Judith a cumplir su anhelo, con tu colaboración podrá hacerlo.

loans.use: Setting up a beauty salon in local shopping plaza

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is 29 years old and lives in Huallparrimachi Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in the city of La Paz with his parents. Since he was a small boy, he has devoted himself to sewing and works alongside his mother and siblings making skirts. The credit he's requesting is to purchase a machine for weaving blankets; with this he can expand his business and improve his income.

Manuel requested his first loan through IMPRO in January of this year and it is already completely paid off. This credit record qualifies him to accept a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Manuel tiene 29 años de edad y vive en la calle Huallparrimachi de la zona de tembladerani de La Ciudad de La paz en casa de sus padres; desde muy pequeño se dedica a la costura y trabaja junto con su mama y sus hermanos en la confección de polleras. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina para tejer mantas y con esto poder ampliar su negocio y poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Manuel solicitó su primer credito con IMPRO en Enero de este año y a la fecha ya está completamente pagado. Este antecedente histórico lo califica para acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of machine for weaving blankets

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a courageous woman who has secured the well being of her only son, her reason for living, for many years. He is now a good and useful man to society, which is reason enough to fill his loving mother with pleasure and motivate her to be successful. Through the years, she has performed several tasks such as hand-weaving garments, the distribution of products, and so on. But the main task that she currently performs is embroidery and the application of sequins to blouses that she sells as handicrafts. Thanks to her consistency, Yolanda has seen her business grow to the point that it can sustain her economically. Her great love for her son urges her to keep making progress, and that's why she requests a loan of $675 to rent a small craft shop in the middle of her city and formally offer her goods safely and in a sufficently large space. We support Yolanda's continuing growth, and we're counting on you.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Yolanda es una mujer coraje, que durante varios años le ha procurado bienestar a su único hijo, quién se ha convertido en su razón de vivir; él ahora es todo un hombre de bien y útil a la sociedad, razones suficientes que llenan de satisfacción a su amorosa madre y la motivan a desempeñarse con éxito.A través de los años ha desempeñado múltiples oficios como la fabricación de prendas tejidas a mano, la siembra de productos, etc. Pero la tarea principal y la que actualmente ejerce es la de bordado y aplicación de lentejuelas a las blusas que comercializa como artesanía.Gracias a su constancia Yolanda ha visto crecer su negocio que le permite sostenerse económicamente así mismo el inmenso amor de su único hijo la impulsan a seguir progresando, es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 675 dólares para poder arrendar un pequeño local artesanal en el centro de su ciudad y así ofrecer sus productos de manera formal con seguridad y en un espacio adecuado.Apoyemos a Yolanda a seguir creciendo, contamos contigo.

loans.use: Renting a local shop for the sale of handicrafts

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan is a young man who decided to make the land he was born in grow. After several years of working outside his native land, he nostalgically returned to it and dedicated himself to planting corn, potato, and alfalfa. He accomplishes this through the cultivation of his own land and others that he has rented. He sells his harvest in a local market, and with a great deal of effort has managed to increase his production little by little. Thanks to his investment, he has seen his earnings increase month by month, and these bring him his daily wages and the full satisfaction of his needs. With his constant hard work, he has decided to continue expanding his labor in order to diversify his crops and bring employment to more farmers in his community. Bringing about his goal requires a loan of $375, which will permit him to purchase better seeds and optimize his yearly planting. He requests your generous support in his goal of quickly making his plans a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Juan es un joven que se decidió a progresar en la tierra que lo vió nacer y tras varios años de laborar fuera de su tierra natal, regreso a ella con nostalgia y se dedicó a la siembra de maíz, papa y alfalfa.Esta actividad la realiza a través del cultivo de sus propias tierras y otras que ha arrendado; la cosecha que obtiene la lleva para comercializarla en el mercado local, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar poco a poco su producción y también gracias a la inversión que hizo ha visto aumentar sus ganancias mes a mes, estas a su vez le permiten el sustento diario y la satisfacción plena de sus necesidades.Con su constante forma de trabajo ha tomado la decisión de seguir ampliando su campo de acción con el propósito de masificar sus productos de cultivo y otorgarle empleo a más campesinos de su comunidad.Para llevar a cabo este anhelo requiere un préstamo por 375 dólares, esta cantidad le permitirá adquirir mejor calidad de semillas para optimizar su siembra anual. Solicita tu generoso apoyo con el objetivo de concretar sus planes en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds.

loans.name: Cecilia Pilar

texts.es:
Cecilia is a talented young woman who finished her technical degree in Information Technology in an excellent special training center in her city. Sadly, due to the lack of labor opportunities, she was unable to find a job. Two years ago, she decided to open a small Internet cafe service. Ever since that day she works tirelessly and that effort has brought her rapid success. In a short time, she has reached the goals she outlined, and also contributes economically to her family's financial well-being. She feels very good that she is able to repay her parents somehow for the efforts they made for her. Judith doesn't want the fruit of her labor to stop increasing, so she is turning to you to ask for a loan of $100 to use for upgrading her computers and not have to see her prosperous business disappear. We support this talented woman in moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia es una joven talentosa, que terminó su carrera técnica de computación e informática en un centro de especialización superior de su ciudad; lamentablemente debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales no logró encontrar trabajo, así que ella decidió hace dos años abrir una pequeña cabina para prestar servicios de internet.Desde aquel día ella trabaja incansablemente y dicho esfuerzo la ha llevado al éxito en poco tiempo ha alcanzado sus metas trazadas y además ahora aporta económicamente al bienestar familiar hecho que la llena de orgullo y la hace sentir muy bien ya que puede retribuir de alguna manera el esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres por ella.Judith no quiere que el fruto de su trabajo termine marchitándose es por ello que recurre a ustedes para solicitar un préstamo de 100 dólares con los que podrá repotenciar sus máquinas y no ver su próspero negocio desaparecer.Apoyemos a una joven talentosa a salir adelante

loans.use: Computer upgrades

loans.name: Jesús Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz is a hard-working woman, mother of three, two of whom are studying and the youngest of whom is still at home with her. This fills her with satisfaction and gives her the strength to move ahead with her work. She has a vehicle which for 10 years has covered a long route on a daily basis, from her location in Hualhuas to Huancayo and then on to San Jeronimo. Thanks to this she along with her husband can support the household, after years of failure during which none of the activities they attempted gave them the wellbeing and satisfaction as the one to which they now dedicate themselves full-time. Now this vehicle needs some parts so that it along with its four wheels can continue to carry the dreams of an entire family, for which she requests a loan of 100 dollars in order to stay on the course to her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Holmes, Kiva volunteer.

Emperatriz es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre de tres niños, dos de ellos están estudiando y el más pequeño aún permanece con ella en casa; esto la llena de satisfacción y fuerzas para poder seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza. Ella tiene un vehículo de transporte desde hace 10 años que diariamente cubre una ruta larga. Se desplaza desde su localidad Hualhuas hasta Huancayo y de allí a San Jerónimo.Gracias a esta movilidad de transporte puede sostener al lado de su esposo la economía de su hogar tras pasados años de fracaso en el que ninguna de las actividades que lograron realizar les otorgó bienestar y satisfacción como éste al cual se dedican ahora por completo.Hoy esta unidad de transporte requiere la compra de algunos repuestos para poder seguir llevando con ayuda de sus 4 ruedas los sueños de toda una familia, por ello solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares para realizar su propósito en corto tiempo y seguir la ruta de sus sueños.

loans.use: To purchase parts for a vehicle used to generate income for a family.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley is an elementary school teacher in her town. She lives with her husband and is also responsible for the wellbeing of her parents, who are elderly and unable to work for health reasons. Fate gave her no children but she tries hard to keep her parents happy and satisfied. He teaching job is part-time which has allowed her to install a mini market in her own home. Her husband is a bus driver and services a route covering the streets of the city of Pucallpa. Both are very dedicated to and responsible in their work. She proposes to expand her mini market for the comfort of her customers who would like to chat while they enjoy a soda pop or fruit punch. She also would like to buy a scooter to increase the family’s income. For these purposes she needs a loan of 1,000 dollars, financed over six months, with which she wants to complete the remodel of her store and repair the vehicle driven by her husband. Let’s help Shirley make her dreams come true by giving her what she needs in order to continue progressing economically.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Holmes, Kiva volunteer.

Shirley, es profesora del nivel primario en un centro educativo de su ciudad, vive con su esposo y de ella depende el bienestar de sus padres porque son ya muy ancianitos y no pueden desempeñar ninguna actividad por los males que siempre los aquejan, por cosas del destino no tiene hijos, pero si se esmera por tener contentos y muy satisfechos a sus padres, El trabajo de profesora es a tiempo compartido y esto le ha permitido instalar un minimarket en su propia casa, su esposo es chofer y brinda servicios de transporte público por las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa, ambos son muy dedicados y responsables en sus ocupaciones. Ella se ha propuesto ampliar las instalaciones de su lugar de ventas para comodidad de los clientes que desean platicar mientras beben una agua y/o refrescos, también desea comprar un motocar con el propósito de incrementar sus ingresos familiares, Para este propósito requiere un préstamo de 1000 dólares, financiados en 6 meses con los que desea hacer las renovaciones del local y reparar el vehículo que es conducido por su esposo. Ayudemos a Shirley a cristalizar sus anhelos brindándole lo que necesita con el fin de que siga progresando familiar y económicamente..

loans.use: Expand minimarket and repair vehicle used to provide public transportation.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny makes cleaning products such as chlorine, water softener, and disinfectants. She has been working for five years in this business. Fanny learned how to make these products from a friend. With her savings she began produce the products and her first client was the high school where she worked. Her clients are primary schools, high schools, and her neighbors. She makes her sales during the afternoon, with the help of her daughter. She also has other sources of income because she is an inspector at a high school. She also tutors children with learning difficulties at her home.

She will use this loan in a similar way as she used a previous one and she will buy the raw materials to produce her products in larger volumes: chlorine, creosote, water softener, disinfectants, and acid. Fanny was very successful with the loan she received several months ago and is anxious to continue investing in her business. She now has the flexibility to offer more products and more varieties of fragrances.

Fanny was born in Manabí. She is 41 years old. She has two children. The older one is already working and her daughter helps her with the business. Her husband works as a driver for a business and on his days off he helps his wife deliver her products. They are a couple that is very willing to work hard to get ahead, and they are always learning something new. Thanks to their incomes, they have been able to improve their house and increase their business. Their aspiration is to grow their customer base.

loans.use: Buy materials and ingredients necessary to make her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy laundry products such as detergent and bleach.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase produce and live pigs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand existing restaurant and help his daughter set up a beauty salon in their home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more spare parts to repair broken electronics and resell them.

loans.name: María Rita

texts.es:
Maria is a stoic mother who despite the problems she had when she lost her shop, has not lost hope of moving forward. She lives alone with her husband who continues to work with the only tool he has, despite his health problems, in order to secure the wellbeing of his caring partner. Maria is the mother of three children who have formed their own families and have decided to build their homes away from the parents’ house. Thanks to the upbringing and good values she instilled in them at a very young age they live their lives responsibly and respectfully, to the pride of their parents. She has a lot of ideas in mind and to make them concrete step by step she first needs to invest in her small shop. This will allow her to grow economically. She requests 300 dollars for the purpose of acquiring a greater quantity and variety of goods to offer them to customers in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Holmes, Kiva volunteer.

Maria es una abnegada madre que a pesar de los problemas que tuvo al perder su pequeña bodega, no pierde las esperanzas de surgir, vive sólo con su esposo que a pesar del mal que sufre no deja de trabajar con la única herramienta que tiene para procurarle bienestar a su amorosa compañera, Es madre de tres hijos que han conformado sus propias familias y han decidido construir su hogar fuera de la casa paterna; gracias a la educación y buenos valores que les inculcó desde muy pequeños se conducen con mucha responsabilidad y respeto para orgullo de sus padres. Tiene muchos propósitos en mente y para concretarlos poco a poco primero necesita invertir en su pequeña bodega, esta le permitirá crecer económica y familiarmente.Hace una petición de 300 dólares con el objetivo de adquirir más cantidad y mayor variedad de artículos de primera necesidad para ofertarlos a los clientes de su comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more produce and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in seafood and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy new products for her store.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila lives with her husband and three small children who attend school. She works selling sweets and regional fruits from the area from a small stand in her home. She started the business on her own initiative after seeing that the salary of her husband was not sufficient to cover the cost to educate and feed her family.

Her house is located in front of a community park where children and adults go every day to get some exercise, or simply have a chat. This location allows Domitilato to sell her products more easily. Her husband works nights as a driver for the municipality of Pucallpa, and is paid only a minimum salary for his work. He contributes this to the household and education expenses for his children.

Domitila and her husband's desire is to continue growing the business with the construction of a stand in their patio. For this, they need a loan of $250 which they will repay in 6 months. For the urgent need of Domitila and her family, let's help secure her dreams to improve the quality of life for her family and the education of her children.

Domitila vive son su esposo y sus tres pequeños niños en edad escolar actualmente se dedica a la venta de dulces y frutas regionales de la zona en un pequeño espacio de su domicilio. El negocio lo inició por iniciativa propia en vista de que el sueldo del esposo no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos de educación y alimentación de su familia, su casa está ubicada frente al parque de la comunidad que frecuentan niños, jóvenes y adultos diariamente para recrearse o simplemente charlar, el cuál le permite comercializar sus productos con mucha acogida.Su esposo trabaja como chofer en el horario nocturno de la municipalidad de Pucallpa, y por su labor percibe un sueldo mínimo, con el que contribuye a satisfacer los gastos familiares y la educación de sus retoños. El anhelo de Domitila y su esposo es seguir creciendo y mejorar el negocio con la construcción de un stand en el patio de su casa y para ello necesita la suma de 250 dólares en calidad de préstamo para ser retornados en un período de 6 meses, por ser de necesidad urgente para ella y su familia, ayudemos a concretar los sueños de Domitila y a contribuir con mejorar la condición de vida familiar y la educación de sus niños.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USED TO CONSTRUCT A SMALL STAND, AND TO BUY FRUITS AND SWEETS TO SELL.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela lives with her much loved husband, and even though they are getting older, both of them continue working for their vocation and desire to serve their fellow citizens. Their children are grown up and independent, each with their own family. They began their business activities selling everyday items with financial support from their children. Ater her husband retired, they wanted to be able to continue with their own business to cover the costs for the public services they received from the city. The small shop is busy every day and they begin work early in the morning and continue until late at night, due to the constant presence of their neighbors. To satisfy the demands of their customers, they need to expand the stock of items they offer. For that, they need a loan of $400 which they will repay in 6 months. Manuela's efforts serve the public, and give an example that for work, there is no "right" age. Let's make it possible for them to realize their objectives with our support.

La señora Manuela vive sola en compañía de su querido esposo, a pesar de la avanzada edad de ambos continúan trabajando por vocación y deseos de servir al prójimo. Sus hijos son mayores e independientes y cada uno cuenta con su familia. Iniciaron sus actividades con el comercio de artículos de primera necesidad con el apoyo económico que le brindaron sus hijos después que su esposo se jubiló para que pudieran tener una actividad en la que puedan continuar trabajando por cuenta propia y con el objetivo de costearse los gastos por los servicios públicos que reciben en la ciudad. La bodega la tiene ocupada todo el día y empieza sus labores muy temprano y las culmina muy entrada la noche; debido a la concurrida presencia de sus vecinos. Con el objetivo de satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes necesita aumentar el stock de artículos para satisfacerlos plenamente. Para ello necesita el apoyo económico en calidad de préstamo por el importe de 400 dólares que los devolverá en un plazo de seis meses. Siendo los deseos de Manuela servir a la colectividad dando el ejemplo que para el trabajo no hay edad. Hagamos que en poco tiempo pueda concretar sus deseos con nuestro apoyo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY EVERYDAY ITEMS WHICH SHE SELLS FROM HER STAND.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more plain coffins and the materials he needs to improve them.

loans.name: Mirdamet

texts.en: Mirdamet A. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is 43 years old, is married and has five children. Mirdamet is a low income person. He is engaged in cattle and sheep breeding. He has 2 cows and 15 sheep. He wants to increase the number of his sheep, so he applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan. He needs a loan in the amount of $800 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: Mirdamet would like to buy 10 sheep to breed.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en: Sabir A. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old, is married and has five children. Sabir is engaged in sheep-breeding. He has 15 years experience in this business. He has been a client of normicro since 2004. His son helps him at his job. Every year Sabir borrows loans and increases his business. He wants to buy more sheep, so he needs $600 to buy 7 sheep.

loans.use: Sabir would like to buy sheep.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Refugia

texts.es:
The rainy season is approaching and the roof of my home has many leaks and I would like to waterproof my home. Because of this, my grandchildren are often ill. I am requesting $1,200 to waterproof the roof to my home.

Translated from Spanish by Christian García, Kiva Volunteer.

“Se acerca la temporada de lluvia y el techo de mi casa tiene muchas goteras así es que me gustaría poder impermeabilizar para evitar que trasmine el agua y que pase la humedad, ya que tengo nietos que debido a esto siempre se enferman”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para impermeabilizar el techo de mi casa.

loans.use:
Waterproofing my home

Impermeabilización de mi vivienda

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Herlindo

texts.es:
“My home has a roof made of wood and laminate and when it rains water leaks in and the home becomes very cold. As the winter season approaches, I would like to replace the roof with one made of concrete to avoid this from happening and provide more comfort to my family. I request $1,000 to construct a roof made from concrete to my home.”

Translated from Spanish by Christian García, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un techo de madera y lamina en mi casa y debido a eso cuando llueve entra mucha agua y también pasa mucho el frío, la temporada se acerca y me gustaría poner un techo de concreto para evitar que esto pase y que mi familia tenga más comodidad” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para hacer un techo de concreto en mi vivienda.

loans.use:
Construct a concrete roof

Poner techo de concreto

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is a young lady of twenty three years of age, who is living with her parents. She just finished school and could not find a job. Then she joined to the SPBD program and applied her first loan of US $300 to start her small shop business. She used the loan to buy some stock for her store, especially the most necessary ones such as snack foods, drinks, and cigarettes. Even though she  she’s doing well,  Viola thinks she should increase her stock in order to gain more profit. She hopes her next loan will use for re-stocking and will help build the business.  Viola also believes if her business does well, then she can develop her family by herself.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Cetty

texts.es:
Cetty is a loving and diligent mother. She has 8 children, her youngest three still live with her and attend school at the city education center. She works every day in a shop in her small home, which she set up with the help of her older children. She also counts on a monthly income she gets from selling items in a small village near the Ucayali river, with the help of her oldest daughter who works as a teacher in that town. With the combined income from these activities she is able to take good care of the children who still live with her. After a careful evaluation, she has proposed that she increase the stock in her small shop to meet the requests of the families who live near the river, so they don't have to buy them in the market. With this extra money, the family would be able to improve their quality of life and education. She is requesting a loan of $500, which she will use to grow her business. Let's help her realize her goals with our generous support.

Cetty, es una amorosa y diligente madre, tiene ocho hijos y mantiene guarecidos en el seno de su hogar sólo a tres de ellos; debido a que aún son muy pequeños y se encuentran estudiando en un centro educativo de su hermosa ciudad. Desempeña sus labores diarias en una pequeña bodega que instaló, con ayuda de sus hijos mayores, en un espacio de su humilde morada. Adicionalmente cuenta con un ingreso mensual que obtiene por los artículos que comercializa en un pequeño pueblo que se ubica en el margen del río Ucayali, con ayuda de su hija mayor que trabaja como maestra en un centro educativo de ese lugar. Con la suma de estos ingresos puede otorgarles bienestar a los niños que aún viven con ella.Así mismo luego de haber hecho una evaluación rigurosa se ha propuesto incrementar el stock de su pequeña bodega con el propósito de abastecer los pedidos que realizan mensualmente las familias de la pequeña localidad ubicada al margen del río para evitar comprarlo en el mercado, con este incremento de dinero la familia también podrá acrecentar su nivel de vida y educación siendo éste el propósito primordial de esta sacrificada madre. A razón de este hecho solicita un monto de 500 dólares con el deseo de poner en marcha su proyecto. Hagamos que este anhelo se haga realidad en corto tiempo con nuestra generosa ayuda.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES TO STOCK HER SMALL STORE.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto is a 26 year old young man who dedicates himself to the transport of passengers. Currently, he owns 5 motorcycles that he rents out to third parties who themselves work as motorcycle taxis. Modesto operates one motorcycle taxi himself. There is a lot of competition in the city of Montero in the province of Santa Cruz de la Sierra but in spite of this, there is high demand from passengers who utilize the motorcycle as a means of transport due to its practicality and speed in driving through challenging terrain. The loan requested will be used to purchase an additional motorcycle since demand for this service is increasing. The purchase price is dependant on where and from whom he purchases the motorcycle.
