This is Modesto’s sixth loan request and he has always demonstrated great responsibility with his loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christian García , Kiva Volunteer.

Modesto es una persona joven de 26 años de edad que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Actualmente cuenta con 5 motos las cuales las alquila a terceras personas para que las mismas puedan trabajar como moto taxis, una de las motos es manejada por él. Modesto es joven pero tiene mucha experiencia en este rubro. La competencia es bastante elevada pero pese a ello, en la ciudad de Montero del Departamento de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, hay bastante demanda de pasajeros que utilizan la moto como medio de transporte, debido a su practicidad y velocidad para llegar a difentes lugares. La presente solicitud es para adquirir una moto más, ya que la demanda de este servicio es bastante creciente, el precio de la misma depende de quién y en que estado compre. La presente solicitud es la sexta en nuestra institución y en todo este tiempo Modesto demostró ser una persona responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use:
Motorcycle purchase

Compra de una moto

loans.name: Vaialalua

texts.en: Ms Vaialalua is a single lady who is twenty seven years old. She didn’t finish school due to the lack of financial support from her parents. Instead, she stayed home and started a vegetable garden and plantation business with the help of her father. She said she only has two hands to work with, but the weeds grew much faster for her two hands, and she now needs some chemicals to kill them. She applied for the amount of US $300 to buy chemicals like gromoxome, seeds, and fertilizer to maintain good growth of her produce. She really appreciates the help she has received from the SPBD program because she believed without them, she could not continue her small business.

loans.use: To buy the chemicals and vegetables seeds for her plantation and vegetable garden

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Muailevai Leaana

texts.en: Muaileval Leaana is a sixty three year old lady who is married with eight children. Most of her kids are moving overseas to look for a better future, and now there are just two children living at home with her and her husband. Apart from that, she’s not relying on them for financial resources because she knows that they will eventually develop their own families as well. Muaileval Leaana would like to make ice-cakes and pancakes, not only to earn some money to live, but to use her time at home because she’s no longer able to do heavy duties; therefore, she’s applying for the amount of US $700 to buy the ingredients needed for her business, and to buy some cement, timbers, and iron roofing materials for house repairs. She's very happy with the SPBD program and hopes to stay in it for a long time.

loans.use: Buying ingredients for ice-cake store and for home improvement

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila P. runs a small grocery store out of her home in El Seybo. She started with nothing and now her business is helping her family get along well. With this new loan she wants to keep expanding her business and buy more products such as pork, chicken, and vegetables.

Zoila still has two years to complete her university degree and wants to go back. She has not finished school yet because she got married and became pregnant and also had to come home to take care of her sick mother. She is hoping that with her profits from her small business, she will be able to complete school.

NOTE: This is a group loan. Zoila is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $1,125 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand and restock inventory of food staples and household supplies

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad is a single parent. She lives with her mother and her only son, who divides his time between studying at college and working part time. Previously, Natividad was selling chickens but it was not going well. Now, by her own initiative, she decided to make a radical change and installed a small shop in her home offering everyday items to contribute to her son's income. To better serve her customers, she needs to buy a refrigerator to keep drinks and other products fresh. She is requesting a loan of $450 with the commitment to repay the loan in 6 months. This will enable her to meet her goals while serving her customers. Let's support her efforts so that she can realize her goals.

Natividad es madre soltera vive con su madre y su único hijo que comparte sus horarios de estudio en la universidad con un trabajo a medio tiempo, anteriormente ella estaba abocada a la venta de pollos al por menor; actualmente por iniciativa propia decidió cambiar radicalmente de rubro y ha instalado en su casa una pequeña bodega en la que oferta artículos de primera necesidad para contribuir con el dinero que genera su hijo con la actividad que desempeña en una institución de su ciudad.Para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes requiere comprar una refrigeradora con el fin de mantener las bebidas y otros productos bien conservados, porque la que tiene se encuentra en sus últimos días de vida útil; motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo de 450 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de seis meses, esto le permitirá cumplir sus deseos en beneficio de sus clientes. Colaboremos con el esfuerzo de Natividad para que siga progresando en la actividad que realiza

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: SHE WILL USE THE LOAN TO BUY A REFRIGERATOR FOR HER SMALL SHOP.

loans.name: Taufusi

texts.en: Mrs T. is married with four children. As as member of her village women’s committee, she chose to open a bingo business so that all members of the committee can play. She believes that this is one of the most profitable businesses if the prices and supplies are good. Her first loan of US $300 was used to buy the supplies and materials. She hopes that her next loan will be used to improve her existing business, as well as start up a barbecue store as her back up business, which will operate during the bingo. She says that she’s comfortable in raising her family and she helps with her kids' school fees by providing financial help.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bingo business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Jhoana

texts.en:
Jhoana M. is 23 years old and married to Julio de la Rosa, whose mother also has a loan from Esperanza. Jhoana and her husband are raising two children and live together with her mother in El Seybo. Their youngest child, five years old, is now attending school.

For her business, Jhoana is currently building a restaurant, which will include a small bar and pool table. The restaurant will also have music and live local entertainment. It’s under construction now and is painted bright green and pink. It is set to be ready in November 2007. It should be able to fit up to 35 people.

In addition to finishing construction, Jhoana needs to buy a freezer in which to hold the food she will sell. This $475 loan will go to help with construction materials as well as the freezer.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer and building materials

loans.name: Jackelyn Laurent

texts.es:
Jackelyn is mother to four children, two of whom are getting ready to test into the university in their city and to more who are still in school. She lives with her husband who works in public transportation in his own car in the streets of Pucallpa. In this way, they share both the household's expenses and their children's education. Before this, they lived in the city of Huanuco and since way back, they have worked selling quick meals. Now, in this beautiful region, they keep working on that same activity in a corner of their home, which they have arranged for this purpose in spite of some problems such as lacking electricity and drinking water. Thanks to the good service they offer and to their loyal clients, they are now in need to buy equipment to generate electricity and also replacements for the kitchen utensils that are used in the preparation and sale of their delicious specialty. To cover these expenses, Jackelyn needs to count on our support, she requests $200, committing herself to return them in six months. Let's allow our help to illuminate the way to their wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Jackelyn es madre de cuatro hijos, dos de ellos estan preparándose para postular a una vacante en la universidad de su ciudad y los otros dos aún se encuentran en el colegio. Ella vive con su esposo que se dedica al transporte público en su auto por las calles de Pucallpa, de esta manera comparten los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos; anteriormente vivían en la ciudad de Huánuco y desde siempre se han dedicado a la venta de comidas rápidas y ahora en esta bella zona continuan desarrollando la actividad que ya conoce en una esquina de su casa que acondicionó para este fin, afrontando ciertos problemas como es la falta de energía eléctrica y agua potable. Gracias a la buena atención que brinda y a los clientes asiduos, es que se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar un equipo para generar luz y la renovación de los utensilios de cocina que utiliza para la preparación y venta de su deliciosa especialidad. Para cubrir estas necesidades Jackleyn necesita contar con nuestro apoyo, solicita la suma de 200 dólares, comprometiéndose a devolverlos en seis meses.Hagamos que nuestra ayuda le proporcione luz para alumbrar el camino de sus anhelos

loans.use: Buying kitchen utensils and electricity generator

loans.name: Sisitagaloa

texts.en: Sisitagaloa is a single lady who is twenty one years old. She just finished school and she is now looking for a job. In the meantime, she is staying home, and she wants to use her spare time to run her elei business (a traditional Samoan way of printing on fabric) and sell her products at shops in town. Her first loan of US $300 was used to buy paint, materials, brushes, and elei materials for the business. She said that if the business goes well and becomes more profitable, then she will no longer need to look for a job, and instead focus on this business. She is very happy in her business and hopes that her next loan will make it more profitable and comfortable.

loans.use: To buy materials for her elei printing business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina A. runs a small convenience store in front of her house. She sells things like rice, chicken, coffee, sugar, and charcoal for cooking and heating. Miguelina is 46 years old, married, has one daughter and four grandchildren. Her husband is a day laborer in a nearby farm and her daughter works for an electrician in the nearby city of Barbaro. They all live together.

Miguelina has already successfully paid back an Esperanza loan for 5,000 pesos (US$ 150 ). She buys products for her convenience store from the nearby capital city of El Seybo, then sells them to her community. Miguelina wants to keep moving forward with her business. Business is good, she says, and she wants to keep selling more goods and needs money to expand.

loans.use: Purchase food staples and household supplies for resale

loans.name: Cinerca

texts.en:
Cinerca, mother of 3 children, is a very diligent, dynamic and visionary 42-year-old woman. Her husband buys and retails iron and other types of metal. Five years ago, she started a stationary store in Hato Nuevo and since then she's been working hard to make her business grow and be useful for the community.

Cinerca's customers incluD. schools in the area, little businesses, churches and so forth. Due to the growing needs of the clients for other kinds of writing materials and office supplies and so as to diversify her range of products, Cinerca wants to purchase Bristol paper, Fabriano watercolor paper, handmaD. paper, glossy paper, and also accessories like glue and so forth. She also wants to purchase articles that people usually need during the holiday season. A loan will help her carry out her projects and earn sufficient money as to help her husband face their housing issues.

loans.use: To buy writing materials and products like Bristol paper, handmade paper and glossy paper, etc. so as to diversify her inventory

loans.name: Widma

texts.es:
Widma is 39 years old and comes from a large and humble family. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling pigs and to traditional handicrafts from her parent's home, and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her 10 year old daughter, who is her greatest joy and has become her best friend. She asks for a $200 loan in order to buy more young animals to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. We support this dedicated mother's proposal.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Widma tiene 39 años de edad, proviene de una familia amplia y humilde, el carácter duro y exigente de su padre hizo que conociera desde muy pequeña el valor significativo del trabajo, gracias a eso ella se desenvuelve sin ningún problema en diversas actividades que le ha tocado realizar durante su vida; actualmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerditos y a las labores de artesanía, estos trabajos los realiza en el domicilio de sus padres y con el ingreso que le genera le brinda una mejor calidad de vida a su hija de 10 años quien es su mayor alegría y se ha convertido en su mejor amiga. Solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, para comprar más animales pequeños para luego venderlos cuando alcancen su madurez; así mismo considera que con esta inversión podrá aumentar sustancialmente su margen de ganancias e incrementará su calidad de vida. Solidaricémonos con el propósito de esta dedicada madre.

loans.use: Purchase young animals

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en: Kuini is a twenty-nine year old lady with three children. She lives with her family of more than ten people, but is the only other person working besides her husband. She thought she could run a small business in order to help out her husband, so she wants a loan for US $500 to buy supplies for a bingo business, as well as to repair her home by buying cement, timber and iron roofing materials. She greatly appreciates the financial help from the SPBD program, because without it, she cannot start her business or improve some of the things needed for her family life. She will work very hard at her business, which she believes will be of great help to her and her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Bingo business and for home repairs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Francisca Salazar

texts.en:
Francisca, 44, married and mother of 4 children (two boys and two girls), runs a fried food store that she started nine years ago. The couple is living with their two girls (10 and 7 years old), since the boys (21 and 18 years old) are working in another part of the country. The oldest guy is actually a military student. The girls are going to the local public school.

Francisca prepares various types of fried foods like fried fish or bananas. She wants to continue diversifying the range of foods she offers to her clientele. She'll introduce foods like spaghetti, stuffing, and some hotcakes. She also wants to give a new touch to the locale where she prepares and sells the fried foods. For those purposes, and in order to keep taking care of this large family, Yudelka is requesting the loan of US$ 325 that she hopes she'll have soon.

loans.use: To introduce a new category of foods (spaghetti, stuffing, hotcakes) to her business and to remodel the locale

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana is 60 years old, a hard-working, selfless mother to five children, despite her advanced age she still has sufficient vitality and strength to continue fufilling her work as an artisan, for which she is well-known and respected within her community for the excellent and fine work she creates. Susana begins her work in the early morning hours so that later she can offer her creations by walking in the busiest places in her town, while her husband tries to earn a living through physical labor with his only tool, his tricycle, offering his services to the community. Through this couple's daily performance they can enjoy their well-being and education of their children.

Today the demand for Susana's knittings has dramatically increased and in order to take advantage of this growth she seeks a loan of $200, which will enable the growth of their capital and aquire a range of wool to later knit in the unique and incomparable way that Susana knows how to knit, with the goal to sell the items and generate better income for the family. MFP offers support to continue knitting and cherishing the family's wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Susana tiene 60 años, madre trabajadora y abnegada D. 5 hijos, pese a la edad avanzada que tiene aún sigue contando con suficiente vitalidad y fuerza para seguir desempeñando el trabajo D. siempre, la artesanía, oficio por la que se hizo muy conocida y respetada dentro D. su entorno, por los excelentes y finos trabajos que realiza. Susana inicia con su labor desD. tempranas horas D. la madrugada, para luego ofrecerlos en forma ambulatoria en los lugares más concurridos D. su localidad, mientras su esposo trata D. ganarse la vida a base D. mucho esfuerzo físico con su única herramienta D. trabajo, su triciclo, ofreciendo sus servicios a la población. A través del desempeño diario D. esta pareja D. esposos pueden gozar D. bienestar y educación sus hijos.Actualmente la demanda D. sus tejidos se ha incrementada D. una forma descomunal y para aprovechar este fenómeno solicita un préstamo D. 200 dólares, este dinero le permitirá aumentar su capital y adquirir una infinita gama D. lanas para luego tejerlas D. la única e incomparable forma que ella sabe hacerlo, con el fin D. comercializarlas y generar mejores ingresos económicos para su familia. Brindémosle nuestro apoyo para siga tejiendo y albergando los anhelos D. su numerosa familia

loans.use: Wool for knitting

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia is 33 years old and has two young children. From her youth, Zonia has worked various jobs, always looking for ways to help support her family. Unfortunately, she encountered some difficulties that prevented her from working as effectively as before. Finally, 4 months ago, with the undying support of her loving sister-in-law, she decided to start selling ice creams in far-away towns and forgotten places in Juliaca, the area where she lives. She has dedicated much time and energy to earn great sums of money for her family's well-being. She would like to buy a freezer so she can preserve products and efficiently run her business. Therefore, she seeks $275 and requests her generous lenders to wait the short time until she is able to materialize her wish. She promises to be punctual and to repay the loan in no more than 6 months. With your collaboration, you will be able help her overcome the obstacles and warmly renew her hopes for progress.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zonia tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños niños y se ha dedicado desde muy joven a diversas actividades comerciales, siempre en busca del progreso y éxito de su familia; sin embargo desafortunadamente encontró muchos obstáculos que no le permitieron desenvolverse eficazmente en su vida laboral. Finalmente hace 4 meses, con el apoyo incondicional de su amorosa suegra decidió comercializar helados en los pueblos más lejanos y olvidados de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, labor a la que le dedica mayor tiempo y esfuerzo y con el que viene generando importantes sumas de dinero para el sustento y bienestar de su familia.Su deseo es adquirir una máquina congeladora que utilizará con el propósito de conservar sus productos y fortalecer su negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares y recurre a los infinitos generosos corazones a fin de concretar su anhelo en corto tiempo, además promete ser puntual y devolver el préstamo en un lapso no mayor a 6 meses.Con tu colaboración congelará los obstáculos y abrigará nuevas esperanzas de progreso en su corazón.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is a young lady of twenty-one years of age, married, and has one son. She just finished school and is staying home to look after her parents. Because she needs some money for her family commitments, she started her fast foods stall business, which she operates at the village school every week; pancake sales sometimes serve as a back-up business. Both businesses were started using her $300 loan when she joined the SPBD program last year. She works very hard in maintaining a good profit flow, and she hope to improve her business through her next loans.

loans.use: Buying ingredients needed for making pancakes such as flour, drippings, and sugar, as well as for other foods to sell at her fast foods stall business.

loans.name: Letoee

texts.en: Mrs. K. is a fifty eight year old woman married with four children and she has been getting loans from SPBD from the past three years; this will be her fifth loan. Most of her past loans were used for improvement of her business by buying chemicals to kill weeds and and purchase fertilizers for the growth of her crops. She is also looking to purchase a toilet set to improve the health condition of her family. She hopes that her next loan will used to repair their house even further. She is happy with both her businesses (plantation and pancake sales) as it is a great help to her many family and church commitments and contributions. She plans to remain in the SPBD program for a long time in order to obtain more loans for her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy gromoxone, sting, and fertilizer for the plantation, as well as the ingredients needed for pancakes. Also to buy cement and toilet seat for her bathroom.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
“I have construction that has yet to be completed due to lack of funds. I have recuperated and would like to finish the construction of the additional rooms so I can use them. I am requesting $1,200 to complete the construction.”

Translated from Spanish by Christian García , Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción si terminar ya que me falto dinero pero ahora me he recuperado un poco y quisiera terminarla para poder habitar esos cuartos. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: to complete construction

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: “…Working the land from God is one of his gifts to the humans where lots of blessings are in it….”  That’s what Mareta believes when she was interviewed. She is one of the longest members of the SPBD program. One of the reasons for her longevity is that she works very hard at her business. With the help of her husband, she plants, weeds, and sells her crops, which include cabbages, cucumbers, beans, and pumpkins. She is very comfortable in providing for the needs of her family and her childrens’ school fees. She greatly appreciates the help from this program, because without it, she cannot run her business. She wishes to get another loan to buy a second-hand pick-up truck to help in delivering her crops to the market, as it’s very far from home.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers for her plantation, and also to buy timber and cement for home improvement.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Lizbeth Teófila

texts.es:
Lizbeth is 19 years old. She is a Young enthusiast and very hard working. With innumerable projects and visions for her future, she is now dedicated to buying and selling ewe wool, which she learned from her loving mother Eulalia not too long ago. She began this intending to increase her quality of life. The two of them buy the leather at fairs that take place in different towns and villages around them to later sheer and sell it to a textile factory. The work is arduous and requires much force given that they have to make long walks and locate the necessary quantity need to be marketable.

Due to the work they do, altogether it is very good and they have been able to accommodate an amplified quantity of orders, and for that reason they are soliciting a loan of $200 USD. This money will permit them the increase their investment capital. This will fortify their business, and increase the standard of living for their family. They extend the promise to repay the loan in 6 months. Help this humble woman so that she can continue to keep the hope she has in her heart to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Lizbeth tiene 19 años, es una joven entusiasta y muy trabajadora, con innumerables proyectos e ilusiones para su vida futura, actualmente está dedicada a la compra y venta de lana de oveja, trabajo que emprendió junto a su querida madre Eulalia hace poco tiempo con el propósito de incrementar su calidad de vida, ambas compran el cuero en las ferias de los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad que habitan para luego trasquilarlos y venderlos a una empresa textil. El trabajo es arduo y requiere de mucho esfuerzo debido a que tienen que realizar largas caminatas hasta ubicar la cantidad necesaria para su comercialización.

Debido a que el trabajo que realizan en conjunto es muy bueno han podido albergar una amplia cantidad de pedidos y por esta razón solicitan un préstamo de 200 dólares, este dinero le permitirá incrementar su capital de inversión, de esa manera fortalecerá su negocio, e incrementará el nivel de vida de su familia; así mismo les extiende su compromiso de realizar la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Ayudemos a esta humilde muchacha para que siga acogiendo en su corazón más deseos de superación.

loans.use: Increase of capital to acquire more wool to be sold

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
“I have a business in which I sell pre-owned shoes and clothing. With the cold season approaching, I have received requests from my customers for warmer clothing and would like to purchase additional merchandise to fulfill their requests. I am requesting $1,200 to invest in my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Christian García , Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos usados y me gustaría comprar más mercancía ya que se acerca la temporada de frío y los clientes ya me lo están solicitando”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use:
Business investment

Invertir para negocio

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Mrs A. is thirty-five years old and a mother of twelve children. It is difficult for her to raise her children with no job or any other financial support. However, her vegetable garden is her passion and has become her savior in many ways. She started selling vegetables, every day, around the village by foot, and then traveling to nearby villages if any were left over. Since then, she has built a small house and a place to sell all her vegetables, which has eliminated the need for all the walking. She has four kids who are attending school, and the rest of her children are almost finished and in high school now. All of their educations have funded by her business. She is hoping to use her next loan to expand her garden and to buy equipment to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy vegetables seeds, chemicals and fertilizers for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Yudelka Yanelis

texts.en:
Yudelka, 29, and her husband sell clothes for women and children, in order to earn a living and take care of their own seven children. Yudelka started the business five years ago. She buys in Santo Domingo, the capital, and retails the clothes in her community. Right now the couple is running the business out of their modest rented house in Hato Nuevo.

Yudelka is now working to expand the business and make it known to all the community and sell more. She is planning to renovate a small locale that her husband has just bought for her and move the business there. She also wants vary her range of products, adding clothes for men to her business.

The couple needs straightaway a loan that could help them reach their purpose and increase their income so that they can improve the situation of their needy family.

loans.use: To renovate a small locale as to move her business; also to introduce men's clothes to vary her inventory

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
“I have a business in which I sell new clothes from my home that customers purchase in installments.  I would like to invest in additional merchandise since the cold season and my customers have begun to request warmers clothing.  I am requesting $1,200 to invest in my business.”
 Translated from Spanish by Christian García
, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio de ropa nueva en mi casa la cual vendo en abonos, pero me gustaría invertir en más mercancía ya que se acerca la temporada de frío y mis clientes me lo están solicitando”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertí en mi negocio.

loans.use:
Invest in my business
Invertir en mi negocio

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel, 46 years old, mother of 3 children (two boys and a girl), owns a little cafeteria. She started the business 20 years ago with the help of her partner, who is a clerk in a supermarket. Isabel prepares food in the afternoon and sells during the evenings in Santo Domingo, since Hato Nuevo is located about one hour from the capital. She also sells natural juices and alcoholic drinks as well as energy drinks.

During these last three years, Isabel's clientele has been expanding, so that she can't always offer everyone the same amount of food and drinks that she had been selling. To remedy that situation, Isabel is planning to buy more provisions in order to prepare more food. She is also thinking about hiring a woman to help her in the business. She is requesting a loan that can help her reach these goals quickly. This way, she'll be able to increase her income and improve her family situation.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs so as to prepare more food for her little cafeteria and to hire a woman to help prepare foods

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a very dynamic 17-year-old girl. Presently she is finishing the last grade of secondary school and is getting ready to go to the university. Virginia is living at home with her parents and her seven brothers and sisters. Her mother is a well-known businesswoman in the area, and her father is a bus driver for a security company. Virginia has gained enough experience in selling products, since she has had to help her mother many times selling her products.

In order to enter the university, Virginia plans to have her own business, selling beauty items like hair repair products, skin care lotions, body lotions and so forth. She will start the business especially with the Jafra skin care line products since those products are commonly know and well accepted in the sector of Hato Nuevo. Virginia thinks that after twelve months, she'll have set aside sufficient money so as to begin her study of Marketing in a good university of Santo Domingo.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as hair repair products and skin care lotions

loans.name: Sikolasitika

texts.en: Sikolasitika is sixty-three old and has eight children. Even though she is too old for most manual labor, she remains a strong and active mother who can look after her family. She believes that the talent she has for sewing shouldn’t be denied, especially while she still has the opportunity to use it. Her business has funded the upbringing of her first four children who are working now, as well as her family's current daily needs. Her first loan of $300 was used to buy a new sewing machine to replace her old one, as well as materials needed for a sewing business. She said that her working kids are responsible now for most of her family needs, but the money she gets from her existing business are used to pay her loan repayments, and for her personal needs. For other financial obligations such as church and school fees,  she can use her own money.  She is very happy to stay with the SPBD loan program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and a new sewing machine.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en: “…I believed that it is a very fast and easy business to run, and I can use my knowledge from school in calculating my profits...” That’s what Iokapeta said on her business interview. She is a young lady of twenty four years of age who just finished school, and she is currently running a bingo business. Her first loan of $300 was used to buy the start-up supplies, and to set up the prize structure of the games. She is very interested in it because she knows how to calculate her expenses and her profits, which was her major in school and she wants to apply it to her work. She wishes that her next loan will be used to improve and maintain her business. Iokapeta is very happy with the SPBD program.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her Bingo business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs S. is a married lady of thirty four years of age with four children. Before joining SPBD, Paulina's taxi stopped running and it stood at home as she did not have enough money to fix it. She is very thankful for the financial help from SPBD, which has allowed her to fix her car with a $300 loan that she used to buy the very needed and expensive parts of her taxi. The taxi is running nowadays, and her family benefits from the extra income. She is hopeful for the future, and she is thinking of starting another business as a back-up to her taxi service. All her children’s’ school fees depend on the money she get from her business. She also plans to repair her house with her next loan.

loans.use: To buy auto parts for her taxi service

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Kisa

texts.en: Kisa is a thirty-two year old lady, married, with three kids. She works very hard to support her extended family that is why she runs her fast foods stall business and sells to her village and the local school. She gets very tired some days but still needs to work hard with no rest. Her first loan of $400 will be used to buy food and ingredients for the business. She says that her burden is becoming lighter, and that she is proud to be able to support her school kids. She is thinking of opening another business to help out, and a barbeque is her first choice. She believes that the more you work the more you get. Her next loan will help to pay her kids school fees and keep her current business running.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her food stall

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en: Talosaga is twenty-four years old, and married with one son. She is a very talented woman in the design and creation of elei (Samoan screen printed material) products. She produces about five dozen elei screens per week, which costs her $100 for all the materials and $40 per dozen to print. She sells her products to different shops in town and in her village. Sometimes people make special orders from her. Her first loan of $300 was used to buy the tools needed for her elei business. She hopes that her next loan will further improve the business and increase her profits. She plans far into future, especially for her son, who will be attending school. She is very happy with her business.

loans.use: To buy materials, paint and elei woods for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: The parents have 7 children. All their children are still going to school. They also had some land and sold it to provide food and education for their children by buying a motorbike for the father's work and using the remainder for the mother's business. They earn about 75 USD per month. They want to borrow $75 to add to the mother’s capital. She will use the profits to support the cost of schooling for the children. She will pay the loan back in 5 months.

loans.use: Groceries

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: There are 7 people in this family.  The husband is dead.  The mother and two daughters are the main workers, and the other 4 children are still pupils. The mother and 2 daughters usually work in the green dragon factory, but their incomes are unstable by their uncertain work. The family does not have any other source of income. Huong's nephew, Pham The Diep, used to live with his grandmother when he was still a child, but now he lives with Huong and her family because the grandmother passed away.  Diep got a project scholarship from Mekong Plus to help pay for school fees.  Huong wants to borrow $50 to raise rabbits to earn more income to support the family. She will pay back the loan in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise rabbits

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a happily married mother of six. She supports her husband by working on their taro plantation six days a week. She rarely asks her family living overseas for a financial support because she makes $300-$400 a month by selling 3-4 bags of taro at the market twice a week. She is applying for this new loan from SPBD in order to keep her children in school and to extend her four-acre taro plantation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, weed killers, a spade and other supplies for her taro plantation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Faatuiese

texts.en: In Samoa, having nine children can be quite tough. However, Faatuiese U. is undeterred by the challenge, and is proud to be the kind of mother that wakes up early and sleeps late. Her business is operating a bingo game every Wednesday and Friday night where she can collect $300-$400 a night. Her next loan is for $1250.00, which she plans to use for her children’s school fees and her family remittances.

loans.use: To buy game packages, ink, and other supplies for  her Bingo business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is a mother of 5 children. She lives in Khudat town, in the Khachmaz region. This 56-year-old woman has bred calves for 6 years. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a calf to increase the number of her calves.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Araz

texts.en: This young man has seven years of experience in cattle breeding. He lives in Ashagi-Zeyid village, in the Khachmaz region. He is 32 years old, married, and has four children. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is 50 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in the villlage of Ashagi-Zeyid in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. He has been in the farming business for 6 years, raising peach trees. Ramiz is requesting a loan of  $825 to buy pesticides for his trees.

loans.use: To buy pesticides

loans.name: Sriningsih

texts.id:
Sriningsih has a business of sewing dresses. She lives with her husband in a rented room that cost Rp200,000.00 (about US$22)/month. She is doing the business from the terrace of her room. Sriningsih has a steady customer from the garment business. When orders are slow, she took orders from customers from surrounding area. In one day she could finish 2 to 3 dresses. The transpotation she uses to pick up and deliver her sewing items is a bicycle. Raw materials like cloth she bought by kilograms to reduce cost. Daily living expenses are about Rp20,000.00 ($2.20). Monthly profit could reach up to Rp1,300,000.00 ($143). The expected capital will be used to buy clothing raw materials. This will help her in her creativity to desgn dresses. She hopes that she would not only complete customer's orders, but also to sell the ideas she put into the dresses she makes.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sriningsih mempunyai usaha Menjahit Pakaian. Dia tinggal berdua bersama suaminya di kos - kosan. Biaya sewa per bulannya Rp 200.000,00. Dia menjalankan usaha di tempat kosnya, tepatnya di bagian teras. Sriningsih mempunyai langganan tetap dari salah satu perusahaan garmen. Apabila sepi pesanan, dia mengambil jahitan dari pelanggan di sekitar tempat kosnya. Satu hari dia bisa menyelesaikan 2 sampai 3 potong pakaian. Alat transportasi yang digunakan Sriningsih untuk mengantar dan mengambil jahitan adalah sepeda gayung. Bahan baku – berupa kain - dia beli kiloan, dengan harga lebih murah. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 20.000,00. Keuntungan per bulannya mencapai Rp 1.300.000,00. Modal yang dia dapat nantinya akan dia gunakan untuk membeli bahan baku kain. Hal ini akan membantu dia mengembangkan kreatifitasnya dalam mendesign pakaian. Dia berharap tidak hanya mampu memenuhi pesanan pelanggan, akan tetapi juga mampu menjual ide – ide yang dituangkan dalam setiap pakain yang dia buat.

loans.use:
To buy clothing raw materials

Membeli bahan baku kain

loans.name: Minara

texts.en: Minara is 41 years old and married with three children.  She and her family live in Khachmaz town. She buys foods such as granulated sugar, cookies, tea etc. to sell to markets wholesale. She now needs a loan of $725 to expand her range of foods she is able to offer to her clients.

loans.use: to expand her range of foods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hidoyathon

texts.en:
Hidoyat R. has been engaged in trade for over 4 years. She started her business by cooking different food for people from several shops nearby such as Avesto (a supermarket in Khujand), Atlant (a computer center), Mercury (a disk shop) and a beauty salon. Her husband was her business partner and he helped her to prepare the food and bring it in his car to these shops.

Her business was uninterrupted but her husband died several weeks ago (she is in mourning dress in the photo). The head of Avesto supermarket helped her and gave her a little promise for a shop in the passage of this market. Presently she sells different food products here and gradually expanded her assortment by including newspapers, paying cards for mobile phones and so on. During Ramazan month, when most people are keeping Ruza (it is Musulman tradition to not eat anything all day during this month) she did not cook. She is going to start cooking again (her elder son is going to help her with the transportation of food) in the end of October. She is requesting $1200 to purchase food products for her business. She is also going to sell her dishes in her little shop.

loans.use: Hidoyathon would like to develop her business making and selling food to people who work in nearby stores.

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en: Gunay (her husband is pictured) is 20 years old and married with one child. The Aliyev family lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Gunay's husband has been in the taxi business for 3 years. They are now requesting a loan of $825 to purchase spare parts for the taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare machine parts

loans.name: Bimuborak

texts.en:
Bimuborak B. has been engaged in business for over 5 years. Her business is to sew national Tadjik mattresses. Her business is located in the service center Navruz. Bimuborak with her two business partners rented one room for their activity 5 years ago.

The process of making mattresses includes four steps: sewing fabric into a long sack, spreading it out on the preparing cotton, putting cotton in the long sack and sewing it with stitch (2 cm) by hand. On one mattress they do 6 or 8 lines of stitches. Making one mattress requires one day. All of them make their mattress separately of each other. Then they give their products to the market for sale. Since ancient times this kind of business is in high demand because it is tradition to give your daughter several (10-12) mattresses with pillows when she is going to get married.

Presently their workshop is one of the known workshops in Khujand and today they sew mattresses according to orders of clients. They have a great number of orders in the wedding period (June-November). To purchase several kinds of fabric for her mattresses she is requesting $1200 for 14 months.

loans.use: Bimuborak would like to buy more fabric to sew and make her traditional Tadjik mattresses often sent with a daughter for her wedding gift.

loans.name: Mahfiratjon

texts.en:
Mahfirat V. sells sporting goods in supermarket Avasto in Khujand. She is renting one shop for her activity. She brought her goods from Bishkek, Kirgizistan. Her business partner is her husband and they both go to purchase goods. This supermarket is crowded every day and she says that her goods have good demand among customers. Many of the people of this supermarket are the constant clients of her shop. She receives a lot of orders from them every trip.

She says that every man must take care of his health himself and the healthy life is better than life in the hospital. Women must keep an ideal figure because a healthy woman always looks beautiful and young. “Health is great wealth!” In the near future she plans to expand her assortment by including some kind of training equipment for figures. For this purpose she is requesting $1200.

loans.use: Mahfirat would like to increase her equipment for her sporting goods shop.

loans.name: Soliev

texts.en: Soliev S. is one of the active clients of Microinvest. He opened a shop at home. His home is situated on the road and his current turnover of business is fast. It is his family business. His wife (she is in the photo) and his daughter sell his goods and he supplies them by necessary goods every day from Panjshanbe market. He has a wide assortment of food products and household products. This month he expanded his assortment by including watermelons and melons. It is very convenient for clients to purchase melons by the way. He plans to spend his future loan for future developing of his working capital as in the nearest future he wants to get his daughter married.

loans.use: Soliev would like to increase his business for her food and housewares shop.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana (her husband is pictured) is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Tarana's husband has been a taxi driver for 2 years and the couple is requesting a loan of $725 to buy spare parts for the taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare machine parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala (her husband is  pictured) is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She and her husband have been in the fruit-selling business for a year, selling watermelons in the local market. They plan to improve their business by purchasing more agricultural produce and fruit, for which they need a loan of $725.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce and fruits

loans.name: Thyda

texts.en:
Thyda M.  is married and has two sons. She learned to weave from her mother in 1990 and started her own silk production in the same year. Her husband is also weaving silk at home after being trained by his wife. To make extra income for the household, Thyda also sells homemade food from her home and raises pigs as well. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. She is now requesting a loan with the amount of $300. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and for fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Sithuok

texts.en:
Sithuok P.  is married and has two sons and two daughters. She learned to weave from her neighbor in 1991and started her own silk production in the same year. She also trained her husband, Var Kimhok to weave silk. He is a mason and assists his wife to weave silk at home when is he free from his construction work. P. also sells desserts at home and is raising cows as well. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA  four times already. She is now requesting a loan with the amount of $100. She will use this money to purchase more silk materials and sewing thread.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
I live in Multan, a small city in Pakistan, but one with a lot of old ruins and shrines of many saints. I have been a textile artist since I was 10. It is our family business, however, I wish that my children pursue an education and acquire some good job after their study completion. I would rather they pursue a career instead of adopting our family business as their profession.

For a living, I knit bags, shawls, and covers, which currently yields me inadequate amounts to make ends meet. I buy wool on credit from my neighbor who charges me with very high prices. However, if I buy the wool on cash from the market, it will be cheaper and will leave me with higher profits. I am asking for a loan of USD 250.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Embala

texts.en: Embala is 29 years old and lives in the Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz with his two children. He has been running a general store for four years and is applying for  a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods for the store. He hopes that offering more goods in his general store will help improve his income.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
My name is Ameeran B. and I am the mother of five children. I make knitwear while my husband works at a property dealer shop and my eldest son is a tailor. Together, we earn $150 USD a month. This income is too less to bear the expenses of seven family members.

Therefore, I need to expand my knitting business, buy additional wool. Thus, I am requesting a $250 USD loan. The additional profits that I will be able to generate from this expansion will help me marry off my eldest daughter and improve our current financial condition.

loans.use: To purchase additional wool

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en:
I am a resident of Multan, a city known for its ceramic pottery in Pakistan. I am the mother of six children, five sons and one daughter. I knit on order for a neighbor of mine on minimal wages while my husband is a peon in a nearby government school. In addition, my two eldest sons are apprentices at a plumbers shop. My daughter assists me in knitting cushions, bed sheets and table covers etc. whereas my youngest three sons are in school.

It is very hard to meet our needs with our combined minimal income of $150 USD a month. I am competent at my work but due to scarce resources, I cannot afford to buy wool and produce a great number of items. I need a loan of 250 USD to start my own business of knitting woolen products.

loans.use: To buy additional wool

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
I was born and raised in Multan, a mid-sized city in southern Punjab (a province in Pakistan). I am a mother of four and all my children attend school. My husband is a rickshaw driver (three wheeled local vehicle) while I knit.

I buy wool from a nearby village while my mother-in-law sells the finished products of knitting in various cities in Punjab. The venture of these two businesses yields us a profit of $90 USD a month. For higher quality of life, I need to expand my knitting business in order to cover all the household expenses. Therefore, I require 250 USD in loans to buy wool in bulk from the city, which will cost a great deal cheaper.

loans.use: To expand knitting business

loans.name: Samangul

texts.en: You can see the happy Gurbanov family in the picture. They live in the town of Khachmaz of Azerbaijan. Samangul is 46 years old and has 4 children. Her family has been raising cows and calves for eight years. They now need a loan of $725 to buy a cow from which they can collect milk and improve their income.

loans.use: To buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a seamstress who owns a successful sewing business in Kayunga, Uganda. She also is a mother of three children. She would like to buy a sewing machine and an additional inventory of cloth.  With the new machine and material she plans to start a sewing school to teach  girls in her village how to make and mend clothing.
 
Many young girls in her village drop out of school. By developing a sewing school, she would like to be an inspiration to other young girls, so they can learn a trade to earn their own income. As her own income increases, Sarah hopes to be able to add on new machines to continue to build her inventory.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine, more cloth and thread

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
I am a poor woman with seven children whom I could not educate due to our underprivileged financial status. We started operating a restaurant six years ago; my two eldest sons and my husband also assist me in this business. Additionally, my other three sons are laborers.

The income from all these sources is just enough to meet our living expenses. My restaurant has high turnover, however, we have a reputation for making quality food, especially tea. To increase the restaurant business and include more items on our menu, I need to invest 175 USD. With the additional income, I will repair my house and improve our living situation.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
I am a mother of five and a widow. I have been living in Multan since my childhood, in the heart of Punjab, the most populated province. I am a textile designer and my eldest son sells the wool at the markets of various cities.

My two other sons are bus drivers and earn extremely minimal wages. In addition, my daughter is married. Unfortunately, I am old and therefore, I cannot knit in large-scales. I also need a helper.

The present quantity that we produce barely covers my son’s transportation costs to the market. If I am able to make large quantities of wool products, he will be able to sell more on every visit to the market, leaving us with decent profits. A loan of 250 USD can do fairly well for me.

loans.use: To buy wool in large quantities

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
I am Nasreen H. and with the help of my husband, I knit woolen bed sheets, cushions, shirts, wall hangings, bags and so forth. I have two sons and one daughter. My eldest son is in grade one and my daughter is in grade two. The youngest one is not of school going age yet.

I wish to have promising careers for my children -- maybe a doctor or a teacher. I have employed women from my neighborhood to help me in my knitting business. They contribute well to our household income and help us manage our living. However, I need to expand my business in order to save for my childrens' education. Thus, I am requesting a loan of 250 USD.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Gatiba

texts.en: Gatiba is 54 and a mother of three. She lives in the village of Garadag-Budug in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. Gatiba has a pomegranate orchard which she runs with her husband (you can see her and her husband in the picture). They have been in the farming business for seven years and now need a loan of $825 to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve their orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Djoshgun

texts.en: Djoshgun lives in the village of Hulovli  in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. He is married and has 3 children. Djoshgun has 5 years of experience in cattle breeding. He needs a loan of $725 to add to his stock of cattle by buying a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mayil

texts.en: Mayil is 25 years old, single, and lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. He has rented a space in the local market  for three years where he intends to set up a clothing sales business. Now he needs a loan of $825 to buy clothes for his store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his sales business

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
I am a textile designer and my husband is a plumber. Together, we earn $140 USD a month, which is too little to support our four children. But even then, we have somehow managed to send our children to school.

I could not study, but I do not want my children to be educated. In order to manage the school expenses and the everyday household expenditures, I need to expand my knitting business for which I require to buy a large amount of wool. The wool should preferably be a wool bale. Thus, I am requesting a loan of 175 USD.

loans.use: To buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Segujja

texts.en:
Segujja owns a newspaper sales business. He is a very friendly man and everyone in Kayunga knows who Sequjja is. He has received other loans which have helped him  purchase larger quantities of newspapers.  He has also been able to place his newspapers in various trading centers through out Kayunga. 
Segujja is also a resourceful salesman, as he also collects old newspapers and resells them to a recycler to turn into paper bags.
Over the past two years, Segujja has received several loans and has been able to repay them on time. He would like a new loan so he can expand his business. He plans on opening other locations in neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers, to increase his sales locations.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
I am Saima A. and I learned how to knit when I was very young. Four years back, I started my own business of making various wool products at my house. My husband is a plumber at a shop for very low pay.

I have one boy who is three years old and when he reaches the age four, I plan to send him to the best school in our area. I wish to expand my existing business for which I will have to hire a few girls from my neighborhood. I will also have to buy a large stock of cotton. I am requesting 250 USD.

loans.use: To buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Basiran

texts.en:
I have lived in Multan all my life; it is a mid-sized city in Southern Punjab -- a densely populated province in Pakistan. I am a widow with eight children, who at the time, could not continue with their studies due to their father’s death.

I embroider clothes on a frame wodden, known as Ada, in our local language that is used for hand embroidery. My daughters also help me in this business whereas my sons make and sell looms. Eid (a religious festival) is around the corner so my hand-made embroidered clothes will be in high demand.

I need to buy threads, sequins and another frames to make and supply additional clothes. With the extra income that I hope will be generated, I will be able to marry off one of my daughters. Therefore, I am requesting a loan of 250 USD.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making embroider clothes

loans.name: Sayyara

texts.en: Sayyara (her husband is pictured) is 43 and a mother of three. She lives in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijian. Sayyara has raised cattle for four years. She fattens the cattle and then sells it. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy 2 cows for  fattenning and selling.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
I am Nazia H. from Multan and I have been living here since my birth. I was married five years ago and am the mother of one boy and one girl. I completed 8th grade and I hope my children will further complete their education.

My husband drives a rented rickshaw (a local three-wheeled taxi) whereas I stay at home and knit. I wish to buy wool bale from Lahore (second largest city in Pakistan) where it is relatively cheaper to expand my business. Therefore, I am requesting a loan of 250 USD.

loans.use: To buy wool for business expansion

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim lives in the town of Khachmaz of Azerbaijan. He is 33 years old and married with 2 children. This young man has run a general store for 2 years and is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy goods to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his general store

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
My name is Shahnaz B. and I am thirty-seven years old. My husband sells the knitted bed sheets, cushions, bags, etc that our neighborhood women make. Meanwhile, I sell clothes door-to-door in nearby villages. My eldest son works at a local factory after having completed the14th grade, while my other son is a tailoring instructor. Due to the income that my eldest son brings by working in a factory, I was able to marry off one of my daughters; the other two of my daughters attend school.

Eid is near and my customers are demanding me to sell cosmetics and jewelry with clothes as well. I need a loan of USD 250 to purchase the required supplies. I will make savings of the extra profits to help me marry off my daughters when the time comes.

loans.use: To expand knitting business

loans.name: Sumyia

texts.en:
I am the mother of two daughters, both of whom study. I had been living in Multan since I was born. My husband is a plumber and works at a shop for minimal wages while I earn a living by making knitted products.

I am requesting to borrow and invest 250 USD in my existing business. I plan to buy wool bale from Lahore in bulk, which will be cheaper. It was also help me complete more knitted products to increase my profits which will in turn, make a better life for my children.

loans.use: Buy wool bale

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is 21 years old and a mother of one. She lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Tarana sells clothes  at retail and has been in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan of $950  to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif  has runs a pear orchard. He is 46 years old and married with 2 children. He lives in the village of Bay-Bala in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. He is requesting a loan of $825 to buy  pesticides, seedlings and fertilizer to improve his orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Adalat

texts.en: Adalat is 51 years old and married with 4 children. The A. family lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Adalat has a year of experience running a general store. He is requesting a loan of $950 to buying more goods with which to attract more clients to his store.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Ruhiyye

texts.en:
Ruhiyye N. was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory, the Gubadli region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. 

She is 31 years old and a mother of three children. Right now she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. She is currently homeless and is staying in a worker’s hostel in Sumgayit city. Ruhiyye opened her business 1998 by selling a small variety of vegetables in front of the hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family’s food and important consumption needs. Her husband assisted her with the small business. She wants to borrow $500 to open a larger counter vegetable section and hopes to improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 14 months.

loans.use: Open a larger vegetable counter section.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya O.  was born in the Xacmaz district. She is 61 years old and a mother of five children. Right now she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. 

She started her business of selling industry goods with $300 in 2002.. At first, she was selling industry goods and earned little money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She had difficulty in covering necessities such as medication, clothes, and school, etc. Now, she wants improve her business, increase her number of  clients, and increase her income.

Mariya needs a $600 loan. With this loan Mariya wants to buy men's suits to sell through her private trade located in the central market. This will help her expand her business. 

Mariya believes this change will expand and improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months and on a monthly basis. Mariya cherishes all the help she hopes to receive.

loans.use: To buy men's suits and industry goods to sell in the central market.

loans.name: Adila

texts.en: Adila is 21 years old, single, and lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. She has been in the jam-making business for a year. She now needs a loan of $950 to buy more fruit so that she can make more jam and earn a higher income.

loans.use: To buy fruits to turn into jam

loans.name: Paridjahan

texts.en: Paridjahan (her husband is pictured) is 37 years old and a mother of three. Her husband started a transportation business five years ago. He transports goods to market with his car. The couple now needs a loan of $950 to purchase spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare machine parts

loans.name: Simnara

texts.en: Simnara is a 42-year-old widow with two children. She lives in the village of Yegudj in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. She has been selling clothes for 10 years and now needs a loan of $825 to buy more clothes for her sales business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Gamar

texts.en: Gamar is 44 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. She is married and has 2 children. Gamar has been in the poultry business for 6 years, buying and selling poultry. She needs a loan of $775 to buy more chicken for her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en: Lorenza, 48 years old, is living with her husband, a mechanic.  They don’t have any children.  Five years ago, Lorenza started a small home business.  She sells hair products like shampoo, rinse, olive oil, hair straightening products and some special soap.  Furthermore, she prepares some mixture for the hair.  This request for a loan is to buy a wider range of merchandise because for the last two weeks she has been in short supply.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of hair products as shampoo, rinse and special soap for hair.

loans.name: Fannie

texts.en: Fannie is a very courageous 46 year old woman who endured much so her six children could have a good education.  Her husband, who has always supported her, is a farmer.  The oldest children are working and can now earn their own living; the others go to school.  The loan requested by Fannie is to invest in her small business.  She sells men's shirts, pants and underwear.  As the holiday season is coming, she wants to buy more merchandise at wholesale price and sell them in her community.  Holiday season has always been the best time to sell a large amount of product and earn sufficient money to set aside for eventual health problems or for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of shirts, pants and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Dulce María

texts.en: Dulce, 40 years old, is married with four children (3 girls and a boy).  Her husband is in the military and is working at Santo Domingo, the capital.  Dulce sells men’s underwear and shoes in her house.  She started the business two years ago in order to help her husband face the housing issues.  In fact, the military is not well paid in the country.  She’s now requesting a loan to buy more shoes and some pants because during all the holiday season, she’ll offer her products at lower prices.  This way, she’ll be promoting the pants that she’ll introduce to the business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of shoes to sell in the holiday season.  Also to introduce pants in the business

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en: Sabrina is 17 years old and is living with her four brothers and sisters.  Her father has a small grocery store and sell basic foodstuffs.  Sabrina will finish secondary school next year and is considering going to university.  But her parents' incomes are not sufficient to pay for both her tuition and other family needs.   So,she has decided to take action.  She is requesting a loan to buy inventory to open a mobile store.  She plans to sell men's clothes, shoes and underwear.  She has already contacted a provider who will sell her wholesale merchandise monthly.  Sabrina is very positive-minded and is sure that she’ll succeed.

loans.use: To start a small clothing business in order to set aside money to go to university next year

loans.name: Reyhanat

texts.en: Reyhanat is a 42-year-old widow with three children, living in the town of Khachmaz  in Azerbaijan. She buys and sells poultry, a business she has been in for five years.  Reyhanat is now requesting a loan of $775 to buy more chickens for her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Nieve

texts.en: Nieve is 33 years old and is mother of three beautiful girls of 15, 14 and 10 years old.  Six months ago, she started a little business with the purpose of tending to her girls' needs.  The father of her daughters doesn’t live with them and is not regularly contributing to solving household problems.  She is now selling clothes, shoes, curtains, sheets for beds, and other houseware.  As she began the business with a very small amount of merchandise, she now wants to have sufficient inventory to offer to clientele.  This way, people will have more purchase options when visiting her business. The loan requested will positively help this woman achieve her goals and help her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes, curtains and other goods in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Gubadli region, which is situated in the west part of Azerbaijan Republic. He is 44 years old and is the father of three children. Right now he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan.

In 2004 Sharif borrowed $400 from Normicro, and expanded his business by buying an assortment of goods and gifts. At first, he was selling only creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, etc.  which earned little money. It provided only some of his family's basic needs.

With the loan he has expanded to a variety of different things such as: creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, bags, briefcases, gifts and more. Sharif would like to increase his work area by dividing the area into two parts. On one side he would like  to sell creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, soaps etc.,and on the other side bags, pictures, gifts and etc. 

He would like to borrow an $800 loan. With this loan he wants to expand his trading area, increase his business and improve his family conditions. He believes with the  change he can pay off monthly payments very easily. Sharif will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand his trading , increase his business and improve his family conditions

loans.name: María Luz

texts.en: María is a 34 years old woman with a very intelligent 10 year old daughter.  The girl is going to school in the township. She lives with her husband who works in her community.  She owns a little grocery store where she sells basic foodstuffs like rice, sugar, potatoes, peas, juice, water and other goods.  The "local" (a commercial space) where she runs her business is in a very disagreeable condition.  She is requesting a loan to remedy that situation.  She plans to renovate the small local and outfit the space in order to make goods visible to the public.  She would like to have her ‘new’ local ready for the holiday season.  María thinks that remodeling the local is a step to progress for her business.

loans.use: To renovate her small local store and outfit the space to make the goods visible to the clients.

loans.name: Polad

texts.en: Polad is 22 years old and married  with one child. He lives in the village of Garagurtlu in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. He has been in the cattle rearing business for 2 years and purchases cattle for fattening and selling. Polad needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Antonieta Del Carmen

texts.en: Antonieta, 20, runs a pica pollo, a fried chicken store with her father’s help, which they bought six months ago and began the operations a month later.  In any typical pica pollo, they sell parts fried chicken, tostones (fried plantains), fried potatoes and so on.   The food store opens from 12 pm to 12 am.  The environment is very pleasant since people can hear good music while they eat. Antonieta wants to renovate the space to make it more convenient and comfortable for customers.  She also wants to hire two persons in addition to the cook.  Lastly, she plans to have flyers printed to promote special offers and to attract more customers. She hopes to get loan requested so she can start executing her plan to expanding her new business.

loans.use: To renovate her foodstore, hire 2 persons, and have  promotional flyers printed.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is  49 years old and a mother of five. She and her family live in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. She has raised poultry for four years and is now requesting a loan of $725 to buy chickens to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa sells chickens from her brother's home, as she does not own her own home. She sells every day and her customers are housewives from the neighborhood. She is 30 years old, has two children, and belongs to the San Felipe 2 group. With her loan she intends to air condition the place where she displays her chickens, thereby increasing sales, and with the earnings she hopes to improve the economic situation of her family and in the future own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA LUISA se dedica a la venta de pollos, este negocio lo tiene establecido en la casa de su hermana ya que por el momento no tiene casa propia. Ella vende todos los días y sus clientes son las amas de casa de su comunidad. Ella tiene 30 años, dos hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado San Felipe 2. Con su préstamo pretende acondicionar el lugar para exhibir los pollos y de esta forma aumentar las ventas, ya que con las ganancias espera mejorar la situación económica de su familia y en un futuro adquirir una casa propia.

loans.use: Improve facility for selling chickens

loans.name: Paula Margarita

texts.es:
Paula is 41 years old, has three children, and is a widow. She makes flour pastries filled with jam or caramel which are very common in her region, adn she sells them in the city market as a traveling vendor.She is part of the San Felipe 2 group together with Maria de Jesús Pérez Hernández (who has a grocery store). With the loan Paula will invest in the purchase of flour, sugar, eggs, etc. and Maria will buy a variety of products to stock the store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

PAULA tiene 41 años, tres hijos, viuda. Ella hace pastelitos de harina rellenos de mermelada o manjar muy comunes en la localidad y los vende en el mercado de la ciudad como persona ambulante. Forma parte del grupo llamado San Felipe 2 junto con doña Maria de Jesús Pérez Hernández (tienda de abarrotes). Con el préstamo Paula invertirá en la compra de harina, azúcar, huevo, etc., y Maria comprara una variedad de productos para surtir la tienda.

loans.use: Purchase baking supplies and grocery store inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is an artisan who embroiders napkins, tablecloths, shawls, blouses and she sells them in the Santo Domingo city market. She is 30 years old, has 5 children, and her husband grows and sells flowers in San Cristóbal City. She is part of the Liliz 3 group. With her loan she will buy thread, which is the primary material needed for embroidery, and she will also support her husband to purchase liquids and fertilizers that they need for their flower harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

JUANA es artesana borda servilletas, manteles, chales, blusas y los vende en el mercado de Santo Domingo de la ciudad. Ella tiene 30 años, cinco hijos, y su esposo se dedica a la Floricultura, lo cual vende en la ciudad de San Cristóbal. Forma parte del grupo llamado Liliz 3. Con su préstamo comprara hilos ya que es la materia prima para el bordado y también apoyara a su esposo en la compra de líquidos y fertilizantes que se necesiten para la cosecha de flores.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery thread and flower harvest supplies

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina is 37 years old, has five children, and her husband sells roses. She is an artesan who embroiders traditional clothing worn by women in her region. She also makes napkins, tablecloths, cushions, y shawls which she sells in a nearby town. She is part of the Liliz 3 group. With her loan she will invest in purchasing thread in order to increase production, and thereby contribute to paying the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

CATARINA tiene 37 años, cinco hijos, su esposo se dedica a la venta de rosas. Ella es artesana borda ropa típica que las mujeres de su localidad utilizan, también hace servilletas, manteles, cojines, chales y los vende en el pueblo mas cercano a su comunidad.
