loans.use: Increase her capital for the Christmas season when her sales are expected to rise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
Isha is 44 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet the family’s expenses. She started the business three years ago, but due to the lack of capital she could not generate sufficient income for business expansion.

Isha sells beer, soft drinks, and mineral water. With her previous loans, she increased her stock and purchased a second-hand refrigerator. She is requesting another loan to expand her business and maximize her profits.

loans.use: Expanding her business by adding additional drink coolers and beverages

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Leandro

texts.en:
Leandro is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his in-laws' home in the Sagrado Corazón de Jesús area of the city of La Paz .

Leandro owns a mini bus which generates the income necessary to support his family. He needs this loan to buy a new engine to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living.

He has been an IMPRO client since 2006 and his repayment record is very good. For this reason he is in good standing to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Leandro tiene 34 años de edad vive en casa de los suegros en la calle Juan Paniagua de la zona Sagrado Corazón de Jesús de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Leandro tiene un minibús con el cual trabaja y mantiene a su familia generando ingresos diarios; el crédito que solicita es para comprar un motor y mantener en buen estado la movilidad pues es su herramienta de trabajo, además de poner en orden los documentos de propiedad. Por su antecedente histórico con Impro puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006 y su record de pagos es muy bueno.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for mini bus

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Selene Josefina

texts.es:
SELENE is 22 years old and single. She works buying handicrafts made by the women of her area, exhibiting and selling them at her location in the center of town. She sells napkins, shawls, cushions, and the traditional clothing used by the women of her area. She is part of the solidarity group called Perla 1, along with Ms. Dolores Patricia (artisan). With their loan, Selene will increase her purchase of more handicrafts, and Dolores will buy thread in bulk.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

SELENE tiene 22 años, soltera. Ella se dedica a comprar artesanía que las mujeres de su localidad hacen, los exhibe y vende en un local que lo tiene ubicado en el centro del pueblo; vende servilletas, chales, cojines, ropa típica que las mujeres de su localidad utilizan. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Perla 1 junto con doña Dolores Patricia (artesana). Con sus prestamos Selene aumentara la compra de mas artesanía y Dolores comprara hilo al por mayor.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Nima

texts.en:
Nima is forty-six years old and married with seven children. She runs a business selling used clothes which she started two years ago. With an unemployed husband, Nima is the main breadwinner for the family.

Her previous loans enabled Nima to increase her stock and generate more profit. She purchased a sewing machine with the profit and has put it for rent for more income. Nima says most of her income goes to her children’s education requirements and food. She now needs another loan to allow her to further expand the business.

loans.use: Diversify her business further to generate maximum profits

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
CATALINA and her husband work growing flowers. Their community is characterized not just by their handicrafts buy also their greenhouses, and the flowers they harvest (especially roses) are sold both within and outside the state. She is 37 years old, has three children, and is part of the solidarity group called Perla 1, along with Ms. Florentina Pérez Pérez (sales of fruits and vegetables). With their loans, Catalina will buy insecticides for the flowers, and nylon and wood to improve her greenhouse. Florentina will buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to supply her business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CATALINA junto con su esposo se dedican a la floricultura, su comunidad se caracteriza no solamente por sus artesanías sino también por sus invernaderos, ya que la cosecha de las flores (en especial las rosas) que se comercializa dentro y fuera del Estado. Ella tiene 37 años, tres hijos y forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Perla 1 junto con doña Florentina Pérez Pérez (venta de frutas y verduras). Con sus prestamos Catalina comprara insecticidas para las flores, naylo y madera al por mayor para hacer el invernadero, Florentina comprara una variedad de frutas y verduras para abastecer su negocio.

loans.use: FLOWER SALES

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
MARIA DEL CARMEN is single, she is 20 years old and an artisan. She embroiders napkins, tablecloths, shawls, and blouses, and she sells them in the handicrafts market in San Cristóbal de las Casas with the vendors who have their locations established there. She is part of the solidarity group called Libélula 1, along with Ms. Rosa Pérez Gómez (artisan) and Ms. Rosa Vázquez Montejo (artisan). All of them will invest their loan in the purchase of thread in bulk, because in that way they save the cost of merchandise, time, and transport.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

MARIA DEL CARMEN es soltera, tiene 20 años y es artesana. Ella borda servilletas, manteles, chales, blusas y los vende en el mercado de las artesanías de San Cristóbal de las casas con los comerciantes que tiene sus locales establecidos ahí. Forma parte del grupo llamado Libélula 1 junto con doña Rosa Pérez Gómez (artesana) y doña Rosa Vázquez Montejo (artesana). Ambas con su préstamo invertirán en la compra de hilo al por mayor, ya que adquiriendo de esta forma ahorraran: costo de mercancía, tiempo y transporte.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
PASCUALA is 35 years old, separated, with three children. She is an artisan. She embroiders napkins, tablecloths, shawls, cushions, and the blouses and skirts that the women of her community wear. She sells her products in the nearest town or in the city, and her customers are tourists who visit the area. She is part of the solidarity group called Libélula 2, along with Ms. Maria Sánchez Vázquez (artisan) and Ms. Pascuala Gómez Pérez (artisan). All of them will invest their loans in the purchase of thread and in that way increase their production. This will produce more earnings and a better economic condition for their family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

PASCUALA tiene 35 años, separada, tres hijos. Ella es artesana, borda servilletas, manteles, chales, cojines, blusas y faldas que las mujeres de su comunidad utiliza; sus productos los vende en el pueblo mas cercano o en la ciudad, los clientes son turistas que visitan el lugar. Forma parte del grupo llamado Libélula 2 junto con doña Maria Sánchez Vázquez (artesana) y doña Pascuala Gómez Pérez (artesana). Ambas con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de hilo y así aumentar la producción. Esto generara obtener mas ganancias y por lo tanto una mejor condición económica para su familia.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Celia Catalina

texts.es:
CELIA CATALINA and her husband are artisans. He makes pants, shirts for boys, and he cuts the fabric which Celia needs for her embroidery. They also have in their home a small location where they sell thread, fabric and needles. She is part of the solidarity group called Libélula 2, along with Ms. Juana Sánchez Vázquez (artisan) and Ms. Pascuala Vázquez Montejo (artisan). All will invest their loans in the purchase of thread in bulk and in that way increase production.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CELIA CATALINA junto con su esposo son artesanos, él hace pantalones, camisas para varones y corta la tela que Celia necesita para que lo borde. También tienen en su casa un pequeño local en donde venden hilos, telas, agujas. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Libélula 2 junto con doña Juana Sánchez Vázquez (artesana) y doña Pascuala Vázquez Montejo (artesana). Ambas con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilo al por mayor y así aumentar la producción.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA is 32 years old, married, with 6 children. Her husband works in the fields and she works making handicrafts, sewing tablecloths, napkins, and blouses, and then embroidering them. She sells them to the tourists who visit her community. She belongs to the solidarity group called Libelula 3, along with Ms. Hermegilda Gómez Pérez (artisan), Ms. María Vásquez Gómez (artisan), and Ms. Catalina Pérez Pérez (artisan). All of them plan to invest their loans in the purchase of material for the sewing of their products, and also thread for embroidering.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

JUANA, tiene 32 años, casada 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo y ella se dedica a la artesanía confeccionando manteles, servilletas, blusas y posteriormente las borda y las vende a los turistas que visitan su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Libelula 3 junto con doña Hermegilda Gómez Pérez (artesana), doña María Vásquez Gómez (artesana) y doña Catalina Pérez Pérez (artesana) Todas ellas esperan invertir sus prestamos comprando material para la confección de sus productos y también hilos de bordar.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
CATALINA is 33 years old and has four children. Her husband is a trader and he works selling fruits and vegetables in the city of Tuxtla Gutiérrez. She works buying blankets and making blouses, napkins, and tablecloths, which she then embroiders and sells in the city of San Cristóbal. She belong to the solidarity group Alaxa 3, along with Ms. Pascuala Hernández Vásquez (artisan), Ms. María Hernández Hernández (artisan), Ms. Cristina Pascuaza Montejo (artisan), and Ms. María Pérez Pérez (artisan). With the loan they will invest in their businesses, buying fabric and thread.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CATALINA, tiene 33 años, cuatro hijos, su esposo es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez. Ella se dedica a comprar manta y confecciona blusas, servilletas y manteles, luego los borda y sale a vender a la ciudad de San Cristóbal. Pertenece al grupo Alaxa 3 junto con doña Pascuala Hernández Vásquez (artesana), doña María Hernández Hernández(artesana) y doña Cristina Pascuaza Montejo (artesana) y doña María Pérez Pérez (artesana). Con el préstamo invertirán en sus negocios comprando géneros e hilos.

loans.use: HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
María Lourdes is head of her household. With a lot of effort and dedication she has been successful in moving her five children ahead. Four of them are now working on their own, leaving her daughter under her care, who helps her with the business.

She opened her restaurant at a site in a local market in Chinandega about five months, which she rents for $50. She started with little capital, a makeshift kitchen and two wood tables. Thank to a loan by CEPRODEL the place's infrastructure and working conditions have improved, and she has been able to purchase an adequate kitchen.

María Lourdes has her heart set on providing her children with everything within her reach. Before starting her own business, she trained people on cooking and pastry making. Currently, her restaurant makes an average of $110 per day.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

María Lourdes es jefa de familia; con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado impulsar a sus cinco hijos hacia adelante, ya cuatro de ellos trabajan quedando así solo una hija a su cargo, la cual le ayuda en su negocio.

El mismo nace en las instalaciones del mercado EL BISNE en el departamento de Chinandega hace aproximadamente 5 meses, local que alquila en US$50.00. Inicio con poco capital, apenas una cocina casera y dos mesas de madera. Gracias al crédito otorgado por CEPRODEL la infraestructura del lugar y las condiciones laborales han mejorado, ya que ha podido comprar una cocina adecuada para el negocio.

María Lourdes ha sido una mujer que ha puesto su empeño en darles a sus hijos todo lo que este a su alcance, anteriormente a su negocio propio se dedicaba a dar capacitación en el área de cocina y repostería. Actualmente ella vende diario un promedio de US$110.00

loans.use: Purchase equipment

loans.name: Luder

texts.en:
Business Description

Luder started this business 5 years ago. He sells dog food and poultry feed. He serves his clients daily from 8 AM to 8 PM

Loan Use

Luder needs this loan to invest in live poultry, poultry feed and other veterinary science products. This way he will be able to offer healthy chicks to his clients who raise poultry.

Personal Information

Luder is 33 years old and has 2 minor children, one of whom attends school. His wife is employeed at a mattress store. Luder started his business by borrowing from a private lender. He and his family live in his parents' home. He needs this loan to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Luder inicio su negocio hace 5 años. Los productos que ofrece son: Alimentos para aves y perros. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8-a.m.-a -8pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Luder necesita del préstamo para invertir en la compra de pollos, balanceados y otros productos veterinarios. De esta manera ofrecer los pollitos completamente sanos a sus clientes que se dedican a la cría de aves de corral.

Información Personal

Luder tiene 33 años. Tiene 2 hijos menores 1 esta estudiando .Su esposa trabaja como empleada en un almacén de colchones. Luder inicio con un capital solicitado a un prestamista. Vive en la casa de sus padres .Por lo que necesita del crédito para poder mejorar y acondicionar de mejor manera su local.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and other veterinary science products

loans.name: Reynaldo Salvador

texts.es:
Reynaldo is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example.

About 15 years ago, Reynaldo decided to start his own business selling cheese at the local market in Chinandega, which he did with $325 in start-up capital he saved from working in an auto body shop. Reynoldo's relationship with CEPRODEL has been fruitful for his business, allowing him to grow it and make improvements to the site. Currently he sells about $810 of goods each day. Thanks to his hard work and determination he has been able to purchase his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Reynaldo M. es un hombre esforzado que ha luchado para sostener a su familia y darles educación a sus hijos, los cuales hoy en día son hombres y mujeres trabajadores gracias al ejemplo de su padre.

Desde hace alrededor de quince años decide poner su propio negocio de venta de queso en el mercado EL BISNE ubicado en el departamento de Chinandega, el cual empieza con un capital de inversión US$325.00, mismos que venía ahorrando con mucho sacrificio cuando laboraba en un taller automotriz de pintura. La experiencia de Reynaldo con CEPRODEL ha sido fructífera para su negocio ya que ha logrado crecer y realizar mejoras en su local. Actualmente vende alrededor de US$810.00 diarios. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado comprar su casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Enrique Secundino

texts.es:
Enrique R. has dedicated almost half his life to his business selling footwear. It allowed him to get back on his feet after a heart-breaking experience when his first wife abandoned him, leaving him almost $20,000 in debt and almost bankrupting his business.

He has four children, all of whom have graduated from high school and are now in the work force. Before starting his own business he worked in the fields as a property and irrigation manager. With a lot of hard work he was able to purchase a store in the local market in Chinandega, and now he sells an average of $110 each day. He was been a partner with CEPRODEL for about 3½ years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Enrique R. ha dedicado casi la mitad de su vida en su negocio de los calzados. Le ha costado levantarse de un rompimiento emocional que lo llevo casi a la quiebra en su negocio, cuando la primera compañera de vida lo abandono dejándole una deuda de casi US$20,000.00.

Tiene cuatro hijos a los cuales les brindo educación primaria y secundaria, ahora ya son trabajadores. Antes de iniciar su negocio propio trabajaba en el campo como responsable de fincas y riego. Con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar sus módulos en el mercado EL BISNE en Chinandega, su venta promedio diaria es de US$110.00. Ha trabajado con CEPRODEL desde hace alrededor de 3½ años.

loans.use: Purchase supplies, overhaul inventory

loans.name: Juana Francis

texts.es:
Juana is a single mother of three. Being head of the household has not been easy, and she has had to work very hard to provide her children with an education. Her oldest son is working in Spain, leaving her take care of her grandson. Her middle child is studying at a university, and the youngest is in high school.

Twenty years ago Juana decided to start her own business in the local market after working previously for similar businesses. She began with only $30 of start-up capital and a small table, and now has five employees and a bigger store. She has been a partner with CEPRODEL for one year, which has allowed her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juana Francis es madre soltera de tres hijos. Su trabajo como jefa de familia no ha sido fácil ya que ha tenido que luchar y trabajar muy duro para darle educación a sus hijos. El mayor lo envío a trabajar a España haciéndose cargo ella de su nieto, el segundo de sus hijos lo tiene estudiando en la universidad y el tercero en secundaria.

Hace 20 años Juana Francis decide poner su negocio propio en el mercado EL BISNE tras laborar anteriormente en negocios similares. Empezó apenas con un capital de US$30.00 y una mesita pequeña, ahora cuenta con 5 trabajadores a su cargo y un amplio local. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año y su experiencia le ha permitido crecer.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, apart from being the owner of a business, is also a homemaker, a devoted mother, and a dedicated wife. She and her husband have two children, whom they have tried to help get ahead in life. Both children are currently in primary school.

Six years ago, Concepción had to give up being solely a homemaker and start her business in the EL BISNE market in Chinandega.

She began with $30.00 of capital and sold small things. She decided to start her business due to the necessity of defraying expenses and covering the needs that her husband’s salary couldn’t. Concepción now grosses approximately $80.00 per day. Thanks to CEPRODEL, she has been able to expand her store and buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Concepción es además de propietaria de su negocio, ama de casa, madre incondicional y esposa dedicada. Tiene dos hijos fruto de su matrimonio a los que en conjunto con su esposo han tratado de sacar adelante. Ambos hijos están cursando educación primaria.

Hace seis años Concepción tuvo que abandonar la vida únicamente de ama de casa e iniciar su negocio en el mercado EL BISNE en Chinandega.

Comenzó con un capital de U$30.00 vendiendo pequeñas cositas, la idea de poner su negocio surge debido a la necesidad de sufragar gastos y cubrir necesidades que el salario devengado por su esposo no cubría. Hoy en día Concepción vende aproximadamente U$80.00 diarios, gracias a CEPRODEL ha podido ampliar la infraestructura de su local y comprar mas mercadería.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and udate her inventory

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos is a single mother and the head of her household. She has dedicated her entire life to fighting for the survival and education of her six children. She has just one son still in her charge, and he is attending high school.

With much hard work, she was able to acquire her own house. She began her business 17 years ago with $50.00 of capital, selling soft drinks in the Santa Ana market of Chinandega. She now sells food in the EL BISNE market, with a daily average of $30.00 in sales.

CEPRODEL has been a great friend in the development of Santos’ business. She herself has recommended the institution to other merchants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos es madre soltera Jefa de familia, ha dedicado su vida entera a luchar por la sobrevivencia y educación de sus seis hijos. A la fecha solo tiene un hijo a su cargo el cual es estudiante de secundaria.

Con mucho esfuerzo logro adquirir su casa propia. Su negocio lo inicia hace 17 años vendiendo refrescos con un capital de US$50.00 en el mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega, actualmente vende comida en el mercado EL BISNE, con una venta promedio diaria de US$30.00.

CEPRODEL ha sido un amigo para el desarrollo del negocio de Santos, ella misma ha recomendado la institución a otros comerciantes.

loans.use: To buy products and raw materials

loans.name: Mariela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mariela de los Angeles is a hardworking woman who has labored from the time she was very young to give a dignified life to her four children. She has only has one child still in her charge, and he is student in primary school.

Her greatest pride is having helped her children become professional men and women, despite the difficult life she has had to endure.

Mariela started a small grocery store, in which she invested $55.00, approximately four years ago. However, thanks to her sacrifice and dedication, and the help of CEPRODEL, she has been able to expand her business and convert it into a small restaurant with daily sales totaling $40.00.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela de los Angeles es una mujer esforzada, que ha laborado desde muy joven para darle una vida digna a sus cuatro hijos. Hoy en dia solo tiene uno de sus hijos a su cargo, el cual es estudiante de primaria.

Su mayor orgullo es haber logrado hacer de sus hijos hombres y mujeres profesionales a pesar del nivel de vida dificil que la ha tocado sobrellevar.

Mariela comienza su negocio con una pequeña pulperia en la cual invierte US$55.00 hace aproximadamente 4 años, sin embargo gracias a su sacrificio, dedicacion y el apoyo de CEPRODEL, logro ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en una comideria en la cual vende diario US$40.00.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her restaurant
